Name: Rahman Creation
Review: Thank You ! Lg Company ,Very Easy Use Full This App And Controlling Fridge Cooling And Manage Temprature. I give Star More .

Name: Rayan AlFakhri
Review: 1- Can't find my TV 2- Won't let me connect my devices to Google Home due to country restrictions

Name: Fiv Asim
Review: A bad application, very limited options for a very bad appliance

Name: Shaun Attard
Review: Works great for my dishwasher and I never care where my TV remote went now that I can use my android to control everything

Name: Raquel Jenkins
Review: Clear instructions on how to fix the problem! Thank you.

Name: Attila Hunul
Review: I have some Error when I want to Connect to the LG TV invalid terms type for service

Name: Iinesh Reddy
Review: For A/C Turning ON/OFF based on room temperature is needed

Name: Dirk Wentink
Review: Bloatware which requires location access and phone access to upload a program to a washing machine. Utter garbage.

Name: Ab Ha
Review: LG needs so many years to develop stable and friendly uses app. Work one time only then never work even I tried several mobiles Very very bad apps. Useless.

Name: paul palmer
Review: All it does is crash on opening saying can't connect to server

Name: Saman Samikermani
Review: "Cannot run on a rooted device". Why?

Name: Shaun Tam
Review: Doesn't support my top loader which says it's got WiFi. Why would there be multiple apps?!

Name: Terri Fuller
Review: Great way to check on your laundry! Love it!

Name: Todd Hutchinson
Review: Works great, an app that does what it is supposed to do. Great job!

Name: Andrew Wang
Review: Cannot open . Force close after few second after latest update.

Name: Ron McNeely
Review: Awesome! Love knowing the status of the washer and dryer!

Name: Andrew Wright
Review: Frequently shows an error message.

Name: Dammala Kumar
Review: Smart App, very informative diagnosis and found the problem aptly

Name: Jaired Epps
Review: So far so good! It was easy to connect and everything is running great.

Name: Filip Noge
Review: Usefull and functional, but unnecessary permission needed.

Name: michael mcrae
Review: Fantastic especially when laundry is out of ear shot

Name: Suzelle Jansen van Rensburg
Review: Great to be able to diagnose and remote start

Name: Dan Garbar
Review: Great app. Very helpful and convenient!

Name: Bill Leeman
Review: Nice plus to excellent appliances. Allows me to keep track of laundry when away from laundry room.

Name: Michel Basmaji
Review: Why does this app need access to manage and make phone calls???

Name: Phillip Fannell
Review: A good place to start when troubleshooting your appliance.

Name: priscilla mcgee
Review: Confusing set up, but finally seems to work. Wish I could edit the settings for downloaded wash cycles

Name: Omar Azim
Review: Very nice application...It controls any LG appliances that hold LG ThinQ ...Thanks LG

Name: President Joker
Review: Wants access to my location, and to make phone calls both are not required for such... If LG wants to know my location it can just ask...

Name: Wilma Shelton
Review: It is easy to do easy to find what you need or want.

Name: Mark S
Review: Just starting to get used to the app with new washer. Seems to work well and is handy!

Name: –ú–µ—Ç–æ–¥–∏ –ü–µ—Ç–∫–æ–≤
Review: You can not edit washer/dryer program parameters. You can only choose from predefined programs and not able to create custom one.

Name: Sabu Varghese
Review: Easy to install and connect to the refrigerator

Name: Scott Rule
Review: Note: I use this app with the wall heating/cooling. Conceptually, this app is super helpful. It simplifies many if the actions that would typically require the physical remote. However, there are a number of things that I want to do quickly and easily that are clumsy. For example, the app shows the temp of each room but not it's current temp setting . For that I need to drill down one room at a time. When adjusting the temp, I can only tap the up/down buttons but want to type in the temp.

Name: Cristian Cadar
Review: my freezer got dumber and forgets settings after the upgrade.. thanks.. what is the point!

Name: Steve chavez
Review: Tag on will not connect to NFC on android phone useless for diagnosis

Name: Computer Zero
Review: See my review history The app only Adjust temp of fridge but not freezer. Turn on off hygiene Reports how many times door opened in your area. Update firmware. Provides diagnostics and stat to LG service. I have find out the hard way that LG is not standing behind own products. I received defective unit. No support from store, LG. LG collects personal info & equipment takes puctures and ignores the problem. Never see them again. That was 2nd product from lg and last. 1st LED TV needs 5 min

Name: Acie Miller
Review: Dryer disconnected from app, now it won't reconnect

Name: Chris LeBeau
Review: App has been fine with my Washer, Dryer and TV. Today I received a notification ad for 15% off laundry detergent. I'm not happy getting ads in my notifications. If this keeps up, I will uninstall the app. I pay enough for your products, I don't need to see ads in the app that supports those paid products, especially when those ads are in the form of notifications.

Name: Shawn Bell
Review: Works very well. Great reminder when you have a busy life. Reccomend for sure.

Name: Chester Balingit
Review: I can't link this to the google home. It gives an "Invalid terms type for service"

Name: John Valenzuela
Review: Contains ads. Already paid thousands of dollars for TV and appliances, now you push ads at me also? No way!

Name: Vytautas Babianskis
Review: Works perfectly on TV and washer Diagnostic

Name: Scott Christensen
Review: Really cool. I like this feature of my appliance a lot. Few improvements: Wish the fridge would show more details about previous days energy usage and # of times door left open too long. Wish the dryer would show actual kwh for each completed cycle instead of just electrical symbols. Same with the monthly chart, it doesn't show actual kwh in the chart, just a bar with no numbers. The washing machine won't connect for some reason. Got my other appliances to connect fine, but that one won't.

Name: Aaron Hall
Review: Works great for my dishwasher to monitor wash cycles.

Name: Rob X
Review: No polish (PL) characters, no Google Home integration (regional lock)

Name: Tonss Sedell
Review: Waste of time just to read fault codes via microphone. Should take 15 seconds, not 5 minutes. Asked for location and phone permissions for no reason at first, and only asked for microphone after 1st audio diag had already failed. Abyssmal. Good idea though. The washing machine functionality is excellent. Implementing this to a mobile application failed hard. 0/5.

Name: Douglas Wright
Review: Washer issue, helped diagnose, didn't give options for fixing.

Name: Chris Park
Review: Wifi works really good, laundry is cleaner and saves water too.

Name: Christin Adree
Review: Rather useless. The only thing I can do with this app is downloading a cycle and get a note that the machine has finished the job. None of the links work, when I need them. What I like to see in this app: 1) A page with a list of cycles. Thouch the cycle will start the machine. 2) A page with all options to configure the cycle of the day, with "save to cycles" option. A stard button ant the bottom. 3) Home page should list 3 buttons: A) "repeat last cycle" B) Start default cycle C) Time of star

Name: Abtin Shakouri
Review: No real opinion on app, but hate the Amazon advertisements. Didn't spend x amount on this for ads.

Name: Nick Bowes
Review: Great App. Love my new LG Appliances and TV

Name: E Santos
Review: Before I can change the settings thru my phone, now it's just diagnostics

Name: Jon Brooks
Review: The app still has bugs to work through for washer and dryer for example it does take a while for the remote access to trigger when it does trigger. What would also be a nice add to the app is there was the option to monitor the moisture sensor in the dryer that the user could trigger additional time or reset cycle or setting multiple cycles for a single load. I find large loads on very dry like comforters and blankets need an additional cycle with a sitting period so it doesn't burn sometimes.

Name: Shane Miles
Review: Permission requirements are far too intrusive. Requiring complete phone permission just to set the country is a massive invasion of privacy. Just ask me what country I want it set to.

Name: Liz Dyan Gonz√°lez Urrego
Review: It's fine but I would love to start my washer from work but it's not possible because the washer can't be on the hole day so o can't obtain contact to start the washer. And is useless just to use it at home from my phone

Name: Curt Whitney
Review: Won't let me sign in. Doesn't show in my installed progams.

Name: eirik wold
Review: Seems to work rsther well. However, it is a pitty that the 12hour format is standard. Should be able to use 24 hour format.

Name: Tracey Hansford
Review: Really useful app, helps diagnose issues

Name: Bruno Morgado
Review: One year later, LG still didn't solve the problems with the app, instead, they used their time to add unwanted Advertising to this app. Keeps breaking connection with Google Home, it's slow to connect, keeps losing connection with the AC units. It's a real mess, I am really sorry I went with LG for my AC instead of some other brand.

Name: Koda Cardoza
Review: The iOS app told me that NFC wasn't supported and that it only worked on Android, so I pulled out my Android device (OnePlus 6, up-to-date on Oxygen running Android 9; not exactly ancient AND has working NFC). Except this doesn't have the option to use NFC. It doesn't even mention NFC in the app when you're getting ready to add a device. Disappointed, and functionally useless for my non-WiFi dryer. It shouldn't be this difficult to access custom cycles.

Name: Juan Muzquiz
Review: The only thing I noticed about the latest update is more ads from Amazon. If it's working fine don't update, going to contact LG about getting a return on the product I bought because of this. I guess collecting my personal data wasn't enough, now I have to wait till all the ads load up before I can control my device.

Name: Doug Gaspar
Review: Hard to set up both washer and dryer then add another person to it. You start with the washer then when you get to the dryer you have to start over with a new app? Why? Once I got it I think it's great. Everything makes sense. Just sucks you have to set up the appliances to use the app. It's connected to WiFi already why do I need to do anything special? Girlfriend got frustrated and quit trying to set up the app

Name: Andrew Crooks
Review: Signing in with google does not work. Wifi is on, the internet is working, and the other sign in methods appear to at least ask for name and password. Signing in with Google does nothing though except very briefly dims the screen and then about 3 minites later it tells me it can't connect to the network.

Name: Lori W
Review: This app just spammed me in notifications to set up Auto Replenishment. I don't want Auto Replenishment. There is no way for me to turn off notifications without turning off the most important notifications of when the washer and dryer have completed their cycles. I don't want an app to notify me about ads they want to push. I don't want "offers" in the app either.

Name: Bro Pebo
Review: Since the latest bug fixes and the name change to ThinQ, it no longer works. It says my dryer is off, but I assure you that it is running. When it is actually off it says disconnected. It never says it's on anymore. Same for washer and dishwasher. Should have left it alone. Edited: After uninstalling the products and starting over they now show up again üò°. Now the washer is stuck in updating firmware.

Name: Zoelyn Choy
Review: Cant get any 'fantastic' remote functions started cos App hangs everytime when i tried downloading the top loader product info. I had turned off mobile data n connected to wifi, machine was on stdby mode. App does not work well on my husband's iphone, it can't get past set up stage. I'm using a note 9 so i assume new phone is supported. Lousy app with no tech support online so it's hard to troubleshoot. App shd allow selection of product using drop-down list instead of d/L product info wholesale

Name: Sean Jacquot
Review: very easy to use and extremely helpful

Name: Peter Toong
Review: Not user friendly. We cant remotely turn on the washer. What a shame !?!

Name: Aria Bashi
Review: It was fine before, did what it needed to do. Now after an update there are push notification ads that you can't remove. New permissions you can't remove for reasons that are flimsy. Need call information to set my time zone? But that setting is within the app. Unnecessary. One star.

Name: Paul Tracy
Review: This app gives you the option to start a load of clothes when your not home, let's say while you're at work or on vacation. The app doesn't load the clothes, it doesn't put detergent into the clothes it just starts the cycle and alerts you when it's finished via cell phone. How did I make it this far in life without this ability. It's not very useful for a washer dryer. It would be great for a robot -like a humanoid robot. You could give the robot instructions to whip up a batch of cookies.

Name: Brad Peter
Review: App is ok. We have a dishwasher, so there's not much to say other than cycle finished and add rinse aid. I just wish it would allow me to select which notices we receive. I don't care when the cycle finishes, but the rinse aid reminder is nice. Fix that and I'll update my review.

Name: Brian Doorenbos
Review: Terrible connection issues with Google assistant

Name: Takeuchi Kei
Review: This app cannot even let me configure the basics of my fh4g1jcs2 washer, only select preconfigured cycles. Unable to even change if I want steam or soil levels adjusted, or change temp. Not even saying that I want the chime off at night and there is no way to change that. Usually you would be able to do more with app than manually, this is just the other.

Name: Carey Child
Review: Helpful tools for usage and maintenance

Name: Nick Ebert
Review: If i could give 0 stars, that would not be low enough for this application. Complete and total junk from beginning to end. My brand new fridge slowed up damaged right out of the box and i hoped getting this app set up and working would get the bitter taste out of my mouth, boy was i wrong. Device repeatedly fails to connect at 80% making the one biggest selling point for this product a complete joke. Would not recommend LG products or apps to my worst enemy at this point.

Name: Harold Wolf
Review: Difficult to set up. No practical functionality with Alexa. It would be nice if the system allowed Alexa to broadcast notifications to its speakers. I revised my review to take into account that the recent washer firmware update appears to have eliminated the wifi disconnection issue..

Name: Ali Eff
Review: Working well so far for remote start and monitoring washes. Handy notification when wash is finished. Would be 5 stars if you could pause a wash for more than 15 mins, e.g. you get held up at work and want to pause for an hour but keep it occasionally turning, so clothes are not sitting around damp in the drum.

Name: Francisco Fernandez
Review: The app works fine. Unless you want to connect it with Google ...

Name: Cody Ganschow
Review: If I could give it negative stars I would. I cant even log into my account to see if this app will even help me. I am second owner of a house with washer and dryer and I'm having issues with the dryer. Of course I dont have purchase date and location. But I cant even log in to diagnose my washer

Name: Pamela Gonzalez
Review: It would be better if you would let me know when the washer is being turned on and when it is turning off as well. Sometimes it does sometimes it doesn't. Ok

Name: Peter Dierkes
Review: Permission to make phone calls? Permission to send Data to Amazon and other third parties? Permission to send and process data outside the EU? For an app to pop up a notification when the laundry is done? Seriously?

Name: A. Scholnick
Review: Needs more control options for NFC use.

Name: CC Barnes
Review: Why does this app need to share your personal data outside of the European economic area . If you don't agree to this You cannot use the app and I did not set up the app because of this.

Name: Terri Davis
Review: POS THAT Sucks been downloading for the last 22mins so I'm on my tablet watching the s#it i wanted to watch on MY TV SCREEN same experience on every available Lg app slow installation

Name: Bob Salita
Review: Poor WiFi installation for LG washer and dryer. The app's SSID and documentation doesn't match actual. You have to look at WiFi access points and manually select dryer's SSID. WiFi password is double of last four hex digits -- e.g. 05FE05FE. Go back into app and hope it connects.

Name: Yolanda Yollie
Review: Just got this recently, but I wasnt able to connect and remote the washing machine...

Name: Mohd Saifulnizam
Review: Nice.. need to improve more on intelligent mode or download cycle

Name: Tyler Deitz
Review: I'm not really satisfied with the app. Essentially it's a notification tool that tells me when my laundry's done. You need to make this more app friendly. Have options. Where hey I left clothes in my dryer let me start a wrinkle free cycle. There many different things that you can do to prove this app. Email me. We can chat and I show you innovation.

Name: Karthik Kumar S
Review: Good! But could be better than this! Overall the app experience is good. But I'm only using it with the Washer. It's good that only after enabling "Remote Start" manually from the machine, it can be controlled remotely. Not sure if LG could override this too remotely. It would be helpful to know the power consumption in Watts rather than as a symbol. Real time product based widget could be more helpful. Server maintainence could be known only after opening the app. Could use push notifications.

Name: Viru Jadhav
Review: I am using it for Air conditioner. Energy Saving Mode is not given. Temperature adjustment is required for scheduling which is not given. Swing can't be shifted from 1 to directly 6th or required positions. Lot can be improved.

Name: H Wong
Review: Can't turn on dryer with this app rendering it useless. Sometimes I want to add drying time once the dryer is finished but it automatically turns off and you can't turn it back on with the app. LG IF YOU'RE READING THIS PLEASE FIX THIS AND UPDATE THIS APP!

Name: Thomas Eddy
Review: Just stupid "Ok Google ask lg to..... Ect ect‚Äù Why add the extra steps?!? Just causes issues, sometimes it doesn't work when Google can't talk to lg. Every other manufacture integrates better Google. I want Google to directly talk to the tv, not via lg servers.

Name: Vincent Forcino-Poquette
Review: Poor excuse for an app. Always saying canceled cause unit did not respond. Try to set a repeat schedule for ac times and regardless of the times you selected it changes it and selects the time it wants. Ex. Set it to turn on at 7:30am and shut off at 4:30pm. It changes it to 8:30 to 5:30. No matter how many times I try to change it. And if I try to select a different time, it changes it to another completely different time. Garbage app waste of space on my phone.

Name: Johnny Westgate
Review: Meh. It covers the basics. It's slow to update the status of appliances, usually telling me they're offline first. Needs explanations of cycles. Is Bedding heavy blankets and duvets? Or is it sheets and pillowcases? Push notifications don't expand to show additional information, like the time it was sent, so you can't know if that note is for a new end of cycle or from one 2 hours ago that you forgot to dismiss. And I want to be able to set a clock start time since we pay time of use hydro.

Name: Chad Grashel
Review: Push notifications sometimes work but most of the time do not. Everything was great until updates were made back in the early spring and LG can't get it right. Adding this. Why does LG need access to photos, media files, and call history? You can't upload anything to their app. It looks like data collection. If you have an issue, you have to call, email, and upload docs outside of the app. Reviewing cycle settings makes no sense. Simply, this is not a user-friendly app.

Name: P M
Review: Didn't work. Twice I've been hit with a wall of water because I opened the door of my washer dryer combo and it had been filling all night even though the machine was off. The SmartThinQ could not find a problem, even though I ran the diagnostic three times. And of course we're less than a month past the one-year warranty date. Very unhappy with my machine and with this app. The app also doesn't identify the correct buttons to push. I had to figure it out.

Name: Eyal Sadeh
Review: Can't connect to Google home in Israel

Name: Kelly Lee
Review: Basically all this app seems to be good for telling me the time left in the cycle and notifying me when my laundry loads are done. It looks like I should be able to do much more with this app, like remotely operate my washer and dryer, selecting the cycle and etc, but neither my machine manuals, nor this app seem to have instructions on how I can use these features.

Name: Mark McLellan
Review: Set up on my S9 plus was quite difficult to be honest. I ended up using a tablet that I had. Once set up though using the tablet I log into my phone and calls fine. Loving the app and my smart washing machine so far.

Name: Dan Lipsa
Review: Has nice description for error codes

Name: Tezza Tucker
Review: Never works. TV is connected and on the same network as my phone. It worked one time only and that was it. Had this problem since end of May this year. So glad my main TV is a Samsung. LG would be better off stop trying to make TVs and concentrate on phones. My LG TV is nowhere near as good as my Samsung Qled. Actually not on the same continent. Get it together devs and make the damn thing work for a change.

Name: Gary Blouin
Review: Created account online. Downloaded app.Says can't find account. Created account on app. Sent email to verify my email address. Did not receive - several times. Troubleshooting: Check spam folder. I checked ... nothing there. Second step: use another email address. I ONLY HAVE ONE! Really, you want me to create another email address just for LG?

Name: Tim Kronebusch
Review: I have a new washer (WM3900HWA) and dryer pair and the washer does not hold it's connection within the app. I have excellent WiFi signal and speed. The dryer stays connected no problem. But the washer shows as "disconnected" when it's on and running every few days. It defeats the purpose of the app to see your cycle times when it is unavailable half the time. I've deleted and reset everything. THIS IS A KNOWN ISSUE ON LG WEBSITE COMMENT FORUM. FIX THE SOFTWARE BUG ALREADY LG!!! IT'S BEEN MONTHS!

Name: Phil Wells
Review: The app itself seems OK. I dont like that the WiFi shuts off on my oven and dryer when they are done. This means I cant tell them to run a little longer. Overall, though, in a big house, I like being able to know when my microwave dinner or laundry load is done. The ability to remote control these appliances isnt as useful because u have to go to them to "load" them in the 1st place. But u CAN put something in the oven and then start it cooking no matter where u are so it's done when u get home.

Name: Devon Wagner
Review: This app does not function well, if you're lucky, and does not function at all, if you're like me. Although the air conditioner that I installed the app for works well, the app is extremely slow and frequently shows my air conditioner as disconnected. If it actually says connected (rare), the majority of the time when I try to input a command to my air conditioner it says it timed out due to a long response time. Internet is 250mb download and 50mb upload (plenty fast enough).

Name: Bill Vestal
Review: You have to plan ahead to use remotely, if you forget to start a load you cant start it remotely unless you specifically enable remote start - which only lasts for one cycle. Washer keeps disconnecting from wifi and requires unplugging it to get it to connect again. Spoke to several people in Support and is of absolutely no help. They keep trying to blame my wifi even though I have 30 other devices with ZERO problems. It's like they don't even bother to test this stuff before they release it.

Name: Free to be ADHD
Review: My dryer is on and connected, but the app refuses to see when the appliance is actually on. Drier is running fine now: on, wifi light on, but the app says it's off. Tells me I need to turn it on to do anything. *facepalm* The app worked for a day. Now won't work. I reset the phone, uninstalled and reinstalled, still "off." Fix this bug. I liked getting a notification when the laundry was done. . Day 2 of asking this get resolved.

Name: Gregory Miller
Review: All in all, it's marginally useful at best. Even though I've run the cleaning cycle on both of our ovens, I still get regular reminders to clean them both. Our refrigerator won't stay online and now won't even connect with the app. Our dishwasher randomly decides to error out, mid cycle, and the app is useless at telling me what is wrong, even when I try to use the diagnostic features. All in all, it's pretty much a failure for our kitchen appliances.

Name: David Karczewski
Review: Works great for trouble shooting.

Name: Allen Guy
Review: Very helpful it sent me straight to the problem.

Name: Mihael Horvatek
Review: After the update the app asks for login (I go through Google account) almost every time I start it, usually after wash end notification! Discovery/status of the washer is a little slow to check but OK. I like how the washer is not always online and goes off when done, the best security measure for IoT devices! Also one less thing for kids to fiddle with.

Name: Rados≈Çaw Burny
Review: App works OK, though it's a bit slow. But I cannot connect the AC to Google Assistant, because "the service is not supported in Poland". What's the point of these ridiculous, arbitrary restrictions? If the functionality is there, why block people from using it based on the country they live in?

Name: Corina Bugan
Review: I have a washer-dryer unit. It seems completely illogical that I can't modify the options for a program (temperature, spin etc.) from my phone before starting the program. I can only do that manually, from the machine's touchscreen. On the app every option is grayed out. I hope it is a bug and that it will be fixed. After that, I will change my rating.

Name: Sam Pickard
Review: Pretty terrible app. No quick way to make the normal changes one would expect. It has a "modes" section which looks like it's supposed to let you jump between common settings but it doesn't work. There is no help out documentation so maybe I'm just doing it wrong but there's no way to know. The connection to Google Assistant is nice but very basic. Certain features seem to be inaccessible via voice commands.

Name: Xhilia JP
Review: worked fine untill today. maybe using the remote after turning it on with my phone app messes it up? it usually worked dine both ways but not today.it says my airconditioner is disconnected and when I try to reconnect it to wifi (holding mode+fan speed) it says "please wait" forever. UPDATE: ok I think by holding 5 sec on the remote control's "clear" button, it allowed me to input the wifi password again and it is now connected. Update 2: ok it disconnected again a few days later. please fix it

Name: Vincent Sabio
Review: Getting the washer and dryer set up on the WiFi is tricky, and the app has no IFTTT integration/capability. For the custom cycles, you have to pick from the custom cycles that LG has set up; you don't get to create your own cycle, even if it's pretty basic.On the positive side, the app is good about letting you know when a cycle completes.

Name: Tyler Chiocchio
Review: I'm constantly getting a "can't connect to server" error when I open the and then it auto closes. However, I'm still getting updates on when my clothes are done. Only passively usable.

Name: Ivan Chwalik
Review: I love the fact that when using this with my TV, it doesn't pull up the keyboard within the app so I can type. This isn't convenient, actually makes things harder!!

Name: Nick Vak
Review: Useful app to diagnose issues.

Name: Lohan Makaum
Review: This app is unabke to connect with my washer. Customer service is very poor and unhelpful.

Name: John R Schleigh IV
Review: Reasonably good app. The features presented are specific to each appliance. Some appliances have more features and controls in the app than others. This makes sense and I find the app useful. My only complaint is that push notifications come through whether I disable them or not. I really don't need to know each time the oven is on and off.

Name: Jim Lutz
Review: Set up my wall mounted air conditioner (heat pump) in about a minute. The app doesn't have all the functions of the unit's remote, but has the important ones, temperature, fan speed/swing, jet mode, as well as being able to set timers. A bit of lag compared to using the remote.

Name: Emily Faith
Review: Using app for remotely operating lg washing machine. Easy set up and no problems so far. Definitely convenient for getting one more load of laundry done during the day and also downloading more wash cycles, like pet hair and odor to get our pet blankets really clean!

Name: Matthew Peck
Review: App is worthless. Can't get my smart oven to connect to my wireless. One of the reasons I bought this appliance and they can't get the software to work. Stop trying to do everything for me and just give me an "Advanced" mode where I can type my wifi info in!!! Not hard and works in numerous other instances. ALSO, the app permissions are not necessary. If all you want to do is confirm location, ask me. Otherwise, stay out of my private life!

Name: Michelle ishappy
Review: I really like this app. It tells me that IcePlus is on or off (I can turn it on or off in the app too). It just told me one of the fridge doors was not closed. I am in another room, so I went in to fix that. It tells me the status of the water filter, which is wonderful. I do wish its name started with LG so it'd be easier to find in my app library.

Name: Jake Rau
Review: Requires password every time it updates.

Name: Gail Hix
Review: Unclear on searches using specific words ....

Name: Carson Rothrock
Review: Useless app that doesn't connect to anything.

Name: Kenneth Richardson
Review: first it said it was registered successfully, now it says it's not. nothing I do will get it to connect. I've read all the other reviews and I wish I could review the app, but I'm stuck at just trying to register. not good. UPDATE: Once I finally got it installed I appreciate being notified when a cycle completes. That's really all I use it for, so far.

Name: Gregory Belsher
Review: complicated app. Most things need you to go to the washing machine so what's the use of the app? At least remort start should be switched on from the app itself. Lots of improvement needed.

Name: Gordon Pettey
Review: Why in the hell does this app refuse to run without location and *phone call* permissions? All you need to do is communicate on the local Wi-Fi or Bluetooth. Stop trying to be spyware. Your response that "each permission is necessary" is a poor attempt to dodge the issue. I'll just return the appliance I paid hundreds of dollars for and go with some other vendor who actually has a clue how to develop privacy-respecting apps.

Name: Shrikant Soni
Review: I use this for the WiFi enabled ACs, and it seems to work pretty seamlessly. Changing the temperature or the modes from this app is super easy and the AC tends to respond within 2 seconds. With all the ACs WiFi enabled in the house, I can control them from sitting anywhere in the world. The energy monitoring feature is great, allows you to see the consumption over the day / week / month. If only they could show past months data too that would be good.

Name: Gentatsu Sakakibara
Review: With my AC, I can't schedule it properly, the time keeps shifting when I turn it off and on, I can't do a temperature range of when to turn on and off, it keeps putting the fan on high when ever I turn it on from the app and or switching modes. I'm giving this a 2 star only because I have some options but as an app, this is terrible. If I had known all these bugs were available, I would have not purchased LG smart products. Update: Oct 10, new update is now constantly crashing my ac app.

Name: Aaron Nath
Review: Need some development in the apps store there is missing jio tv and apple TV and in the apps and there is no voice search option like Google assistant and not understand all commends in the remote voice search...otherwise great experience best 4k experience and best sounds and cute looking remote...

Name: yousef shah
Review: Not working , so sad it came update while I'm travelling for one month planned to buy LG air conditioning Wi-Fi so I can control it from abroad. Was working perfectly until update , nw I can't access the air conditioning 2 of them & cost a lot to buy each , all time i am trying to use the application,it says it's disconnected!!!! I check my electric and my Wi-Fi router all working perfectly except the devices . I'm 7000 miles from home and by end of month the house will be so hot and can dist

Name: James Herpel
Review: Good app feels almost pointless for washer and dryer. You cannot remote start unless you press the control remotely on washer and dryer first and then after each cycle it resets and powers off you can't even turn on the power remotely. You can power off remotely. It is really nice to get end of cycle notifications for both.

Name: Allison Barrett
Review: Use this app for an LG window AC unit. It used to be great. Now scheduling feature doesn't function at all because of a bug in their update. Have contacted LG multiple times, they don't care. Definitely don't buy this AC unit if you plan to use the app, you'll be disappointed.

Name: Robert Kennedy
Review: Bro, this friggin app kept me from configuring the machines at the same time. A bug in the code only allows you to configure one machine at a time, which is to say, if my dryer is on and configured, my washer cant be configured, which is patently ridiculous. Please fix and I'll throw the five star.

Name: Stephen Pare
Review: Cant even get the app to connect to a new washer. All they do is blame my internet. I speedtest and try to connect with 3 different devices right next to the washing machine. All test at over 100mbps. And washing machine show its connected to my wifi when I use my Xfinity app. So it connects to my internet just fine but wont connect to the app and they say it's not their fault? Just shows they dont care Was on phone for 2 hours. Was told their head tech would call me in 48 hours. Still waiting!

Name: Dead Spector
Review: I connected my washer and dryer every time I click on the dryer. The app saying the dryer is not connected to the network or it's off but clearly connected lt shows how much time I have left.

Name: Strahinja Kustudic
Review: Cannot change Wi-Fi network on my Air Conditioner. I have three PM12SP air conditioners and I wanted to change the Wi-Fi on all three of them. I managed to change the Wi-Fi a few months ago, but now it doesn't work. Just tells me that it didn't manage to do it. I can see that it connected to the LG wifi network during the operation, wifi icon on the air conditioner stops blinking and just lights, but all stays like that and in the end the app tells me that it didn't manage to do it.

Name: Andrea Vega
Review: Terrible experience! Can't turn on the washing machine/dryer remotely, can't customize the cycles, can't link it to my google assistant, can't add users to manage the machine. Basically, all this app can do is, notifying when a cycle is finished. Just feels like this app is pointless, very frustrating, I was expecting better from LG.

Name: Brandon Ainsworth
Review: Slow and simplistic. Doesn't give you much info and doesn't let you change most individual cycle settings. Cannot use Android adaptive battery optimization or you don't get the alerts until the next time you unlock your phone. I would like more details on the appliance, like the MAC for the WiFi adapter

Name: Allen R Grodsky
Review: It was working great. I really liked it. However, the app was updated last week and no longer works. Very frustrating, and annoying. I cannot find any support contact for the not so SmartThinQ app. I have a few other LG devices, but if this is an indication of how LG supports its products I may stop using LG.

Name: Michael Nguyen
Review: Won't get past account creation because keeps saying won't comply with terms, but doesn't explain specifics. Update to LG software team response: I have never rooted my Google pixel 1, running whatever updates Google pushes out.

Name: Michael Ayers
Review: This is so frustrating. LG needs to start over and completely re-think this whole user experience.

Name: Romanticsman
Review: Either the wifi card and/or the firmware of the AC unit is buggy, or this app is, or both. Today I spent hours trying to re-connect it to wifi and for no logical reason it finally connected! The schedule function keeps moving a start and stop time one hour forward every time I turn it on or off. The temp is still being reset to 16C everytime I change cooling modes with the app from cool to energy saver and vice versa. Terribly buggy and it seems like the app, because it worked after a re-install.

Name: Jaclyn Pytel
Review: I love the app when it works. Occassionally it will say that my washer machine is "disconnected" when I'm standing next to the machine with a full wifi signal. Other than that, it's a great app especially with our laundry facilities on a different level of the home.

Name: Jay Cee Turner
Review: This is my first smart large appliance. I love it. Plus, the clothes come out super clean. I wish I could store more downloads on the washer itself. But, having the app is the next best thing.

Name: Robbie Fern
Review: Amazing app helps with infomation of all LGs amazing products

Name: OobiesGaming
Review: You pay $1700 for a dryer that takes 2 cycles to dry your clothes, and then need an account to be able to even try to create a setup to make it dry in one cycle. If I'd known I would need to screw around with it this much I would of bought a $500 dryer from a differant company.

Name: James Caperelli III
Review: Very convenient. Disconnected twice for an unknown reason, but so far ok. Now it is 10/28/19 and time for an update... The app almost always shows the washer as disconnected while the the dryer status is rock solid. Washer always indicates connected to wifi on the front panel, but rarely is connected to the app. Major disappointment. Lowering my rating.

Name: Ryan Payne
Review: Great smart diagnosis app. When a machine is showing a code, you hold your phone to it and it will tell you what is wrong plus give you tips to fix the issue. Also, you can download new cycles to the machines and create your own cycles to download. Pretty cool!

Name: jaimin rao
Review: OK as a stand-alone app. Does NOT allow my fully supported and new LG TV to connect to Google Home (I am UK based). App shows up but does not link. Functionality clearly has not been tested and TV is being sold with false advertising. It has options that suggest it should work with Google home via Smarthinq but hasn't been tried/tested prior to release of app.

Name: M√§rten T√µnissoo
Review: Again with some stupid login. Dont want to create a new login or provide you with my google data. Just let me diagnose my washing machine without forcing loging in! Also you need access to my contacts, gps, sd card data etc ....even malware does not want that much permission...stop updating your app with bloatware and remove restrictions if i dont give you all my data!

Name: Charles Sownder
Review: Great App, I can control my LG ecosystem, I can control using my google mini.. which is definitely a great experience. I don't see the option to connect my TV to be controlled from Google mini and I can't turn on my TV using this app otherwise this app is an awesome app I'm loving it.. I use it and this makes me feel like I'm smart and I'm in a smart home.. thank you for the one who created this app. I appreciate it. But due to few bug's like what I mentioned above, I gave 4 stars.. otherwise 5.

Name: Sandip Varma
Review: I am havi LG freez. From last few days it's not cooling. I have tried this app several times. Test result shows refrigerator is working fine. Cooling absolutely normal. So funny.

Name: nancy muehl
Review: Took a few attempts to sync washer/dryer. Seems to be working well. Have only had the set a week. Would be nice to be able to set a time when using remote start.

Name: Jakub ≈†tetina
Review: 1/ App is too slow and still loading; 2/ CZ IS OK NOW ; 3/ "ENERGY MONITORING" IS BETTER, NOW IT IS NOT ONLY CYCLE COUNTER, but i do not know what energy - kW/kWh/litres/??? 4/ not possible to set or change program after it is set to remote start.. app is only starter of the cycle + I use it only for notification of finished cycle

Name: Vishesh Narula
Review: In app store, name is LG ThinQ. But once downloaded it's call ThinQ. Why no LG? The UI for the AC remote function is not good. It mimic a normal remote which is not so smart. You have to click each time to increase/decrease temp by one at a time. Should allow user to scroll temp and fan speed then execute. Also, unlike the physical remote it lacks full fan speed control as it only have low/med/high which is 1/3/5 fan speed. It's missing 2 & 4 fan speed. Option to save preferences would be nice.

Name: Courtney Times
Review: Its conveniently useful when you're away from the home or at home completing other task. Knowing a cycle is complete and you when its available to start another load of laundry is awesome.

Name: Vincent Chan
Review: I found that the TV only connect to 2.4 GHz WiFi network. I will require to open the app and connect to my TV then I will be able to control my TV but not when my phone connect to 5 GHz WiFi network. I have Google Mesh and it will do auto switch between 2.4 and 5 GHz network. My other products are on 2.4 GHz and while my phone is on 5 GHz but I have no problem to find those. My is LG OLED C8 model. It is new enough to have 5GHz WiFi built-in. Correct me if I am wrong.

Name: Saurabh A
Review: Lot of wifi connectivity issue, sometimes it show.my washing machine connected, sometimes it doesn't. Also the download wash cycles should get permanently stored in the machine rather than a need to download Everytime. These downloaded wash cycles should show up on the app and we should be able to just select one of those cycles once downloaded and start the wash program.

Name: John Hu√¢n V≈©
Review: What is the point of using this app aside from monitoring it? You can't even configure or change the settings! If I'm able to schedule my dishwasher and change the settings, then this application will be more powerful. This is why I'm uninstalling it.

Name: Lachie Death
Review: Instability, latest update won't allow download cycles, slow to respond to commands or it says no network connection or the machine is disconnected. This app needs work

Name: Zaine Karim
Review: App works great, only down side is that my appliances work on 2.4 GHz and does not work with my Orbi for some reason. Managed to sort it out with a 2.5ghz extender.

Name: Sentilong Jamir
Review: Excellent app to diagnose my refrigerator

Name: Fotios Malliaris
Review: The time left plus the notification when finished is awesome

Name: Luka Koprivica
Review: I see that LG doesn't read this!!! Reminder for tub cleaning should be persistent! Until done, not just once!!! Great to have option that it offers, but many could be added, eg switching the sound off! Why with all that functionality such a small, and very useful little commodity, was ommited?

Name: Amenofhis
Review: doesn't have compatibility with my portable air conditioner. don't know why it has the smartthinq logo on my air conditioner is a R410a i've tried everything and the official webpage doesn't have anything about the product still it is a lg product. i saw videos with the portable ac option but in this new app version i don't see it. fix that please. 23/08/19 I haven't receive any news about the AC and it still doesn't connect to WiFi and I send all the info requested not even a reply than you.

Name: Micheal B.
Review: How do I turn off the stupid advertising that came with your latest update? I didn't buy LG to get an ad every 3 seconds scrolling across my phone screen! Why can you not turn Bluetooth back off after you enable it for no apparent reason? Your programmers suck!

Name: Thomas Janney
Review: Great App! Has a great experience.

Name: John McCabe
Review: App works well, especially when kids claim they turned the tv off before going out or bed etc But really need an option to not allow app to start Bluetooth, or unable to control, at least have the app switch Bluetooth back off when existing the app (unless another app is already using the protocol)

Name: James Conzett
Review: Rediculious. A.C. unit schedule function refuses to save. Try to turn off at 1am and on at 6am or any other times the app changes the unedited time by an hour and saves the edited time to whatever but NEVER what you enter. After several attempts I gave up. The app WILL NOT SAVE SCHEDULE TIMES THAT YOU ENTER. Absolutely a waste of time and effort setting up. WORTHLESS.

Name: Rajath raju
Review: More service regarding information is needed in app

Name: Darko Sarenac
Review: This has been happening for years now. What part of "you are asking for a too liberal set of permissions for what you provide" do you not understand. Half the time or actually almost always it is impossible to get even the.basic.functionality on this piece work.

Name: Marc D
Review: Why would an app for the range need to make calls, need my location or an account to use. LG needs to reevaluate its privacy policy. As we all become more enlightened with how corporations are selling every tidbit of information they collect, they risk alienating consumers. Count me as one. The app has been uninstalled & I'm regretting choosing LG.

Name: Yeshaya Kraus
Review: This app gets worse and worse with each update. My AC can't use mechanical timers, so I was excited to see that there's a wifi option. First the timer function kept randomly changing to hours off of what I set it to, now I can't even see the interface. The user interface is just messed up. I wish they would fix it so I can make it actually work.

Name: Dave Leyton
Review: Used to work perfectly for air con. Since last update just get error "server failed to connect. No response from server. Try again later"

Name: Michael Spliedt
Review: Overall a good way to monitor the progress of my wt7900 and dlex7900. It lacks the ability to modify way cycles such as soak or extra rinse, so it's usefulness as a remote start is somewhat limited. The additional cycles to download from the catalog work very well.

Name: Anna Johnson
Review: I absolutely love this app. Half the time I forget that I have started laundry, but with the app it sending me a message that clothes are either finished in the wash or dryer. Also I can start the washer or dryer using the app. After using this I want all my appliances to have this feature.

Name: Jason Sylvester
Review: Great fridge very user friendly

Name: D RG
Review: I am at a loss. What is this app for? The 'tag on' instructions and choices are not the same listed in the manual. The manual says LG Smart Laundry. App looks like a 6 year old wrote it. Does nothing. When I tap to the washer like the instructions say. It syncs and downloads. But what does that do?. Nothing!

Name: Henry Chinery
Review: Used to work okay but now won't let me sign in despite letting me sign in on the website, resetting the password. Then it tells me I have tried too many times and to sign in via email link which , of course, also doesn't work.

Name: fnaf boy nightmare A
Review: I didn't care if I had wifi at first but I am now in love with this capability now. The app is very convenient when I'm busy as heck. I'm not wasting time running up and down 2 or 3 flights of stairs just to see if it's done yet. Love it!!

Name: SBTRIS
Review: Needs odd permissions, needs consent to ship your data abroad outside-eea, and then it fails to connect to the fridge. Also constantly shows ads for Amazon dash which doesn't exist anymore?

Name: Laila
Review: I have a very bad habit of leaving stuff in the washer and dryer much to my husbands annoyance. That's stopped since we upgraded our machines and I've been able to use the app. The only thing I don't like is my phone does not have NFC so I'm missing out on some of the functions but it's still a very useful app.

Name: Patrick Wall
Review: Glitchy!!! I've tried several times to set a schedule for on at 7am and off at 8pm. It won't lock in my time but makes up 2 separate on and off times. Currently, it's stuck at 8am and 10pm, and this is through the app.

Name: tlcsmith426 1
Review: App performs okay At first before patest update it would read that a door was left open on our refridgerator after one of us got the milk out or something as simple as that causing us to worry if we bought a malfuntioning unit But since update says more info like fan evap coil ,motor and such with check marks Hopefully one of those components malfunctions it will let us know

Name: Chris Riddin
Review: Only information is temperature and diagnosis for fridge/freezer. What about door opening, power usage etc. Not able to switch off automatic Bluetooth connection

Name: Tristan Griffiths
Review: Just brought the new signature fridge freezer and thought I was a good idea have the app connect to our fridge freezer..only to find no matter how hard I try to connect to it nothing seems to work..keeps saying failed connection..WiFi has no internet connection. TERRIBLE APP

Name: AC Breeze
Review: Works well when it syncs with the air conditioning equipment, just a little bit slow to sync compared to other smart home apps like Hive and my cctv system. My company have installed many of the air conditioning units and its the same at all the other one's I set up. Just a bit slow to sync. Would be 5 star's if a bit quicker.

Name: erin walick
Review: When will this app reconnect to the server again!? Cool concept but not if I can never use it or add more appliances to it. Please fix!

Name: Tony Li
Review: Useful app but I don`r like that you can only use the app on the same wifi to control/access your appliance remotely like the washet/dryet when you are away from home.

Name: Mint flow
Review: Doesn't work with Alexa which is very disappointing and unclear controls on how to remove the remote from the screen when not using it.

Name: Gary Maxwell
Review: Easy to use and understand.

Name: M. G.
Review: Still sucks! And total BS response from the devs. Why can't i turn off Locstion and media access to the app after initial run?. You don't need that ongoing unless you are stealing data!

Name: Daniel Moses
Review: App updated 2 days ago and now today it won't open, says "Cannot run on rooted device". My phone is not rooted! Fix your app! No IFTTT Support, Alexa integration is worthless! I'm about to take this washer and dryer back and get Samsung.

Name: Daniel Enriquez
Review: Why is it not working anymore? I bought LG because of the convenience of remote control thru wifi. Now app always says Server Not Found. It used to work smoothly for a few weeks only. Please fix! Disappointing and not convenient anymore.

Name: Steve G
Review: I've the latest SmartThinQ update installed and the Normal and Download cycle options both deny me the ability to change the wash temperature (for cycle Downloads all changes are denied). Modern detergents claim they work equally well at lower temperatures with reduced energy costs and less environmental detriment. Also your default of 40c is too hot for most woollens!! So in SmartThinQ why do I not have the option to choose a lower temperature? Please can you answer my question LG?

Name: Chuck Huggins
Review: Annoying app. I dont mind the in app ads, but the notifications for these ads, that you can't turn, off is uncalled for. Now I have to turn all notifications off when not doing laundry to prevent the interruptions. Plus why in the world do I need a history of the washer/dryer usage?

Name: Paul Dublin
Review: I have had to use this twice to fix a loud fan noise and both times it diagnoses and fixed the issue instantly. Love this app.

Name: James Stevens
Review: works after a lot of effort.

Name: Doug Ryder
Review: It tells me when the clothes are done yet somehow I have done laundry without this feature for years

Name: Pari Chit
Review: 1.It can't be used unless you to turn on the machine and click on a button in the panel, which will later pair up with the phone and starts to work 2. Wash cycles can't be customised Only benefit is, it'll notify once the wash is over!

Name: Contact Oztrained
Review: R9 Master needs My Zone maps that can be edited as hallways and bedrooms are seen as one space and I want them independently selectable for cleaning. No areas in My Zone (Do not clean) can be selected. Since latest ThinQ update start and finish times in Cleaning Diary are out by 1 hour e.g. shows 7:30am instead of 8:30am. Time in Notifications is correct i.e. it will show 8:30am

Name: Jeffrey Monarch
Review: I like the notifications when a load is done but I wish I could use the remote controls without having to turn it on manually each time.

Name: Joe Seagle
Review: Spent extra to get the "smart" oven to preheat from work so it's ready when I get home. Only to find out to preheat via the phone I literally have to press a button on the oven and open the oven door to grant access to the phone to select preheating. I may as well just preheat it myself instead of going through those steps. What's the point of advertising this feature if you need to be there in person to operate the oven just to turn it on with my phone? So misleading. SUPER disappointed.

Name: Fernando B
Review: this app works good the only thing it needs to have 5 stars is to have the option to turn off the display light on my AC, the remote control has it so I don't think it would be difficult to have it in the App.

Name: Max Stoaks
Review: Useless. In order to add appliances you have to login to your LG account. It does not recognize my LG account even after verifying via desktop and resetting pw. Part of the reason we bought these units was for programmability... Which has to be through the broken app.

Name: Fahad Alabdulkarim
Review: Update 9/5/2019 Nice edit screen added moved to 3 starts we need costume mores now please and direct wifi connection for faster response lots of missing feature we need more customizable modes to controlore that one AC at once. UI IS VERY BAD update. still missing custom mods and widget also an option to organize the ac location in the UI to sort by name or custom order.

Name: Asa Scotts
Review: Now everytime I restart my phone my custom sounds for the apps notifications are set back to the apps default sound of 121090 (whatever that is) . No other app I have custom sounds assigned has this problem. Must be something with the apps initialization sequence. Very frustrating.

Name: Jake Lambert
Review: You cannot use it unless you allow LG to track your location and have access to operate and configure your telephone, including "make calls". It is a shame because the app, without the extremely intrusive permissions, is quite nice.

Name: Karan Hoondlani
Review: Good to track status of your LG appliance...I use it for my dishwasher. But wish you could do more like - schedule a delayed run, turn on night dry option, etc. At present it gives me real time data on the dishwasher run status which is good, don't get me wrong. But maybe I expect more!

Name: Matthew Wyen
Review: "SERVER CANNOT CONNECT"

Name: ÿ±ŸäŸáÿßŸÖ ÿ£ÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿπÿ®ÿØ ÿßŸÑŸàŸáÿßÿ®
Review: Wow awesome application am very happy it works with me

Name: Mourad Larif
Review: Limited features. I have a washer and dryer. I cannot start a laundry load directly from the app. It has to be done on the machine asks them remotely started. Also the notifications are not working all the time.

Name: Will Freeman
Review: Very basic, IoT is stretching the truth a little. Basically no integrarions beyond ultra basic voice control. LG you need to open up APIs to your appliances to make them truly IoT capable, this closed approach with only major players will keep you behind in the market.

Name: The Drakes
Review: Nice app but could be great I should be able to see my fridge real time temps without needing to run the diagnostic. Also I should be able to start a dryer from the app so I can just add more time without first having to tell the dryer I want to use the app in the beginning.

Name: Adam L
Review: Waste of time. Can't even modify the downloaded programs to set things to "cold water" on a washing machine. Certain people in the household don't like pressing the cold water setting 4 times every single time. This would've been easier, but no

Name: Alexander Heinz
Review: Notifications when my washer or dryer finished a cycle? Nice. Advertisement "notifications" for crappy deals on supplies through Amazon? That can't be turned off? No. Just no.

Name: Radim Bosticka
Review: I love this. Only issue is the annoying need to flip to remote mode to use mobile. Is there some default which can be changed? Can't find it :(

Name: RJ Amato
Review: Great app very easy to use and sync to my phone. Love the product. My first LG appliance and I am impressed

Name: Chris Shinn
Review: Application is simple and the premise is good, but notifications from the machines do not come regularly or promptly

Name: Anil More
Review: Nice app but make it more user friendly.

Name: Stephenie B.
Review: Fails to connect past 30% using NFC. Phone is a Pixel 2 with no case on and NFC is turned on. Phone is held in the proper place and doesn't move during the attempt. Cannot add appliances. Models WM4270HVA and DLEX4270V.

Name: Gen X
Review: Fantastic App. My phone manufacturer disabled screen mirroring for some strange reason? this app enables me to share my photos, videos etc without having to go out & buy a Chromecast - also control's the TV great, but I prefer the magic remote üòÄ

Name: Jan Hub√≠k
Review: I was using this app, but recent update broke it. Now it says "Cannot run on a rooted device" even though my device is not rooted. And even if it was, it would be a stupid requirement.

Name: Al Khasser
Review: Finally after over 1 year of use and you've nailed it. Works as I expect it to. If you're facing issues delete app and reinstall. Hopefully it stays fixed now. 2 X TV, Washer Dryer, American fridge and AC. All functions working as they should

Name: Nikki Nowers
Review: Awesome app. Not only does it have extra setting I can download to my washer and dryer for those special materials, but it also can diagnose any error code and tell you how to fix them.

Name: Abdulrahman Al-Faifi
Review: Now it is not working after the update and always showing "Server failed to connect", rectification is urgently needed please.

Name: Matthew Fischer
Review: Your bug fixes didn't fix the scheduling for the AC. You're app is costing myself and probably others money. Can't have this AC unit running all the time and with the scheduling I can turn the unit off for certain hours of the day or night.

Name: kerstin hoepfner
Review: App has some useful features but I expected more. E.g. the energy monitoring doesn't work, also it takes very long to display the status and sometimes failes completely. Wifi is good, cannot be the reason.

Name: flamenskall !-0
Review: I dont think i have any home apliances conmatible with this i was just curious of what it was But the app itself just keeps looping between the turms and the acoune signup aplies screen When i select all it says ive already signed up Idk whats going on

Name: Muhammad Danish Bin Zahrom Shah
Review: Great app to control and oversee usage & air quality but could improve more showing size of area polluted or also include data from outside pollution.

Name: JM Asmolo
Review: Smart useful apps for checking lg 16kg washing machine.

Name: Kelly Matos
Review: This smart appliance is better than all of my previous conventional ones

Name: Claudiu Firan
Review: Can't connect it with Google home

Name: yar zar
Review: I can't find option to add my Hom-bot cleaner. Can anyone explain me why please?

Name: Agnes Sammut
Review: Love this app. I can control the tv and monitor my washing. No need to go to the laundry just to check when your cycle is going to finish, it's all at your fingertips.

Name: Randy Gault
Review: It refuses to run on my device, and requires far too many permissions. There must be a third party or PC app somewhere. This sucks. I should use stronger words than that.

Name: Sangruddha Datta
Review: Eversince the update the instantaneous power consumption is not displayed. It will show as a fraction of the actual power. Previously it used to show the correct value always which i have verified with a clamp meter.

Name: Bj√∂rn Hutmacher
Review: Why is a rooted device a problem for this app? It's not exactly a banking or identification app. Please remove this.

Name: Taylor Cuzela
Review: Buggy Nagware. I have to reregister my washer every time that I use this app and then it tells me that it's already registered at which point it reappears. And then it demands I enable location services which I lothe doing. I might have bought a different washer if I knew I'd be nagged all the time to change settings. Wood not recommend.

Name: Yahir Vite Lugardo
Review: My SmartThingQ TV can't be linked to my Google Home, when I try to set the device up, it seems to be linking my account and then it doesn't do anything but back to "Setup new device on Google Home"

Name: David Karnes
Review: Nice to be able to check status and turn on and off remotely. However, even after the current update, there are still significant glitches in the scheduling system.

Name: Lori Pfeifer
Review: Love the app for my washer and dryer. It lets me know how far along they are and when they are done. It's hard for me to hear the melodic chime, and it sets off my phone notification when it's time to switch out the clothes.

Name: Mike Young

Review: You click on the app then wait ~10 seconds for it to connect to our 3 devices. Only then can tell one of then to turn on. Not sure what the deal but I seem to have to hover a bit to activate the on/off button. The remote has different settings, so if you both remote and phone then you the user has to manually sync them. Frequent "upgrades" means you have to login in again, and data loss as in my preferences for celcius. Weather gadget takes 40% of screen and only shows Fahrenheit. Ugh.

Name: Hugh Wicks
Review: I bought a fridge freezer with wifi so I could use the app to see the temperatures inside the fridge and freezer compartments. The wifi version cost about 100 Euro more. Nothing to complicated there, until you find out the only temperatures you see on the app (or the fridge door for that matter) are what LG call 'target temperatures', you can adjust the 'target temperatures' but you have no idea if the fridge freezer has achieved them, at no point does the fridge door or app display the current internal temperatures The fridge freezer itself is great but what is the point of the app? Surely the most fundamental information you want from a wifi enabled fridge freezer is the inside temperatures, I understand that if I leave the door open it will send me an alert but come on is that it, I would not leave the door open anyway and unless the cat develops ninja skills and starts raiding the fridge overnight it is not going to happen. As a remote interface with my fridge this app is about as much use as a chocolate tea pot. Back to the shelf thermometer.

Name: Kien Lam
Review: Basic 'smart home' functionality, serviceable app, Google Assistant/Home connectivity. Despite the promise of glossy commercials for the smart home, the state of LG smart appliances (I have three of them) is basic as of summer 2019. This app is needed to connect the LG appliance to your home Wi-Fi, but is sparse, icons and terms don't line up well with those on the appliance itself. The best part might be Google Assistant/Home connectivity, which worked well for me. Three stars from me.

Name: Dave F
Review: I'm guessing this app replaced the LG Smart Laundry&DW app and is not compatible with my 4 year old LG washer and dryer. Only thing the app will let me do is downlaod a cycle, and even then they only option is small load. I wanted to be able to check the stats of my laundry, since our laundry room is now in the basement. The app wasn't needed at our old house, as the laundry room was on the first floor and we could hear when the load was finished. Not good, LG.

Name: Phil Regier
Review: Utterly useless.  Worse than the front panel controls, with fewer options.  Won't even allow timed dry, and has to be re-enabled on the dryer's control panel every time you use it.  Most of the downloadable programs are the opposite of what I want, and LG forbids you to create your own.  RATIONALE/USE CASE:  Because high heat is so damaging to clothing, and because dryers (especially our LG dryer) are so bad at sensing humidity, I've found the _only_ way to get properly dry clothes without damage or wrinkles is to run _several_ timed dry sessions with rest periods in between.  First low or medium, then a rest to allow moisture to redistribute, then a low immediately followed by air dry to cool and avoid wrinkles.  It works great manually, and an app _should_ be great for doing this with fewer trips to the laundry room, but LG's app forbids this usage.

For the washing machine would be nice to be able to customize programs like you can on LCD Screen of washer itself (change RPM, and temperature) .

Wish my old unit still worked i would go back to it. 10/10 would NOT buy an LG again.

Name: Cornelius Avalon RPG
Review: This does the basics for my American style fridge freezer, but it could do so much more and with a better UX. For example, it should register my warranty, show exact model, include a searchable manual, have a vacation mode, and be able to remote control outside the network. Nice stats on what's going on inside would get you a 5 star: actual inside and outside temp graph, uptime (since last powered on) and active life span (total minutes receiving power since manufacture) would be cool.

Review: Connected it to the dryer.. Complete waste of time. Im sure it does other cool stuff but the dryer connectivity is nothing short of pointless. Says you can 'download cycles', but there's only one listed ('really dry', or something dumb like that). Doesn't give u alerts or allow you to control anything remotely (on my dryer model anyway).

Name: WilliamAnthony Goffigan
Review: I rarely write reviews, but this is stupid. What is the point of the app and connecting it to your voice assistant if you have turn on a device, ex. washer, manually and enable remote start. This defeats the entire purpose of the products being smart appliances. I should be able to control the appliance whether it's on or off, but the fact I have to physically turn it on and enable remote start is counterproductive. Either allow users to properly control the appliance remotely or don't bother.

Please fix your app. Additionally, instructions for connecting AC to web are different in app vs owners manual. You do not hold Mode+Fan on the LP1419IVSM, you should only hold fan to enable wifi.

Name: Michael Kumm
Review: 08.17.19 The Schedule setting for A/C's is that being worked on, it has not worked since the updated last month it was working fine.  **PLEASE fix it or make the prior version of the app available**  I've done complete uninstalls, cleared data & cache with no discernible changes. If this is fixed I will update this review Also, on the 'Energy Monitoring' 902 days vs the ~month ive had it?  So confusing.

Name: My Salvation.
Review: LG this is pretty sad on your part... Just brought a Smart TV yesterday. 8/3/2019 and this App will ONLY turn it OFF. You mean to tell in "2019" your App can't even turn the a Smary TV ON... Are you KIDDING ME???? It's a ON and OFF function. Let's get real people. Hire someone who can build a App. As much money we pay for your Appliances.

How can I try fancy features of my washing machine without telling you where I am or without allowing you to call anybody you want?And I regret buying LG washing machine. Name: Steve Housn
Review: LG is consumer hostile. Be aware of the following before purchasing an LG product. FULL LOCATION PERMISSIONS ARE REQUIRED TO RUN THIS APP. This means that you will have to consent to LG's tracking of your every move just so you can be notified your washer's done. This is an abusive tactic and there is no legitimate reason LG should require this. PUSH ADS ARE FORCED AND POP UP ON YOUR NOTIFICATION BAR.. Out at a nice dinner? Prepare to be interrupted as you toast your friend. Amazon has laundry detergent on sale! These push ads cannot be disabled without disabling the only useful features this app has. Neither of these consumer hostile policies is necessary. The smart app on for my GE appliances neither tracks me nor pushes ads. LG, if you're reading this: I just bought two new big screen TVs. These would have absolutely been LG TVs if it weren't for this app and your policies. Now there won't be another LG product purchased for my home. ________________________________________________________________ LG has responded to this review with a SHAMELESS, BLATANT LIE. Location permissions ARE NOT required to search for WiFi networks and they know it. I have other appliance apps on my phone that do not need location permissions and have found and connected to my WiFi network without a problem.

Review: works pretty good. wish it would show humidity in the room as well. The app starts fairly slow. Would love to have the sleep option on the app too, not just on the unit.

Name: Rishabh Dixit
Review: Worst app not able to detect problem

Name: A Google user
Review: After multiple attempts to login to the app, I discovered you have to disconnect from your Wi-Fi to login successfully via mobile data to bypass the network error. Unfortunately, I'm constantly having to login whenever I access the app, which means I have to disconnect from the Wi-Fi to login successfully. The push notifications, however, seem to work without being logged in, so the app is a 3-star for me since it seems to be working OK.

Name: Ryan Jancik
Review: I purchased an LG washer and dryer with WiFi capabilities. This app is extremely slow and basically only notifies you when the washer and dryer are done (or tells you how much time is left). There is a way to upload custom cycles to your appliance, but it is not really useful. What's worse is that the app requires A LOT of permissions to be enabled that it doesn't need for any legitimate purpose other than to collect information about me. Why does this app need access to my location at all times? LG doesn't need to know when I am home or when I am out somewhere else just to see the status of my laundry. If I turn the location permission off, the app stops working. In addition, LG seems to have frequent updates to the terms of service that you must agree to or the app will not work. Who wants to frequently read legalese to see if you are being forced to give up more rights? I hope LG fixes these problems soon.

Name: Ni√±o Dinoy
Review: Initial connection with the a/c was very straining.

Name: Chris Kell
Review: App is a great concept but it won't let me download any cycles to my washing machine. Just tells me it has failed to download cycle to machine every time. It also doesn't have any data on energy monitoring. Just says no recent history. Very disappointing. I've uninstalled app and reinstalled several times. Cleared the cache but it still won't work. Any advice would be appreciated.

Name: anthony prieto
Review: Worked for the first couple of days, then out of nowhere ceased functioning. I can still turn on my my LG LP1417wsrsm from the app, but I can no longer adjust any settings. It will not allow me to see the current set temperature, adjust it, fan speed, anything. Its just blank. I was directed to LG support forums, had someone ask me for my model # and never posted anything else. Not sure what else to do at this point.

Name: Cool Que
Review: App needs a bit of work. Instruction wording doesn't match up to what's actually on the appliance screen. Then this is just a big annoyance, why can my wife not use it at home on a tablet? This is the convenience people seek. Why will it only work with devices with a SIM card? It's in the home connected to the same WiFi but somehow an Appliance needs a device with Mobile capabilities? Not sure I understand the logic there. No, she does not have an Android or IOS, but the tablet is right there.

Name: Kathleen Little
Review: pretty useless. Must turn on machine to use the phone app, and it is way more complicated to use than the control panel. When the cycle completes and the machine turns off, you must go turn on the machine to get a report! Turning on "remote start" from the machine's control panel only works if you go turn on the machine. I'll give them credit, no hacker will ever breach their security and turn on the machine maliciously.

Name: Daniel Servansky
Review: I appreciate the notifications that the washer and dryer are done since they are in the basement. The app is a little buggy with connecting to the appliances at times.

Name: DJ KY
Review: the Schedule feature is something to be desired. its very confusing! what is 15hr turn on? an I scheduling specific hours after I turn the unit off or is this 15:00 hours aka 3:00PM Really would be nice if you could use IFTTT service to open up options for a Smarter Air conditioning service.

Name: hayek joseph
Review: Very high and good app

Name: Paul Fletcher
Review: I have 2 air conditioners. The app worked great for a year, now it see's both air conditioners, but not the data/settings within. Removing and re-adding didn't help.  Update: Thanks for your response LG. The reinstall didn't help initially, but a few days later the data within the air conditioners started showing up. Now I have access to all the settings, except temperature. I'll reach out to tech support, and update accordingly.

Name: Lichtywara
Review: Privacy and terms have just changed for the worst. LG wants to share personal data with third party "service providers". The problem is the app does not let you see what personal data they have. Nowhere in the app can I do that nor is it clear where and how I can do that. I would like to know what personal data LG has collected, I want it deleted and I'll be terminating my account/deleting this app!!

Name: Iktidar Kazim
Review: WOW! What a stupid App!! Why so many PERMISSIONS?? Why can't I use it without location and phone permissions?? Can't use it without login!! Why does it need my Date Of BIRTH?? And the app name is "SMART", which is only smart thing about it!! LG = Life Gone!!

Name: Jason Matthews
Review: This app used to work but now it claims that I'm rooted and it won't anymore.  Doesn't matter much anyway, the app sucks.  It lacks content and functionality.  Just because you can create an app doesn't mean you should

Name: Bryan Thompson
Review: I received my new LG refrigerator today, installed the app and followed the easy Wi-Fi setup instructions without any issues.  I'm new to the app, so this is not a review, but more of a feature request.  The food expiration feature is a great add, however, I believe the current design is inefficient for managing food items.   The current process: 1. Open Manage Food 2. Click Add Food button 3. Locate a food item by category or search for. If you don't find an item you can create a new user item.  4. Add item to your refrigerator or freezer area 5. Navigate back to the Manage Food page  6. Locate the added item within my items 7. Open the item and add the expiration date.   Whew!! That's a lot of work to add one item and the expiration date.  I recommend you add barcode scanning functionality and the following process: 1. Open Manage Food 2. Click Add Food by Barcode (new feature) 3. View item details, select refrigerator or freezer area and set expiration date from this page.   Done! This would be a much better user experience.  I will begin using the app daily, I'll update by rating if appropriate.  Thanks for your time and consideration!

Name: jason dodt
Review: Love it, works well with everything

Name: Lucas Quiros
Review: LOVE IT, everyday usage

Name: A Google user
Review: This app has a very limited options (ductless AC units), I think it was created at leat 10 years ago, and never been improved after that, not user friendly at all. I'll bet, all customers will be greatful to see advance time schedules with options for temperatures and air flows, and have an option for night mode, shut off the annoying beeping. Description of the modes (home, away, sleep, etc.) and ability to customize it as needed. As for now it is very poor application for such company as LG, very disappointed.

Name: Thomas Bowen
Review: The app may be ok. However the Wi-Fi will NOT connect to a net work name that has a special character in it. My net work has a special character. I have connected numerous other TV's, home security, cameras. thermostats etc. to the network. LG is the only appliance brand that will not connect, thus making the app and LG smart appliances useless to me. It is unbelievable to me that a world wide corporation product cannot connect to a wi-fi network with a special character in the name.

Name: Elliot Wiseman
Review: Connection issues gallore. use it for my lg ductless heat pumps. nearly every time I go to use the remote interface, one or both systems have a connection error. I have to go home, disconnect, then reconnect the malfunctioning wifi connector. I don't have connection problems for any of my other devices, including other brands of wifi thermostats in my house. there are clearly issues with these lg controls. fyi, I am an HVAC contractor with many years of experience. I sell and install lg systems.

Name: Velin Lechev
Review: A/C WiFi has a serious flaw. Registration ok, works for 12-24 hrs, then says "Off". You cannot turn it back on remotely because "It is either Off or not connected to the network". This is the MAIN thing. It MUST work. Connection - strong and healthy, no issues there. Please fix this, it is truly disappointing.

Name: Vance Reif
Review: Just like many other reviews in here, I'm very disappointed. I have a LG mini split mutizone AC system with 3 wall mount units. Each unit needs to be registered.
