Again as others have noted it needs a 2.4 wifi router and apparently a 5khz will not work, seems stupid if you ask me. Either way my router will run both. So I had 2 units registered and running. The third one I could not get registered with the app. Tried numerous times many different ways. I also noted like others have stated that if the units are off and I open the app I can't turn on the units with this app. It will state next to the image the product unit is off or it is not connected to the Internet (which it is because I just connected it). So far I have emailed LG, no response.

Name: R Young
Review: App has a lot of room for improvement. For some reason it needs my location on before it will connect to the wifi... and call status?...WHAT FOR? Too many permissions! I eventually got it to connect to my $3000 fridge, but once the fridge got the wifi data for my network, it switched over and changed its name to the generic wifi driver name, QCA4002, and now the app can't find it and prompts me to restart the painful process all over again. Waste of time!

Name: Chris Gilbert
Review: Wasted opportunity. Why does my fridge have WiFi and alert me itself when the door has been left open but this app doesn't? it would've been the single most useful feature to have that alert whilst I'm in another room or out, but all I can do is set the temperature remotely. How often is that ever going to be useful?! Please make this improvement

Name: Charles Lam
Review: push notifications no longer working after last update. i had washing machine working fine with alerts before. i just also a new dishwasher. i still dont get any alerts. no problem with LG tv controller via app

Name: Scott Heim
Review: Love this washer and dryer! Would buy it again! CONS: The prest settings dont allow you to delay the wash. If you have the lid open on the washer and hit start by mistake the washer throws an error. The only way to clear is by shutting it off and starting again. PROS: Washes clothes quickly. Really love and use the delay start option. Happy it pops up on Friday hone to remind you to start it. Love that you can track the time on each units to see how much is left.

Name: Mert G√∂rkem Manav
Review: App crashed when opening

Name: Evelene Maye
Review: Doesnt work. It request location and phone permissions and then it just hangs( does nothing, but not crash.) Like it's waiting for something to happen. My guess is that it is waiting for a response from its 'mothership' because i'm not letting it go online. I'm keeping it behind a firewall. If the developers were to implement an offline mode soon, i would increase the rating.

Name: kevin grube
Review: update of android and smartThinQ app couldn't connect to AC unit said disconnected . wifi light on. (was working). did setup again stayed at 80% failed. Removed app and reinstalled reconnected fixed problem.

Name: Cassie Clemons
Review: It took a bit to sync with the dryer. But it works great now.

Name: tim solar
Review: Using it to control a 5 zone mini-split. Works ok. App lacks fuctionality. Time zone stuck in Eastern ... Can't seem to change it to Pacific ... Oddly tho - only an hour ahead. Connects to the AC unit quickly and easily. Controls them OK. App is disappointing. No ability to schedule anything other than on/off. Seems like a first draft. Needs work.

Name: Nickalos Sigurnjak
Review: This app is great for notifications and downloading new appliance settings, but aside from that, it does nothing else. There NEEDS to be more functionality. I would adopt more LG appliances and products if i had more remote control features. I cant even start my dishwasher from the app? Or change the cycles via the app? Why? I will update my review as soon as these key features are implemented.

Name: Ignacio Soroeta
Review: The washing machine can't be turned on remotely. The cycles can't be customized. I can't stop the machine and change the cycle if it was not started remotely. Too many restrictions. I can't even change the language. But the app tells me the weather. I don't need the weather, I need the app to make my life easier. The only thing that works fine is the notification that the machine finished washing.

Name: A Google user
Review: Utterly useless. This app actually has to contact the LG server every time you press a button. My AC (6 feet away) has to contact a server 6000 miles away. Spends so long making a connection (little circle spinning around)  it quicker to go get the standard remote out of the bedroom cupboard and put in new batteries. Truly, dreadfully awful. Feels like the IT trainee knocked it up over lunch.

Name: Jake V
Review: Is only good for monitoring when the cycles are gonna be over. The "download cycles" feature literally never works and frequently says "unable to use because the network is lost or your product is off" neither of which is the case. My wifi can effortly stream 4k to my TV's yet, my washer and dryer has an issue downloading cycles from the internet? Come on. Realistically that's like a few KB of data. Sort it out, LG.

Name: Katrina Petrehn
Review: I think it's absurd that I can't program my own custom cycles.. temp is my biggest issue. I hate that I can't change the temp of the programming. Also after I choose my favorites, when I click on the icon in the favorites "bar" it takes me to a blank page instead of letting me download it to the tag. ANNOYING!!!

Name: Daniel Bongard
Review: LG ThinQ doesn't find my TV even though the LG TV Plus app works perfectly fine. My TV says it's registered, I got an email from LG saying "Thank you for registering your TV", but the ThinQ app just says "NO PRODUCTS REGISTERED".  And the diagnostics tool just takes me to a blank white screen.  So I have no Google assistant functionality at all, and LG's online tech support chat is unable to do anything for me, and after 2 hours they eventually just ignored me and let the chat time out.   So my "smart tv" is completely "dumb".  And the worst part is that as I look through these reviews I can see many others with exactly the same problem as me dating all the way back to late last year.....so...I'm taking it that LG is fully aware of the problem but has no idea how to fix it.   It might have been nice if they could have just told me that fact and saved me two hours worth of pointless ill-quipped tech support efforts.   If you're thinking of buying an LG TV because you're reading "Works with Google Assistant" then don't, because it doesn't.

Name: LifeNRA2008
Review: So far it has done everything I want it to do. It's nice being able to turn on the AC from work, then by the time I get home it's nice and cool. I would have given this app 5 stars. But every time I use the app, the app turns on my bluetooth. KILLED my battery because I didn't notice this right away. Why do you need my bluetooth on when I am away makes no sense. There should be a way to turn this off. But there is not. Should fix this!

Name: William Cooper
Review: In principle I really liked the idea of a phone app to control my LG appliances. However, it doesn't really control them remotely. The app appears to have been designed by a liability lawyer working group instead of home chefs. All the nanny oversight limitations require you to go over to the oven and do things. So much for * remote * control. E.g., once a timer expires, you have to go over to the oven before you can reset the timer for a few more minutes of baking. Argh! Focus on functionality!

Name: G H
Review: Horribly slow app that constantly wants to download product information until it finally fails. Takes forever to find the air conditioner just one mind you. While my WeMo app units are found with virtually no discernible lag

Name: Julie St.Peter
Review: Works like a charm. Saved me from diagnostic nightmare

Name: Zaker
Review: Works with my Refrigerator

Name: A Google user
Review: Works well for my purposes (heat pump). Note that many apps will not always function properly via a wi-fi connection. Once you have configured your LG device to connect to your local network, turn off wi-fi on your smartphone and reconnect (to your LG account) via the cell network (to check for downloads, etc.). (Version 2.3.1401working fine via wi-fi / cell).

Name: Michelle B
Review: Works Great for me! I Love that when I'm upstairs I don't have to keep going up and down the stairs to check if the Washer or Dryer is Done! Saves me a lot of time too cause you know when your clothes are Done so you can keep up with it and get it done quicker! Great app, there was some issues in the Beginning but with a Few Updates they have Done, it's Been Working Great! Definitely a Plus for Me!

Name: Leaburn Knott
Review: Using on a Mini Split. Works fine. I can control the heat while away. One Zone seems to be in a different time zone, might have to reset the time with the remote??? Wish it had an option when on a schedule to work like smart thermostat and cut back the heat not the same temp it was the last time it was turned off.

Name: Michael Albert
Review: Couldn't login to my LG account, had use different account therefore sharing lots of private personal information. Email to support was unanswered. NFC pairing with my dryer was very finicky and took several tries to accomplish. After all that I'm told that my dryer doesn't support WiFi even though it's supposed to, and consequently I couldn't get message when a dryer load was done. That's all I wanted and it took way too much work to figure that out.  In response to your question my Dryer is (from the receipt) a "DLE3170W 7.4CF FL ELEC DRYER ULTRA CAP".

Name: N√°ndor Junior Izer
Review: Useless piece of s*** :( I selected LG washing machine, mainly because the smart function, but the app is painfully slow and functionless. Waiting 20+ seconds just to see the remaining time is absolutely useless. I can download fancy named (but technically similar) programs to the machine, but can't edit any own. Can't connect the notification to any third party system (like Google or Alexa). Need a lot of development!

Name: A Google user
Review: Bought a new c8 tv, what's the point of it saying it's connected/registered on the tv, when the tv does not display itself in either google home/assistant or smart thinq app. This was the first time I went for LG, and if this ain't resolved, it's also the last. Thanks for letting my waste more than 4k on a device that is so ancient that it is not functional with the future of smart homes.  Hence I mentioned that it concludes with the TV displaying that the TV is registered to google, however what help is there in it saying that when it does not appear in Google home/ assistant for me to properly control?  I have light switches that I registered to google that appears in my list of devices allowing me to make them apart of different locations. While with this it just tells me it is, and there's nothing to help me improve my home automation to allocate the tv to some sort of location.  To conclude, how is it that a 30 dollar device is more compatible with google(better smart device) than your $4k+ tv, TRAGIC.

Name: Ramon Ravent√≥s
Review: Impossible to connect the television with the application. I've waste a lot of time by reading the guides on the lg website and even so I have not been able to find the solution. All the forums that I've consulted the people there also find the same problem and no solution. Although I had read that it was possible to do so from Spain, there is a message saying that there is no option to do so from my country.

Name: A Google user
Review: UPDATED 12152018: LG finally fixed the notifications to work with your default Android notification scheme. No more annoying pop-ups on the lock screen and pop-ups in general if you don't use them like me. Can't complain about the permissions, because if your app needs the WiFi App such as this to grant appliance access to WiFi, that is GOOGLE'S REQUIREMENT AND IT'S STUPID! Again, won't hold LG responsible for this. Haven't come up with a use case for the app other than end of cycle notifications for my washer and dryer. I know you can program or start cycles from the app, but still haven't experienced a time that I would want to do it.

Name: Dave Lloyd
Review: Seems pointless. Huge permission request. Went through and tried register dryer. It worked then when it goes back to main page it decides it's not registered after all. Hit the home button and it seems to be "profiles" which is not really relevant for a dryer. Since can't see anything useful (like a schedule or electricity usage) I'm uninstalling

Name: IvanPatrick Camposano
Review: Used To Be Good, The Update Sucks! With the update, my LG AC won't be able to connect with the WiFi I have at home. The WiFi in the Led display won't blink and won't appear. Now, I'm just using the remote. Bummer. Now, how can I set the AC ON when I'm on my way home? LG, please fix this. I love to use the app but now I'm only using the remote. The router I have is near the AC as well. Please fix this ASAP

Name: Denise Dutton
Review: Requires the app to be able to control your Wi-Fi... Which made it almost impossible to check any other app. Plus, I still can't connect to my new dishwasher. Fail.

Name: Peter Short
Review: Why is it everytime there is an update i have to re register my product. Very very poor. And now we have to have an account to see temp of fridge and feezer. Not bothering as it is not worth the effort. Ill get another brand next time.

Name: Kenneth Hall
Review: Downloaded app tried tried sign in with my LG account info and it doesn't recognize it. So I guess that makes this app useless to me.

Name: Denise Smith
Review: Very good told me everything about my fridge

Name: Shivang Joshi
Review: So, I was using this to operate my Smart ThinQ AC for a couple of days and monitor the energy usage. But after the recent maintenance break on the app, the AC just isn't showing the WiFi LED. I purchased the damn AC thinking that it'll be better to handle from anywhere!! But now that feature isn't even working! I could have bought any other AC if I didn't want to have that feature!

Name: Thomas Tovey
Review: I used to be able to control my ducted system via this app. Then you took the functionality away. Ie. The menu does not exist for ducked on iOS or Android. However I had a scheduled timing setup on the app and the aircon system still thinks the app is there. Now I have not air turn on at 5am daily with no way of turning it off. So disappointed. Please put the ducked aircon back on. This is a major reason I bought the system in the first place.

Name: Byron Bwoy
Review: Product should always be connected to wifi source once set, not everytime you turn it on you would need to set it. Also, I should be able to turn my dryer and washer on the same way I'm able to turn it off. The remote start option seems pointless because machine has to stay on to use this option defeating the concept of energy saving anyway... The alerts are great, would be cool to create your own musical alerts.

Name: Neil Ferreira
Review: This App had such promise but not needing able took remotely start the appliances or set the wash/dry cycle without first getting it all set up on the appliance and setting remote start on, on the appliance defeats the object of having an app. The only useful feature is the push notification when the cycle is done, but this does not really add any value.

Name: Greg Hyman
Review: "No problem with the product could be found."  Our fridge quit working.  60¬∞ in the freezer, water and melted popsicles and melted ice cream and spoiled milk and... basically everything in the freezer and the refrigerator is ruined.  The app connects just fine, but apparently it doesn't consider it a problem when the refrigerator stops keeping things cold.  What is the point of advertising a feature that is supposed to be "smart," yet can't detect an error when the refrigerator is not able to do the ONE THING it is designed to do?

Name: Tony Stevens
Review: have only had our LG washing machine for one day so we are still getting to know all the features but the app is a new experience and will hopefully be used frequently, the app seems like a great idea and should add flexibility of use to our machine. the app is fairly intuitive but it would be nice to see the energy use in kw/h rather than just a graph with no scale, also would be nice to see actual water usage per wash as well as cumulative figures for water and electricity thus the 4 * rating.

Name: Gary Benjamin
Review: I only use this app with a washer and dryer. It works as advertized, but I would like to see more. Pros: You can see how many minutes are left in the cycle, start and stop the machines, and get a notification when the cycle ends. There are also special cycle and diagnostic functions that I don't use. Cons: Can't see the machine after the cycle ends, useful in the case of errors like unbalanced load. Alexa doesn't give an end of cycle notification and can only see one machine at a time

Name: Clarence Hurt
Review: Along with several others that have downloaded this app, I too have been experiencing several issues with this app. I have used multiple email accounts to try to log in to this app, and all has failed. I have multiple LG products which I cannot even access remotely as a result of a login error. Very disappointing...

Name: Alicia Brook
Review: Awesome but want a quicker wash

Name: Patrick Tuxbury
Review: I thought it was ridiculous for a washer/dryer to have WiFi built in because I could never see the need to start the washing machine remotely. However, our washer and dryer are in the basement, and I've found this app to be very useful in notifying me when the washer or dryer is finished. Overall using this app had been a positive experience.

Name: A Google user
Review: Very slow app, no API for home assistant, need to remote enable (somewhat understand that), rooted phone it wont boot (proven when using root hide apps, works again), like honestly LG the point is to integrate not separate. This kind of mentality will not keep you in the IoT game very long -- look at GE integrating with Google Assistant. A simple command should be made available to the assistant. "Hey Google, is my fridge open?" But no :(

Name: M. Jackson
Review: Killing my battery!!! (Note 9) I installed this app to go with our new washer. Didn't give us much functionality, why would I load the washer, then walk away and remote start it? The downloaded cycles didn't seem to differ from the installed ones. Worse part the app was draining my battery big time, yet was somehow hiding it from the system. Was trying to figure out what was causing the issue, remembered this app was new, uninstalled it and my power usage was normal again.

Name: LeNee Curtis
Review: I like this app in that it notifies me when the load is done. It needs many more features. Remote start never works properly, if at all . I wish it had a reminder or snooze function when it notifies that the load is done but my biggest complaint is that it will not stay connected to the internet & washer!

Name: Amritava Roy
Review: This app is good and I installed it and it set it up nicely without any hiccups with my vivo Y69 android phone. But after I connected my ac using iPad, the app on android phone started acting weird. I uninstalled it and reinstalled the app on my android phone and it is showing Service Message which states " Service check is restricting app usage and blah blah blah...." and app is closing. What is this? Can you help me to reset the wifi settings of the ac?

Name: Dorian Lara
Review: I believe that the smart diagnosis feature on LG products is very usefull and they should continue using this feature from now on. However the app is irritably glitchy; it takes forever for the app to load and there are times when the app crashes altogether. this has been a problem for quite sometime and I wish LG would resolve this as soon as possible. When the smart diagnosis does works it is very helpfull it gives me the problems and the solutions right then and there.

Name: Blair Magon
Review: Like other reviewers it would be better to have more control starting and setting of the washing machine remotely rather than having to go to the machine every time. Ideally we should be able present the settings and just turn the washer on and send the settings directly. Otherwise its great to be able to monitor the process and see energy usage etc. Update 12/01/19, Noticed delay start via app now works! Thank you!

Name: Jaber M
Review: I like the app since it gives me the option to start the machine and monitor the progress remotely. A really nice feature the only the app can provide is the wrinkle prevention/fresh care option. on the negatives, the app is very sluggish and does not instantly update the machine progress. I have to back up to the intial app page and select the machine to get an accurate status update.

Name: Mihail Stroe
Review: I cannot use the app. After starting, and connect with google account, the screen shows " Downloading the product information... Please wait" and remains stuck on that. I've been trying from several devices (Samsung S9, Oppo Find7, etc.) with the same result. ... after several hours... Downloaded information..but a waste of time, not much info about Cycles ( time for cleaning, how many rise, does dry.. ). I have LG in all my house: TVs, fridges, washing machine, but I will change all of them.

Name: Matthew Palmer
Review: A pretty much unless app. Whats the point of remote access to your washer & dryer if once any cycle finishes it stops your remote access? REALLY! Also you have to turn on the wifi function everytime you turn on the machines. So to sum it up, you have to be standing in front of the washer & dryer to power it on, and to turn on the WiFi so you can connect to it remotely to see what you set it up to do while standing there. Once finished you start all over again! Skip LG WiFi not worth the $$!

Name: Benjamin Durfee
Review: This app wants crazy permissions. Ability to control phone calls, ability to turn on and off your phone's wifi, requires your date of birth. On top of that it repeatedly said I don't have internet, which is false. Does not save router password so you have to enter it every time. Garbage. Probably a scam. All I want to do is know when the dryer load is done. With how much trouble this is I'll just use a timer

Name: Tabetha Kelsey
Review: this app is the absolute worst. i have it for my washer. the menus are non-existent. it's just poking at random buttons until you happen upon what you're looking for. literally the ONLY reason i bought this washer is because it stated it had a "delicate" cycle in the specs. come to find out, this is actually a "lingerie" cycle in the app to download to the machine. and it's no longer available. sick.

Name: Jafar Sharifi
Review: Perfect application I really like it and enjoying

Name: Brian Finlay
Review: My wife and I both have Pixel 2 devices and mine works without issue. Wife's phone it wont work as it says the device is rooted. Its not rooted and the bootloader is still locked.  Very frustrated by the fact that this app checks for rooted devices and will not clearly say how it is checking for that so that I can properly troubleshoot it.

Name: funkyman909
Review: interesting features, I like how you can download different cycles for the dryer and washer. you can also remotely start the dryer and washer from this app, what I was hoping for though was to be able to set a time, or timer for when you want your cycle to start. a remote start feature is more of a novelty then anything youstill have to click go. if you could set a timer for say 08:00 the next morning then that would really make this technology the most useful in my opinion

Name: A Google user
Review: Was connected and working fine. Then my app just stopped communicating to my heatpump. My WiFi access point see its connected and working fine, but the app on my phone says it can't register it when trying to connect... UPDATE ,had to delete the app and reinstall it. Works good now, still very slow communications when you first open the app, but when it's fully communicating it works very fast.

Name: Matthew Dale
Review: It's actually more convenient to just walk down two flights of stairs from my office to my basement than it is to setup this app. My phone has to be positioned perfectly with an icon on the washer and near as I can tell the shadows of ancient monuments in east Asia also have to line up under the summer equinox, because the correct positioning of the phone vs washer seems to change and when found will throw up its hands and have a problem just to have a problem.

Name: Adam
Review: Doesn't work on rooted phones. Barely let's you do anything with washer and dryer remotely. And the appliance has to be turned and left on to remote connect. And you have to turn on "remote start" every time the appliance is turned off. It asks for too many permissions that it doesn't really need.

Name: Mathias Dybvik
Review: Worst privacy policy. Hardest to use. Primary purpose is to spy on customers. Believe it or not, you actually have to give LG the right to make phone calls on your behalf in order to install the app. And if for some reason LG thinks you are in another country than what you are, you need to get yourself a new email account to register a new account to use your LG products. Tedious. Unless of course you want to give them access to your Facebook account, good luck with that...

Name: Kishore Devarakonda
Review: I had a lot of difficulty in connecting my AC to the app. after about 15 to 20 tries, it connected. Next day it again showed the status if the AC as disconnected. It again took several attempts to connect. But again the next day it shows as disconnected and not connecting again. Also, why does this app turn on bluetooth on my phone?

Name: Matthew Cornish
Review: Bought a new 55" TV and can't connect it to anything because this bloody app doesn't work. Everyone you try to setup the TV to use this it just sits there saying nothing is connected. Why can't it just work like the older LG TVs. What's the point in having a smart TV if it's dumber than a box of nails.

Name: Unbreak able
Review: Total rubbish!!! Can't even log in! The create account by LG (website) forced my email to set leading case to create the account. Then this silly app refuses to accept it as it is leading case (instead of converting to all lower as default)!!! So one hand is fighting the other hand at LG!!!! I raised it with LG support but they can't be bothered to resolve it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Name: Marek Rodziewicz
Review: Does not connect to LG wall mounted AC unit. After enabling the wifi connection on the unit and confirming it is on in the app by clicking YES, all I get is a loading page with PLEASE WAIT. Nothing happens. Wifi connectivity is one of the main reasons we bought the LG AC unit, feeling very disappointed. Reinstalling app did nothing to resolve the issue. Android webview is upto date. Mobile data switch disabled. I've checked every single possibility - still nothing.

Name: Ben Treseder
Review: On the weekend I bought a dual washer and dryer. This app handy in that you can look at how long till the wash is complete and it'll notify me when it's done. Improvements would be the ability for the app to send me a notice it is done and the option to continue and dry my items (depending on the wash setting). Not being able to connect when the machines are turned off restricts the set up via the app.

Name: Dave Petzel
Review: So why do you prevent this app from running on a rooted phone? This is the ONLY app that I have tried to run that has complained about my phone being rooted. fix this! Then LG responded, due to some security reasons, really, even my banking apps run on my rooted phone, please explain LG. There is no reason to prevent this. How about giving the user the option, like asking a question, "do you really want to use this app on you rooted phone?" One of the selling points was this app, fix this.

Name: Denny Hollick
Review: Unfortunately the last update broke the ability to set up scheduled changes to A/C. It's additionally very slow. LG should open their API to better apps and services if they can't build one themselves.

Name: TheRealBigJake
Review: What business is it of yours if my phone is rooted? You don't have permission to check my phone for administrator rights! I bet you scanned my phone to see all the apps I have installed without me too! Shame on you LG After reading the reviews I'm glad this app doesn't work. Thanks for saving me the headache of using this garbage

Name: Paul Edworthy
Review: Push notifications have never worked, it's the very least you'd expect from a WiFi enabled product. Registering using a Huawei P20 Pro does not work. 1 out of 10 times, I could provide the home WiFi details, but it would never get further than 40% complete. Luckily I was able to use a Sony Xperia to complete the registration, then log in using the same account on the Huawei phone. Not an ideal UX.

Name: Nate Best
Review: For whatever reason, I've stopped getting notifications that my wash/dryer cycles are done. super frustrating. I've force closed the app, cleared the app storage, uninstalled/reinstalled the app and still not working properly. All i want is the notifications so if I'm not home or in a different part of the house, I have a reminder that there's laundry to be dealt with.

Name: –î–º–∏—Ç—Ä–∏–π –°–µ—Ä–≥–µ–µ–≤–∏—á
Review: It requests too many permissions! LG responds it needs "Make calls and call settings" in order to identify country and language. BUT at the same time app requests LOCATION? Please, use location info and a lot of 3d party services to convert location into country info! If even it is not possible, live filling country and language info to user. Believe, we will cope with it.

Name: Katelyn G
Review: It'd be nice if we could actually use the functions of the app like downloading new cycles to use. But considering every single time it says that it can't because we're not connected, despite the wifi showing on and remote start available, we're unable to download cycles. So yeah, that's very frustrating.

Name: Stephanie Epps-Guzek
Review: Doesn't work... installed and uninstalled and reinstalled multiple times. Go through the registration but when I click on my stove the app freezes and I have to force stop. It's like it never fully downloads my oven and the app just shows a bunch of gibberish where I assume the product's info would appear... glad I sprang the extra money on useless bluetooth functionality. So far not impressed with LG.

Name: Frederick Frederickson
Review: I have smart fridge, washing machine and vacuum. All have problem connecting to the app except the vacuum. I tried for hours and days trying to connect to the fridge and washing machine with my P20 Pro but failed! This app sucks very bad!!!! I took out my old LG G4 to sync the app with the fridge and washing machine, and it worked! The app should have worked with all newer android phone!

Name: Jermaine
Review: I installed this to use with my refrigerator. It keeps telling me it will not run on a rooted device. My phone is not rooted. I bought an unlocked phone directly from HTC. This is ridiculous. Update: 01/23/2019 A previous update now shows me to use the app on my phone. The app features are great now that I am able to use it. I changed my rating from 1 star to 5. This is a great app.

Name: Grace Lee
Review: I live in the same country where our LG appliances were purchased. However, I cannot connect to the only official version of the app available to me. There is no way in the app to change my region or location even though I turned my GPS on like the app asked me too. I cannot program anything for our washer, dryer, or styler. I cannot put delicate natural materials (fur, leather) into the styler because some functions require a connected app, which is a huge design flaw.

Name: Andrei Picus
Review: There's no good reason why this app should require call permissions. Overall pretty simple app that lets me control my washing machine and fridge. I can download new washing programs or set the temperature, and the notifications are a nice touch. Wifi diagnostics for the fridge always fails, but audio diagnostics works and it helped me figure out that the fridge was in defrosting mode so that's why I couldn't hear it working. The English copy in some screens contains grammar mistakes.

Name: Lena Manns
Review: I was so excited about my LG washer and dryer that was delivered today. But if I knew my app would be stuck on the "downloading product information" screen I would have just went with the Samsung set. I've uninstalled the app and re-downloaded it, it still doesn't work. May call and return my products tomorrow. Sad cause I had such high Hope's. My last set of LG washer and dryer worked for over 12 years.

Name: Barbu Diana
Review: The idea behind this is awesome and really helpful. I use this app for a washing machine and i do like the fact that i have so many programs to choose from. However, it lacks some features: i wish i had some kind of a description for the programmes and the amount of time they take-you can only see this on the machine when you download the program. A favourites kind of feature would be useful too and maybe having the possibility to monitor the washing cycle while it goes.

Name: Iveben Kruzen
Review: When using this app for a heat pump why can't we set the temperature when using the the on/off timer, it only uses the laat temperature that was set? I would like to automatically set a time when I'm not home to a lower temperature and then have it higher when I'm home. The way it is now the weekly timer is useless.

Name: Shreyas Narulkar
Review: Remote controling is only do ON & OFF and cycle selection process, modification of cycle is not controllable via this app, for eg: if I want to increase temp, need extra rinse, need extra spin. So this functions are uncontrollable, or may be LG should provide a guide to run this app online (kind of navigator) and also please update the app so it takes less space in device

Name: Tom Tam
Review: A little lag in establishing connection with my wifi enabled split air units. The biggest pain point is the schedule feature. It does not operate at all. In other words, setting a time to turn on and off does not work. The unit remains off, even though I can hear an audible ring after confirming the settings.

Name: King P
Review: Bit poorly laid out, awkward menus. Main issue is a notification from it, e.g. washing complete, keeps the phone screen on constantly. Someone else uses washer and I discover my phone hours later at 4% battery. Had to turn off notifications. But that was the point of it, to know when my washing is done. Stupid.

Name: Ines Valenti
Review: The app is slow, when you click on the washing machine/download cycles nothing happens. Usually have to click a couple of times before it opens the options to download cycles. It just shows the cycle names but it doesn't give more information like how long it takes or the temperature. There is no setting for towels, the short wash also takes a really long time. My previous washing machine had a 15min cycle which was awesome. I also wish we could customise our own cycles

Name: quek ee soon
Review: App not reponding after the last update.

Name: Liesdi_ana
Review: Good and simple

Name: Bill Peters
Review: difficult to navigate

Name: Don G
Review: There is so much promise that is unrealized with this app. I connect everything I must house with my Google Home and have come to expect a certain amount of functionality. I can use this app with Google to change the temp in my fridge, turn ice plus on but can't run my 78" LG TV or start my LG connected dryer unless I pushed a button on the dryer to specifically allow remote start. This is a good start but needs a lot work to truly connect with my Google home.

Name: Brian Njeru
Review: I am only able to select the cycle but I cannot select the options for Wash, Rinse, Spin, Temperature, dry, etal. I'm usong an LG G4. It's also unfortunate that I have to switch on remote start from the machine. It would have been epic if I could switch on the machine and remote start from the App.

Name: Babu Kumaran
Review: They steal your personal information. I just want to scan the fride for error code. They wont let you use the app if you are not willing to give up your private info (location, calls and messages), while its often unnecessary for the users to give those permissions. If you want to know the country or language, just ask in a page, dont ask for full permissions to spy on people.

Name: Dan Scherlis
Review: Buggy. Current version fails to declare its "notification channel". LG developers would know this, if they ran their own app with all the debug alerts enabled. (Or maybe try this thing called "testing", LG. Ask around. It's a good thing, unless you don't want to know about your bugs.) Edit: Raised to 3 stars. Because they're still better than Samsung. (I've a pixel 2. Stock. Fully upgraded.)

Name: jetro baggins
Review: Good but I've 2 issues with it that are deal breakers: (1) the app lacks any form of automation by itself (say, turn on air-conditioning when temp is 29) and (2) integration with other automation app like IFTTT, Google Home or Alexa is regional and sadly our region hasn't been supported still. As it is, it can only turn on/off air-conditioning and after the coolness factor has worn off, to me, until automation is supported, it's nothing but a novelty app.

Name: Ronda Wilder
Review: We bought our washer in July & I loved the Smart Thinq app. Since an upgrade in the app I have been unable to connect it. I have done everything conceivably possible (including a page from an answer another review)& still can't get connected. My router needs an extender to reach, that address has an underscore I can't change, & is the only thing I can figure is causing the prob. My washer is downstairs, & my kids do their own laundry making this ability convenient. Please, help me fix this bug.

Name: mohd khairul
Review: I'm using LG 9kg Heat pump dryer TD-H9066WS. It connect easily and pair with apps, the apps show how many cycle does the dryer used every month, type of drying menu used, wireless start stop and pause. But there is a small things that I found, when the dryer estimate to finish 14minutes, I'm click pause using apps and the dryer pause as it should be but it resumes to 20 minutes to compete dry. That's all. Everything else, nice

Name: A Google user
Review: This app is useless. Just purchased a new refrigerator with wifi capability. LG had an outdated email address on file. I spent 40 minutes on phone to restore login credentials. Owners Manual insert had the wrong app name. Downloaded updated app and then could not login with new credentials. Purchased from Costco, whose support is excellent, and they were unable to work with the app. Now attempting to exchange "smart" frig for a GE model...

Name: Travis Arnzen
Review: This is thr most useless app in the world. What's the point of remote start? You have to enable it every time you run it. As soon as the cycle ends, you lose your ability to do anything remotely and even after the dryer is turned back on, you have to hold down the button to re-enable remote start. This is the most useless feature but should be the best. It is the feature that sold me on your dryer. What's the point?

Name: nialled
Review: Works ok but very slow to connect to my LG air conditioner. I would say there is a delay of around 30 secs between launching the App and being able to control the a/c. I have tried it on three devices including IOS and Android and they all do it. UPDATE 22 June 2019. I have updated my devices but there is still a delay of around 15s. I am using WiFi with a 200mbps connection so the problem is not due to my internet connection.

Name: Andrew Carruthers
Review: I'm using it for a washer and dryer, and it's pretty convenient to get alerts when loads are done (for as lazy as that may sound). It'd be nice if it had a widget for easier access to common features or statuses, and I'd really love the ability to program cycles in greater depth (and, to have custom programs as the default when each appliance is started).

Name: Oliver Fernandes
Review: Some features missing. As of today, u can turn off the light for the ac with the app or alexa skill. You can't schedule for anything less than 1 hour. So if the ac needs to be on, it has to be for an hour. I want it to be set to any value in minutes. Plus if I want to turn on or off the ac in different times of the night... I can only do a on - off. I can't do a on-off-on-off etc

Name: Dave Courington
Review: cool thing to change settings but it would be nice to be able to get things like actual temp inside the until instead of just what it is set to on the door.

Name: Peter Francis
Review: Can't run on a rooted phone.. Really,, devs need to realise that it's not some mission critical banking app.

Name: Timothy Rose
Review: i did not think that i needed a washer and dryer with wifi but after purchasing a laundry pair i will not go back. This feature has allowed me to determine extactly when my clothes are ready to be dried or folded down to the second. I can match up the cycle counts per month to determine how much detergent to purchase and to finally budget for these expenses. The app does have a couple of flaws... My washer drops off the wifi while the dryer stays on. The device polling time is slow. Good start.

Name: Felix F√∂rster
Review: Tried to connect a LG C8 TV with Google home trough the app like described on LG website. However, when pressing (+)add on the app TVs are not even listed as category. Way too complex and many steps and I'm a rather tech savvy. How are older people supposed to set this up? Probably not... Turns out LG changed its mind (hence the old manual on their website) and only allows Google home integration and sign up directly from a menu within the TV.

Name: A Google user
Review: Not terrible but expected more. App will control washer, but will only start it if washer is powered on and you select the remote start option. So basically useless for that functionality. The notifications are nice. You cant change the washer cycle if someone else starts it. Its not overly intuitive. My washer doesnt need to tell me the weather, because my thermostat, computer, tv, and phone already do that. The description for this app says stop wasting time with chores, but to effectly use the app, it takes more time than to actually push the buttons at the washer.

Name: Henry Elliott
Review: Invasive permissions required to operate my LG AC unit. Call, photos....what the he__. Also, do not believe the app connects directly to unit through app when connected to Wi-Fi, but goes through a LG server to connect. NO, not for me. I'd like to keep the connection direct from app on phone through my Wi-Fi to AC unit. No LG server.

Name: Nicolas M√©nard-Guy
Review: UX is generally bad, most options and features aren't explained.  Why does Bluetooth turn on when app is opened? You can turn that off, but it doesn't explain why you'd want it on  Modes: What do they do?  Why does it say "Airconditioner Alert" when clicking on a mode?  I haven't tested it much, but the App doesn't really tell me how it can be helpful to me

Name: Bess Ward
Review: i really wish you could give it it's own notification sound, but it just uses the default so i often miss or ignore it. sometimes it doesn't even notify me at all until i open the app and it's been 30 min gone by. other times, even with the app open it just sits there spinning until i tap the actual appliance. so it's a bit annoying, but when it works properly it's very nice.

Name: Jeff Larkin
Review: Although it explains why, it asks for unreasonable permissions like making and managing phonecalls that it should be able to function without. After that there's no functionality without creating an LG account. Just not worth it to me.  Update: The developer's response to my review just proves my point as to why I uninstalled the app. Asking to be able to make/manage phone calls to determine my country is an abuse of that permission and violation of my privacy. Same with requesting fine-grained location just to access WiFi. If they can't trust me to tell them what country I live in, why should I trust them with such broad permissions? This might be a good app, but is burdened with permissions issues that make it not worth installing in my opinion. Your mileage may vary though.

Name: Kombucha Like
Review: This app is amazing. my laundry room in on the second floor, and when im crazy busy and dont want to run upstairs to see if laundry is done. I just open the app. Makes my life so much more easier. No longer running up the stairs to see if it's done and then seeing there's 5 minutes left, and running back down the stairs. and hoping I remember 5 minutes later that laundry is done.

Name: David Taylor
Review: I've just bought an American style fridge freezer, connected the app...I can set the temperature of the fridge and freezer and...that's it. Now you'd THINK that one of the kinda useful things to know would be what the temperature ACTUALLY IS!!!!  Nope, it won't do that, however it will tell me the weather in my location and the outside temperature, should I wish to venture out.  FFS, there are a million ways to find out the temperature outside and the last place I will look is on my fridge/freezer app but c'mon, ffs, tell me the temperature INSIDE THE BLOODY THING.  That's the ONE thing that this app should be doing!  The appliance will have temperature sensors so the data is there, the appliance already communicates with the app for diagnostic and firmware info but seriously, what part of "YOU HAVE ONE TASK" isn't clear here?   TELL ME THE ACTUAL TEMPERATURE INSIDE THE APPLIANCE.

Name: Lolo S
Review: I use this app for one appliance only (washer). I like having a notification for the end of wash. I was spoiled to my previous version of my LG washer with a custom program & became excited to see I could download one. Unfortunately, these settings are preset and not editable through the app to download. So instead of making a cycle setting for one button push, I have to make changes to the closest setting I've downloaded. A custom setting like on the WT5001CW would be awesome!

Name: Sam Payne
Review: Most frustrating app ever!! Tried to set up regular schedule for ac unit. I'd set it to start at 4pm, save, then back up to menu and it would show starting at 5pm. I tried to anticipate a time zone issue when creating other schedules. I'd save a new one at 3pm, then it would push the first schedule to a new time, and save the current one at a different time. Worst programming ever. Worthless. I bought a Wi-Fi enabled power plug to schedule on on the plug and bypass the worthless LG app.

Name: Roberta Olivero
Review: Why don't let the user customize washer cycles from the app? That would be very useful and productive. If I need to customize a cycle I have to access the washer panel directly, and this is a no sense since the app could do it. Please improve the app, you can do it.

Name: Marwan Oussama
Review: cant connect to google home

Name: Marc F
Review: Cannot get the app to work on Google Pixel 2 with latest version of Android 9. When I enter my email address and pwd, always get the message - Network Instability - No response from the server. Try again later. Have tried this over many days with same result. Very frustrating! Also, have the exact same problem on my Samsung tablet! Just got update, re-installed - same problem!

Name: Steven Beghtel
Review: This app is s big waste of my time!! I bought a $3000 refrigerator with wifi for the sole purpose of connecting it with the smart thinQ app. Well this app is not smart at all!! I have repeaters in my house.and one directly across from the refrigerator!! I have an IP cam right across from my refrigerator and that works fine, so I know it isn't a problem with my wifi. I had it connected once and it worked for awhile but quit!! If I had know LG products don't work well with their apps or play well with Amazon echo, I wouldn't have spent the outrageously high prices on their appliances!!

Name: Matias Kaski
Review: AC only showing disconnected. Worked few hours and sometimes works after outer unit defrost seqence. Nothing helps, to get it connect again than just wait. there is nothing wrong with my router and all needed ports are open for AC on router. Really need help with this. When app works it's fun and useful but 95% of time it does not connect.

Name: Stephan Burke
Review: Works with top washer 7300 & dryer 7250. Conneting to my WiFi was a bit challenging as my network is top security type. I was able to get around this once I was able to discover the MAC address for both appliances. I would have appreciated if LG would had provided these MAC address's. So I had to disable my network security in order to discover those addresse's. After that I reinstated the network security and gave access to both LG appliances. Only then was this app able to recognize both.

Name: Jack Harris
Review: Unlike the previous version, this latest version of the LG app is really pretty good. It was easy to set up and I like the updates. The temperature now shows up in Fahrenheit, which is great for us Americans. It's a very simple and easily understood app that does indeed offer some value.

Name: A Google user
Review: Awful! This app is glitchy, randomly logs you out, and is so hard to use. I really wish LG would overhaul this terrible app! We have an LG washer and dryer and when the app works it is handy for checking on laundry, but getting the app to actually work is the problem. Should have gotten the Samsung washer and dryer!

Name: Faye Malliou
Review: Buying a washer/dryer that doesn't give you the option of having a simple "rinse&spin" already predownloaded is really uncomfortable. Every time I try to download it from the app, it simply times out and I get so frustrated (usually after 10' of failed attempts) and simply end up rewashing the clothes with a "fast" available program...Can't even add it to favorites for when it decides to allow me to download it. Practically can't use any downloadable program. Thats really not cost effective.

Name: A Google user
Review: Downloaded the app to set up my Smart ThinkQ refrigerator but the app is not working. Tried to register my product multiple times but it failed so I decided to reinstall the app hoping it'd fix the bugs but it got worse. The app flashes a log in failed message on start up and whenever I select the retry button, the screen loads then the same message appears. Apparently getting a Smart ThinkQ refrigerator is useless because of the buggy app.

Name: Jan Sakran
Review: I am not really sure what this app is supposed to do. I bought the LG washer WT7500C and Dryer DLEX7600, i have the NFC turned on on my phone and was able to register the products and that's about it. app says i can download cycles but doesnt give me any options to download. Is it supposed to allow me run my washer and dryer from afar? keep track of what they are doing? other than monitoring any service issues, which i am not hoping to have use to often, not sure what i am using the app for...

Name: Nikolay Krastev
Review: I used it to connect my lg fridge freezer, but to be honest its not very functional. Why can't be shown on the app the current live temperatures in the fridge freezer? The only thing i can see is the target. I wan to see what is the temperature in my fridge. It's so simple

Name: Bo Asher
Review: think first before buying an LG product to use with this app. This is one of the worst home automation apps available. It takes no less than 20 seconds to even see the air conditioning unit that is turned on and connected to Wi-Fi. it takes even longer when the unit is off. When using the Google Assistant on any device connected to my home network, it cannot turn on the A/C because it takes so long for the app and air conditioner to talk to each other.

Name: Rafa≈Ç Mo≈Çotkiewicz
Review: Can't browse available washing cycles when I'm not connected. Not nice when I have some time on my commute and instead I'll have to read what's available when I'm home and should just start my laundry and go do some other stuff. App igmores it's connected to the machine with Polish labels printed on it. Not a problem for me but I can see how it could be disappointing for people from my mother's generation. Selection of programs is decent, but lacks "sports shoes" and some are redundant.

Name: Michal Tinka
Review: after last redesign/update, some options for AC were removed and when I try to add/edit schedule, I got only "retry for normal operation". The same in settings of AC unit section. Tried to reinstall app, another LG account, pair AC units again, no success. So I am stuck with schedule and settings from 2 weeks ago without option to change it.. but basic functions as temperature, fan speed are working ok.

Name: Bill Stevens
Review: Stopped connecting to server, after multiple data clears and reinstallations. Works on wife's phone but I am the laundry meister in this house. I have wasted a lot of time trying to get this app to work.

Name: S. Fletcher
Review: Very useful for washers and dryers

Name: Dwight Williams
Review: Don't know why, but this app will not connect to my Alexa app. Not impressed with this LG App

Name: Jillian Garber
Review: I'm not willing to give an app permissions to make phone calls just so i can control my washer and dryer. Could have been a neat featuer, but not at the expense of giving some company control of my phone. The good old buttons on the device will work just fine.  Edit: I am a developer and this response is either total BS or laziness on the part of their engineers (or both). There are a multitude of ways you could have the bulk of your app functionality working without these permissions (including using self-reported locations, disabling some features when location isn't available, or more specific location services permissions (ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION or ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION) without full phone call capabilities. And that's just to name a few).

Name: A Google user
Review: Great app for my ductless units. It was super easy to pair and navigate. I have had them installed for 2 months without issues with connection. I just noticed the temperature setting is showing 2 degrees higher on the app than on the remote, must be a big. It would be great to have alerts if there was a temperature drop below the setting.

Name: DNNS HRN
Review: Convenient to have app notify us as soon as they are finished so don't have to watch a clock while in another room. Washer dryer WiFi also turns Off while they are Off so does not intefer with other WiFi devices. Bought the big 7 cuft dryer washer combination and they do a large load fast. So need this app to keep up with them so the washer dryer are not waiting on us. App also provides a countdown until finished which helps planning when needed at washer dryer to move clothes.

Name: Ivan Greguric Ortolan
Review: The app doesn't even stay open, just shuts down after a popup saying: Network instability, no response from the server, try again later. No support for the message can be found anywhere on the internet...  EDIT: I had to clear the app data and in the end I got it working but then I discovered the fridge was delivered broken and the smart diagnosis was not picking it up. Also would have much easier troubleshooting the issue is there was any way of getting the current fridge temperature (on the fridge or in app)..

Name: A Google user
Review: get notification no matter where you are... at work, out gardening etc. app works great! set laundry and head to work then start remotely 1 hour before getting home and laundry is ready for the dryer when you get home...sweet! I'm always working late or stopping to get groceries so I arrive home at different times... app starting works better for me than time delay. Thank you LG!

Name: A Google user
Review: This app is good. Im using 7kg washer 5kg dryer. The Download Cycle all good, the only thing is the Description of each cycle is not loaded automatically. This is the only bug, it shows the Description when i click "?" button on Download Cycle Help. Please fix this and your apps just great, really. Thanks

Name: Lady G
Review: Last October when we bought our new washer and dryer I was looking for one with wifi that would alert me when each load was done. This app does exactly that and so much more! I love all of the features that this app has. It's very convenient being able to control my washer and dryer with my phone. Plus all of the info that they give you to help keep your appliances in good working order is very important to me. my favorite thing is being able to check the time left on a load from my phone.

Name: richardc1983
Review: On latest update & trying to control 4 air conditioners. Upon opening the app it takes perhaps 30/40seconds before the products load & you can control them, very long delay. Also keep getting some units saying "disconnected" so have to force close app & reopen to reconnect. You can only adjust temperature in increments or 1.0c even though on my wall controller I can go in increments of 0.5c. Have deleted & re-added the units to try fix the slowness and disconnection issues. Improvement needed!

Name: Sean H
Review: the app is pretty limited in features and is locked down for how i hoped is be able to use it. I'd like to be able to modify cycles and remotely start, but you can only do that if you physically set it to remote start. it's great for notifications that a cycle is complete, but that's about it for value.

Name: Thad Caperton
Review: For air conditioner control, there needs to be a tactile and / or visible cue that user has successfully pushed the power button in the app, as currently it's impossible to tell if you've hit it or missed it. Also, it takes far too long for app to connect to air conditioner. Finally, consider changing name of app to "LG SmartThinq" as i forget name of app 100 percent of time I'm looking for it, assuming the app name would start with "LG."

Name: Hannah Shipman
Review: OK but not quite what I expected. Finally got it connected using Android. I couldn't get it to play nicely with ios. I would like to see the model number, access manual, be able to customise wash cycles, etc. from within the app. It does tell me when a cycle has finished and I can start the machine remotely, which are both useful.

Name: saumil kapadia
Review: Application is helpful but few issues they should take care. 1. i should be able to remote start always when machine is connected to wifi. 2. i should be able to customize default wash+dry with washer time and dryer time. 3 energy consumption not showing when u directly use washer rather app. 4. time it shows is not correct. machine always take 1 hour more time to finish then what it shows.

Name: Ravi Gupta
Review: Great app. User friendly.

Name: Biodun's Reality
Review: Efficient and reliable.

Name: A Google user
Review: Very long loading, tried on two devices. Needs to download information when registering a product, and then freezes. Says that there is server error connecting, but in that moment my network is online. Tried to use other network, but also cant download information. Frustrated and disapointed.

Name: TOki DOki
Review: Please bring the last version back. It used to work great! Since the last update, I haven't received any notifications at all. Uninstalled and reinstalled, still no notifications which are set to on. Why does the new version automatically turn on bluetooth everytime you open the app? Last version didn't need bluetooth. App used to send me notifications even if I were miles away from home. App still shows machine status and time which is good, but I need notifications to work again.

Name: J.R. Raith
Review: App gives redundant information (weather), but not helpful information, like which filters my refrigerator needs. Lets me adjust settings remotely and tells me when the dryer is done, which is nice. Just doesn't feel very "smart"; lots of room to make it more useful and helpful.

Name: Jordan Bouzeneris
Review: update to dev team: I'm not so dis-satisfied with wifi issues so much that this ecosystem you've developed, it's like an alexa competitor, but it's not, & also it's compatible with alexa, with 18 servers involved, & you would have had privacy on your side but then you made it worse with no opt-outs... don't get me wrong, I can see the logic in the planning of preheating something or other. Until a lawsuit happens. BTW I noticed the life-shortening wind-down firmware update. just jots off now.

Name: Skyler
Review: My ac unit has "sleep mode" but this is not an option i can control with the app. There are connectivity issues using wifi remote, even when I'm home and using a good strong connection. The app (wifi control) and the remote control supplied with the unit don't play well together. If i use the app, and then the remote when I'm home they pick different settings rather than finding what they are previously set at on unit itself. Hope you fix it all. ‚òπÔ∏è

Name: J Droid
Review: this app thinks the phone is rooted and wont work... the only app I've seen do this. Not even banking apps ... inferior technology the permisisons they ask for are not needed. the excuse LG gives here is false. they dont need to verify location, they don't need to verify storage space, they don't need to verify country. No legitimate app does this. LG is definitely collecting your info and selling it.

Name: John R
Review: Update: Uninstalled and reinstalled from the app store. Looks like it might be working now. Previously: Terrible. Thought this feature was a reason to purchase an air conditioner, but after it performed an auto firmware update, (minutes after the initial download of app) it could no longer connect to my WIFI. I wasted over 30 minutes of time trying to get it to reconnect, including uninstalling and reinstalling the app.

Name: Carlos Perez
Review: We have been using the app for about 2 weeks with an LG 14,000btu portable air conditioner. The app has the On/Off switch, low/high fan, temperature setting with target and actual room temperature, mode switch for AC cool, fan and dehumidifier. Also has the air vent swing mode switch. All switches and settings have worked properly and we are very happy with it. Alexa controls On/Off and temperature settings.

Name: Phill G
Review: Works great with google home.

Name: Isabelle Hwang
Review: convenient. love new functions

Name: Eric Burns
Review: what a horrible app. what good is having something like this when you cant even start the appliance from the app? I can see it running and know how much time is left but cant pause. stop or start a cycle. seems pretty worthless. i thought the whole purpose of this app was to remotely control the appliance which means turning it on, starting a cycle etc. cant do any if that here. dont waste time with this. pointless. so much for a smart appliance

Name: Milton Cooley
Review: Not very intuitive but once you get the hang of things it works well for what it is. Best features are the smart diagnosis and the ability to download new wash cycles. The smart diagnosis detected that my plumbing is backwards, hot water thru the cold water pipe and vice versa. Easy fix and working like a charm ever since. Also it pings my smartphone when the load is finished. Sweet!

Name: Gavin Wilkinson
Review: App won't add TV, it says check for Web OS 4 or higher, the TV has it. Then it asks to select Google or Amazon, neither appear on the TV. So it just stops there. I can't change the region of the TV or of the phone app. The phone app looks like it will change but only gives one country and language option. It's terribly frustrating to go in circles following the instructions. The TV's Web OS and phone OS are capable, just the software is disabled.

Name: redsuperduty1
Review: This has to be the worst app I have ever used..Over an hour spent waisting my time and it still does not work..This goes along with problems with the washer too..6 months old and had to be replaced after numerous repair attemps and now will not function as it is supposed too..This was a almost a 4000.00 set to boot.. Thanks L.G. for a great product !!

Name: Terry Chlebek
Review: The app mostly worked until the most recent update. Now we're lucky to get 1 out of 10 push notifications. Tried uninstalling/reinstalling and re-doing the wifi setup, but still almost useless now. Update: So after 3 weeks of a completely non-functional app, LG has finally released an update that at least restores it to its previous level of functionality. Update 2 (6/23): Broke again. Back to the old version for good since that at least works.

Name: Michelle Mota
Review: I was under the impression I could operate my washer and dryer remotely from this app. I cannot and only seem to have the option to do a diagnosis EDIT Thank you LG for reviewing my feedback. I had the chance to go through my settings and test out the features! It works wonderfully - love that I can program the washer to go off X number of hours (although it would be nice if there was an option to just program the desired time). Count down on washer/dryer is great too.

Name: Kuba Wolanin
Review: SmartThinQ API being closed source, blocks me from using my device in my own local network without this crappy cloud solution. Can't add my air conditioner to the app. Tried several times with mixed results - sometimes it adds it but says "Registration failed", the other time it claims it's "Updating firmware"... Still ending up with using remote controller. What's more, I cannot use SmartThinQ with Google Home in Poland. "Service not available in your region". Worst experience ever!

Name: Adrian Springer
Review: Not much use. We've noticed by using an internal thermometer that our LG fridgefreezer temperature goes up and down wildly. I was hoping this app would identify why but it doesn't really give any indication of what the product does. Only thing it ever tells you about is when it runs a defrost occasionally.

Name: Spooky Weirdo
Review: Invasive, unnecessary permissions. In the comments they say they need permission to manage and make phone calls just to determine your country? Just have a screen with a drop down menu like most other apps.

Name: Mariusz Lotko
Review: Utterly useless. Wanted to use the app for my washer/dryer, but there are no useful downloadable cycles, only really obscure and esoteric settings that cthulu might want to use to launder his delicates. In terms of time saved I'd like to give this app 0 stars because it only cost time to figure out how useless it is. "Smart" my a**.

Name: Katie Janisse
Review: I like that I get alerts when the load is down as I live in a four level house and cant hear the washer or dryer and get distracted by kids often. It sucks you have to hit remote start on the unit for this to work also annoying you cant cancel and select a different cycle i accidentally pressed the wrong button and couldn't fix it.

Name: Ivan Donkey
Review: I cant register my non wifi appliances now that they have changed this to wifi only. My washer and dryer both had no issues using the download cycle with NFC tag until i had ti reinstal this app. Now it requires me ti register my washer and dryer again but suprise, it needs tinhave wifi built into my machines. My machines are not wifi equipted. Hiw stupi is it to remove functionality on an appliiance that is less than 2 yrs old simply because they added additional features to the newer models.

Name: David Hartman
Review: This app wants permission to access everything in my phone, which I consider excessive and a privacy and security risk. Why does my air conditioner need to access my photos, text, email, contacts, moicrophone, camera, storage, phone Bluetooth, and location? The only thing it should need is WiFi unless it's spying on me. I had a little trouble getting my A/C to connect to WiFi but works well except it always turns Bluetooth on and doesn't turn it off. I plan on removing most permissions!

Name: Scott Baitz
Review: Update to developer: I understand why the permissions, but request them at the time they're needed. You can't use the app w/o providing access to location and calling info. This is an app for my household appliances. I accept some features wont work without those permissions, but to not even launch w/o allowing permissions? No thanks. Allowing me to start the use of the app and ask for the permissions you need at the time that I'm attempting to use a feature that needs it.

Name: joe whaddyaknow
Review: if you use LG products in your household then this app will control them all. I have my TV, dish washer, and washing machine and air conditioner all under control in a single app. you can even diagnose a particular device using the app and it will tell you if it has a problem that needs fixing. truly convenient and life simplified.

Name: David M
Review: this app is unbelievably worthless. there is only one possible use for having Wi-Fi connectivity to a washer: to create a custom downloaded cycle. instead of allowing you to do this the app creates 20 possible cycles of which you can download 1 to the washer. all I want is a simple cold wash with 2-3 additional rinses because my kid has eczema. this is not possible. all the preset cycles to select from are random and worthless. everybody online complains about the same thing. LG, please fix

Name: CJ Ottawa
Review: One step forward, two steps back.  I'm using this app on Android to control a single air-conditioner. PROS: it controls the air-conditioner, from anywhere in the world, and lets me monitor indoor temperature. CONS: BRUTAL user interface that wastes a tonne of space. A recent update moves things around slightly, improving some, worstening others. I *wish* I could attach a screen capture - I even made a mockup of how the app could be improved with some minor UI/UX changes.

Name: Christian Venegas
Review: My mother does not use an android phone in the house. She uses a tablet. Problem is this App is not compatible with android tablets. Bad planning on the developers part. Also this app is not so easy to setup with the appliances.

Name: Aiden Wilson
Review: Great application for smart TV

Name: mlou billings
Review: Won't connect washer

Name: Family Shared
Review: I have an LG Tag On washer and dryer. the "tagging" location is inconveniently positioned in front of very sensitive cycle buttons. When trying to Tag the washer or dryer the buttons get pushed easily. The list of drying/washing options is very limited, and actually seems useless. the washing and drying modes I have selected (Normal) show in the app as "This cycle does not exist anymore". There are only 3 washing cycles available by size 1) Single item 2) Small 3) Winkle stop. (no med/Lg?)

Name: Igor Maculan
Review: I'm really disappointed, I've bought a webOS television with a big advertisement that said "Google Assistant compatible" and here, in Spain, I can't connect it to my Google home. What I should do, buy a Chromecast in a 2000‚Ç¨ television "compatible with google assistant"? Searching a little I've discovered that works only in USA. I love the television quality,but I'm thinking to returning it back. I've bought the TV hardware and the OS too and it's not compatible as the advertisement said.

Name: Brett
Review: I'm in app development and KNOW you don't NEED my GPS location and personal data for device connectivity! DON'T LIE! One of the selling points for my $1000 dishwasher was you could connect to it through your phone. Yet after buying it the app refuses to work unless you grant it exact GPS location and personal info which is NOT necessary to simply connect a device to WiFi. I would've returned the washer if app was integral but the irony is the app is horrible so I'm uninstalling it. F*@& you LG!

Name: Damien B
Review: This app is just LG farming personal information from customers. Needed every peice of personal info imaginable for an account. I just wanted to know why my washer had ue errors every load, now it wants me to register the washer to the account to use "smart diagnosis", because it would be horrable if the app would just talk to the washer 2 feet infront of it. (In advance) don' give me that "to determine your country the app needs acsess to your call/photos/everything" why do you need my country?

Name: R Wruck
Review: Difficult to commission Smart LG devices. Must turn off device firewall and disable 5G WiFi. AP does not install on: Nexus 7 and Samsung Galaxy Tab S 8.4. Privacy concerns include AP requires access to location and mobile calls. Not much functionality for all the hassle. Save yourself some time and skip this AP.

Name: A Google user
Review: This application does not allow you to select NFC , a number of the LG products only have NFC capability. This is really a non-starter.All your response did was take me back here with the same issue. Your application does not provide NFC option!!!!!! This really sucks.

Name: Alex Brandt
Review: The app doesnt support connecting to my WiFi with a portable air conditioning unit that shows this icon and recommends this app in the instruction manual. With the correct credentials it keeps providing a login error. I suspect it isn't switching to the 2.4 GHz channel because the two frequencies share an SSID.

Name: t t
Review: registration fails if your wifi password contains special characters (?!#@$&...)

Name: Marcelo M
Review: Is full of bugs, is not possible to add appliances with my Galaxy S10+ because it remains forever looking for it but with my Moto G it works, maybe is an incompatibility problem with Android 9. Smart Diagnosis is a gimmick, I run it with my washer (WD22TS6/WM5000HVA) and it gave me ever error because the door was open when it was not, the LG technical support told me that the Android app is giving too much problems, so don't use Smart Diagnosis.

Name: Thang Duong Bao
Review: Slow slow slow, every time open the app to setup timer for washer, I almost give up because it's too slow to connect.

Name: Dave Hogan
Review: Doesn't work, asks for unlimited access to phone to run, doesn't work for tag on

Name: Brad Diermann
Review: my oven refuses to register. the worst support I've ever seen. I saw LGs comment below. are you kidding me? you dont think I've tried this already? your app support is a complete joke. why is it your oven is the only thing out of 3 appliances that wont register? by the way, this stupid email address they're telling you to email, they MIGHT reply to you once every week with useless things you've already done. it's just not support AT ALL.

Name: Jessica Wright
Review: The app isn't allowing me to register my washer. I got a new phone (Samsung Galaxy S8) and in getting an error for the wifi. Its saying the device doesn't support a 5.0 ghz, it needs 2.4 ghz. Not sure why this is s problem. It worked fine with my old phone and the same wifi.

Name: Sandra Payne
Review: Works great but have to give it 1 star for too many permissions required, there's absolutely no reason at all it needs access to phone, storage, and location to turn on an air conditioner so I have to go thru the frustration of revoking permissions everytime after using it

Name: John Seravic
Review: Using it for a refrigerator with water/air filter. It notified me that the filters need replacing but doesn't give me a product #. Worse yet,.the app doesn't tell me the fridge model # either. Had to actually pull out the manual to find out what to buy. Something this trivial shouldn't be hard to find.

Name: sai chan
Review: LG portable air conditioner, app was working fine then the past few days, you cant adjust swivel or cooling temperature. you can only turn off and on. already tried uninstalling and reinstalling app with new update. using Samsung note 9 and iphone 6. its not working on both of my phones anymore right now. This eventually got fixed. Thank you

Name: A Google user
Review: the app demands to be allowed to make calks and read call settings, allegedly to determine your preferred country and language settings. You should be able to find that some other way. An app I use to set the inadequate delay timer on my LG washing machine does not need to make phone calls

Name: A Google user
Review: When this app works (for Alexa), it provides limited functionality. Nothing like described. But, the app rarely works. I re installed w no change. This function was one of the reasons I chose this LG TV. LG should not advertise this function until it works.

Name: Derek Darby
Review: it connects to our new refrigerator and you could conceivably change temps and other settings but why? it isn't like I'll be out of town and suddenly decide i want my fridge in 35 instead of 37. what it really needs to do is show the current operating temps and give notifications if they go out of range. in response, useless options to be made remotely. monitoring actual current temp is desired

Name: sugars
Review: you must take off your cell phone case and it doesn't seem to work with a 5G Wi-Fi connection. it can take one to three minutes to connect to but initially it takes a longer time than using the app again to connect. they should make this app connect quicker to our appliances

Name: Harry Fabb
Review: Works ok, I had troubles getting things working to start with, heres a few tips. - Open google speach recognition and make sure you have a voice match profile saved and that all terms and conditions are accepted and up to date. - Use the LG account options not thirt party authentification services as they take time to create your account and send relevant emails, do it tjenold fassioned way. - Be patient, say "Hey Google, ask LG" if the responce is normal it worked if not it will twll you.

Name: David Leach
Review: Nice app but new LDT7808SS clothes washer stops communicating with WiFi. Holding WiFi btn for more than 3 secs usually restores connection but not always. Also Remote Start must be selected at washer before app can perform any actions, and selecting this option locks door so that no additional garments can be put in washer. Remote start resets after cycle has completed so must be selected again to enable app to perform any further actions. BTW both washer & my Android cell ph are on 2.4 GHz WiFi.

Name: N B
Review: Loved the app until last week when they did some kind of upgrade to it.  Now I cannot set up a schedule anymore as when i click Add schedule a box pops up saying Notice: please retry for normal operation. when i click on my pre-existing schedule the same box pops up but it changes my schedule forward by 1 hour.

Name: Benito
Review: Your app consumes too much space for me only to use to diagnose my washing machine, you should have smaller size app for individual use

Name: John Alland
Review: App just opens and then crashes. Bought a new LG washer today and installed this app on my Galaxy S7. Made it through setup and got to point where phone tries to pair with washer then it crashes. The App Crashed immediately on every open after that.
