Name: Kenneth Roof
Review: I have downloaded and reinstalled this app numerous times to find it will not run. Plus, your appliances need to display their MAC address somewhere. My network is MAC filtered. An $800 washer and $1000 LG combo with touch controls rendered totally worthless of the expense! Great work LG! Why would I ever but another LG product?

Name: Christoforos Zisis
Review: Piece of garbage. The NFC Tag On feature does not work at all. The app randomly crashes (unrendered handlebars style templates). It's a shame since the washer would be otherwise great.

Name: Ecks Fiftyone
Review: Won't run on rooted devices. So glad I installed and tested this while the salesman at sears was entering all the info into his terminal for the my new $3k washer dryer combo. He wasn't too happy when I told him I changed my mind. Sorry LG looks like you made my blacklist. BTW MASTERPASS will run on a rooted device with a simple warning, but your cheesy washing machine app won't?

Name: viktor de pasquale
Review: Cannot run on rooted device huh, then suck this 1* rating up reeeeeaaaaal good.

Name: Steve See
Review: Latest update made oven control non-functional

Name: Usman Abdukadirovich
Review: Pleas add more functions for the Tag on products

Name: M. Faruq Amrullah
Review: Useful app for LG ecosystem

Name: Blake Mimitz
Review: Easy setup and very helpful

Name: jay dinze
Review: Permissions

Name: Richard Harris
Review: Great product

Name: Supakit Uasamphanchai
Review: Great app

Name: Kale Jenny
Review: Useless

Name: Syahrul Boor
Review: Helpfully

Name: paramjeet singh
Review: Good

Name: Muffe Ahmed
Review: good

Name: sima p
Review: Great

Name: Ricky Gosse
Review: Convenient

Name: A Google user
Review:
Easy to install on my Samsung Galaxy Grand phone. Easy to navigate the LG 
App & download software updates for my LG washer and dryer with Smart 
ThinQ. Just switch to NFC phone setting & tap on the "cell phone" icon on 
washer & dryer to connect. I added a "small load" cycle to my washer & 
venting update to dryer. BTW, I see people complaining about the App's 
permissions, but they are reasonable and necessary - read 3rd qtr 2018 post 
from LG. Thank you LG! I'm very happy.

Name: Andras
Review:
It works basically. I didn't found it and this app can't see it, MAC 
address should have been shown clearly on appliances (it's necessary for 
mac address filtered network for example). If that helps someone, I was 
able to detect the AC MAC with nmcli on Linux with "nmcli dev wifi list" 
and "nmcli -f BSSID,ACTIVE dev wifi list" commands. My main concern is that 
I try to setup weekly reservations on AC with the app and it's clear that 
the timing isn't saved, refreshed and executed correctly with this app. The 
connection to appliance is slow however it's not just an app related issue.

Name: Tejesh Bhaga
Review:
I am running a non rooted Pixel 2 XL running Android 9.0 Pie. I cannot even 
get it to start as it states "Cannot run on rooted device"... It doesn't 
even attempt to open. The development of this app is so bad it hurts to 
even have to write a review. So pretty much I will do what I did last year 
and disable the wifi on the fridge and live with it as a normal fridge. 
Good luck with keeping up with Google APIs that have been out for months.

Name: Chris Tremblay
Review:
Update 2018-07-09: Still doesn't work after update 2018-06-29: already sent 
the details requested immediately after first response from LG and still 
doesn't work and never got a response.. Can't run on a rooted device. 
Except my One plus 3T isn't root protected by default (submitted my details 
as requested and still no change)

Name: David Scott
Review: LG seriously needs to revamp the user experience of this app. I'm not even talking about the appliances the app connects to. The app itself is amazingly unintuitive. Also, there is no reason for it to be over 70MB, and crash if you don't give it all the permissions it wants. (Normal apps will work fine until you try to actually do something that requires that permission.)

Name: Ryan Ephgrave
Review:
This app handles notifications in the worst way possible. It will pop up 
over all other apps instead of just doing a simple normal Android 
notification. It also sends tips through this method that has nothing to do 
with the timer of the washer. Use normal Android notifications!

Name: A Google user
Review: Network unstable message, getting data, rarely connects. Please fix it. It  used to work fine. I regret buying LG and will likely never buy LG again.  This could result in a mass lawsuit if not fixed. Many users have this  issue and support can't fix it, blaming it on their own network.  Update:  Everything is working now after an update, thank you very much.  While the recommended fix of cycling power,  uninstall/reinstall, etc usually works, it did not this time.  We have multiple phones and multiple units and all were affected.

Name: Jeremy Sawatzky
Review:
Utter trash software. Requires totally unessasary permissions and 
connecting to 1 air conditioner is difficult enough let alone having a 
stable enough connection to change the temperture. Connecting 2 air 
conditioners? Even 2 different models? Forget it. Total and complete 
failure to provide any usable functionality. It angers me to no end that I 
paid extra for my aircon units to have wifi functionality and it is 
completely unusable. LG u need to fix this garbage that you are charging 
extra for.

Name: T Peter
Review: Can't connect to smart refrigerator. It's a total zero. Router is about 10 feet from appliance so I know the connection is solid as it is with other devices all the way across the house. It appears to connect to the appliance SSID but does nothing after that. I think this one got loose before it was thoroughly tested.

Name: Michael Fischer
Review:
Smart Thinq app was difficult to use, because the instructions are not 
entirely clear and there are many places where one could make an incorrect 
entry. Almost gave up at one point, and would have given a much worse 
review. Once I was successful in pairing my device, the app communicated 
easily with my new refrigerator and registered my product. I am happy with 
it.

Name: David Goodson
Review:
LG accout. login every time... Why ?? Every time I log in to the account it 
keeps telling me wrong password.. I have to reset password every time I 
open Smart ThinQ and then I have to go through the process of setting up 
connection to a/c unit all over again... what a waste ...

Name: Jordan Vanderkuyl
Review: This is the worst, most counter intuitive app I've ever seen. All I wanted to do was set up my LG smart TV on Alexa. But first I have to download this stupid app, which gives the poorest instructions ever on how to connect the TV to the smart phone. 3 hours later, and I'm still lost

Name: Randy Braze
Review:
This app won't connect. When I contacted LG support, I received an 
automated email asking for the same information I just sent them. Then they 
asked me to rate their software. Here is your rating. I would give it 0 
stars, if possible. What a piece of junk!

Name: Charlie Lehardy
Review: It was a royal pain to set up our refrigerator. It is finally working but the one thing I really care about isn't available. I can set the temperature, I can see how many times doors have been opened and how much power is being used. But I can't see the current temperature! Why can't I see the current temperature when I can do all these other things?

Name: Rob Thayer
Review: What's the point? You have to physically turn on you washer or dryer the stand there holding the remote start button for 3 seconds. Then whats the point of the app? If you don't hold the remote start you can't connect to the machine. Why isn't that enabled by default? Also, with Google home, you can't pause washing or dryg. ? You can stop it, but hey, when you stop it, it turns the whole machine off and then you can't connect to the machine anymore! So... Up the stairs to go power on the machine and start the whole wash or dry over again because it doesn't pick up where it left off, nope, it starts all over again. Not all that smart if you ask me... What would be nice is a standby mode where you can still connect to and operate the machine even if it is off from the app. And for the love of God, enable pause with Google home!!! Everyone at some point leaves clothes in the dryer. Imagine being able to say, hey Google turn on the dryer for 20 mins just to fluff up your clothes or warm up a sweater... Now that's smart thin q ing.

Name: Janos Sebok
Review: Utter piece of garbage, listen to all the negative reviews and don't bother! Won't even connect via NFC, just counting to 100% and say registration error. Connection is clearly detected when in proximity with smart phone, but just won't register the washer.

Name: Eric Bursley
Review:
Doesn't seem to work on the pixel xl. The app just errors out after launch 
and never works. I have also tries it on two other phones. Neither work. So 
three devices from two different companies don't work with this app.

Name: chris kunkel
Review:
Got it to connect to 2 ductless ac's easily. Have fun control of units, ui 
is easy. Dislike how it requires crazy permissions and how I cant set 
schedules. Smartthinq should be able to automate you ac schedule, not just 
be a fancy remote. It came with a remote.

Name: Alexander Coutts
Review: Worked well for a few days, but mysteriously stopped working. Now I cannot connect to any of my AC units, it's been 3 weeks now with no success.

Name: Micha≈Ç DƒÖbrowski
Review: Cannot run on rooted device. Absurd. Is this banking app that root bothers  it? Yeah, I figured it's security reasons, but what is this app capable off that such reasons are at play ? Cranking up your loundry rotating speed while you sleep ?

Name: Derrick Parks
Review:
Application works great and would be a 5 star app but the unnecessary and 
invasive permissions are uncalled for. Apps with permissions like this need 
to be blackballed to get the point across that users are uncomfortable with 
these practices. Engineer a better solution that does not require this data.

Name: Jim Wood
Review: Tried to use this on my LG Fiesta 2 and I could not sign into my LG account, though I'm signed in with the same email and password on my computer, and both my LG phone and LG dishwasher are registered with LG? The app kept telling me my password or email was wrong? I figured, LG phone, LG app, LG dishwasher, what could go wrong? Ended up just uninstalling the app. Updated 8/4/2018 - After being informed that I had to create yet another password for this LG app to work, and that my LG account password isn't linked to the app, the app works fine with my dishwasher. There's not a lot of use for this app with a dishwasher, it did tell me when my load was done, and it did work. I downloaded it mainly for possible future diagnosis of problems.

Name: Hollis Fernandez
Review:
Good report on device updates via phone. It reports status of wash (whether 
wash, rinse, spin or dry, or error) as well as time remaining. Wish the app 
allowed resetting of alarm. But otherwise quite helpful.

Name: Mike C
Review: Absolute piece of junk, totally useless and extremely buggy and slow. I swear to God I will never ever in my life buy any LG product again; even if it's free I won't bother. What a nightmare to own any LG product.

Name: Selby Kendrick
Review: Absolutely terrible app. It's hard to work, bad interface for a mobile device. Accidentally turn my ac off all the time when I'm trying to pull up the tiny arrow to be able to change settings. Takes FOREVER to sync, almost impossible to do it on the train. Not able to create an AC schedule of varying temps (just turning it on and off). AC doesn't work with Google home, can't change temps. I REALLY regret buying this LG AC

Name: Brandon Asp
Review:
Over the past hour, I've experienced a number of errors when attempting to 
use the app and add my washer and dryer to the list of devices. The first 
error is upon launching the app when a message pops up that says "ERROR. 
SmartThinQ app. Failed execution. Try again." I tried again a couple of 
times over the next 15 minutes and eventually the app launched. Next, I had 
to register an account. I chose to use my Google account to register as the 
option was given. A few more errors, waiting patiently for 20 minutes or so 
to get a connection to LG's server, and I was able to get the the apps home 
screen. I then moved on to choosing a device and attempting to get my 
washer or dryer connected to the internet. After 5 attempts with no 
feedback from the app other than "Connection Failed. Please try again.", I 
gave up. You win this time LG. TLDR: This app is riddled with errors upon 
launching or using the app. Limited resources to troubleshoot the errors 
are available online.

Name: Lizz Codner
Review: It needs an NFC compatible phone to work. Which means the app for my new washer doesn't work on either my nor my husband's phone. Why can the printer we have and also the lightbulb company for the LED bulb we have figure out how to use an app for ANY phone, and a major company like LG can only work with some phones? Useless.

Name: Henry Kim
Review:
Nice to get notifications when my wash is done, but app is too slow. It 
would be nice if the notification tells me of the dryer is finished our not 
so I don't have to pick up the wet clothes.

Name: Craig Barber
Review:
Permissions suggested snooping and privacy violations are likely. No reason 
to access my contacts and storage on startup to connect to a washing 
machine. From a mobile software developer, write better software LG.

Name: Kris Tyler
Review: It suddenly requires full access to my phone in order to work at all. I am installing it and calling the authorities. DO NOT USE THIS APP. LG, you don't need to access my phone to find my country. I will tell you. You don't need access to my files to update. I decide if and when I update. You're not fooling anyone with this attempted theft. Look at the latest reviews. I'm not the only former customer. I'll never buy another LG product again. No TVs, monitors, kitchen appliances. I'm done with you.

Name: Renee Carlino
Review:
I love being able to see how much time is left on my washer and dryer 
without going into the cellar to check. No more setting timers to remember 
when to switch the laundry. Very easy to set up too.

Name: Forest Tusignup
Review:
Used to be more useful. I can't seem to find model numbers, a link to 
manuals, available accessories, etc. Really not much point to this for 
someone without WiFi appliances. Am I missing something?

Name: Brigitte Laskowski
Review:
App was good in Oreo but I just had my Google Pixel Cal's OS updated to 
Android P "Pie" on Aug. 6th, 2018 and now your app no longer works. Please 
update your app to work with Android Pie! I'm soon to have an LG Dishwasher 
in addition to my LG Washer.

Name: Zack Schiel
Review: [Edit - LG acknowledged and fixed the sign-up issue. Raised rating to reflect that.] Unable to sign up for account. It tells me the LG account could not be created due to minimum age requirement not met. I'm nearly 40 years old. This message comes no matter whether I choose LG, Google Facebook, or Amazon sign-in. I have a Pixel 2 and also tried my wife's Pixel 1 to the same result.

Name: lohith n
Review:
Very good app, nicely built. gave information of how many times it has been 
without tub clean, for maintenance, and general tips to keep the appliance 
in good condition, there are many other options to explore in this app will 
certainly do that

Name: Avis Chan
Review:
I try to install, but the software require to access my photos, but I deny 
and can't use app. I don't feel comfortable to allow an app to access any 
data in my phone. So I never use the app. Never mind, the app is not 
important.

Name: Miguel Vega-Huerta
Review:
The app works well. Good job LG. My suggestion is over the color scale for 
energy usage. Can it have a numetical option for colorblind people? People 
complain over nothing. Could the pernissions be used to data mine? Yes, but 
they explain the reason why they are used. Even then, not all are enabled. 
Edit 6/7 it's been 2 months. Still no numerical values or anything else for 
colorblind people. This makes the energy usage screen useless to me. I'll 
wait another few months before I update this to 1 star if a colorblind 
option still isn't added. If nothing else, let me pick what colors are used 
for the scale. The idea I sent of numerical values is the easiest but I'd 
you are adamant of sticking to colors, let us pick them.

Name: Carla Springer
Review:
I mainly set up the app so I can know the wash load is finished. Im guilty 
of washing clothes and forgetting about it. Pop up is great. Set up wasn't 
hard once I realized I wasnt pressing the right button on the washer for 
wifi. Lol.

Name: Mathieu Cotnoir
Review:
App doesn't work, asks for calling permissions (what's up with that??) And 
cannot even create an account I keep getting processing errors for 
everything on my S8+.

Name: Nate Batey
Review:
LG... If you want to be innovative and try things like this. Take the time 
to fix the apps that allow us to make our lives easier. I tried to see if i 
simply could and the app is buggy. It wont open. Servers time out too 
often. Please fix this. Id love to use it and use it properly.

Name: Joseph Poli
Review:
Seems to me the first feature you would want in an app monitoring a 
refrigerator is the temperature inside. The second would be an alert when 
the temperature rises. But you won't find either of these features in this 
app. Instead you get useless things like "ice plus" that makes extra ice 
for 24 hours... Pretty much useless... The diagnostic feature doesn't ever 
work via WiFi... I will uninstall it.

Name: Dana Oliver
Review:
FABULOUS DARLING!! My front load LG smart washer is a dream! I have enjoyed 
washing in this well made washer for 5 years. I had an issue with the tub 
not draining after washing a heavy load of small sized washable rugs. I 
have the SmartThinQ app and along with the Smart Diagnosis function on the 
smart washer, I was able to repair my washer easily with the diagnosis from 
the app. Great app and washer so far!

Name: Vladovi Home Svishtov
Review: After one year I can't believe that Google home support for my country(Bulgaria) is not available, this is total nonsense. The last lg purchase for me, you abounded all your older products software!

Name: Caleb Martin
Review: Doesn't work at all. I was able to add my dishwasher to the app via NFC, but beyond that, all the Tag On operations fail at 60% with a message that I should make sure the appliance is on (it is).

Name: Andrew Bakke
Review:
Please allow the optional permissions to be optional. Don't require phone 
until I want to make a call, don't require GPS unless I want to connect to 
WiFi. Updated the app to "improve login", but this is still an issue. Won't 
use until it's fixed.

Name: Marcus Griep
Review:
Application does not work. Claims that my device is rooted, but I am 
running the stock Android for my Pixel 2. I do not understand why the 
software even cares about root, but this instantly devalues all of my LG 
appliances.

Name: John Bazuin
Review: I have installed the app on my s9+ phone and i can see the temp of my lg fridge ,but no power usage or anything else. Surely it can do more than that?

Name: Steve Morrison
Review:
Nothing mind blowing of course, but it is a functional, useful app for 
keeping track of appliances I use every day. In this age of connectivity, 
it's nice to be able to have even less ties to the kitchen and concentrate 
on other things in life.

Name: David W. Scott
Review:
Some improvement to login shows with July 2018 update. Still needs quick 
one click shortcuts to set aircon regular preferences, etc. Every single 
operation of the aircon takes forever, I just want to turn the heat up or 
down, I should not have to click this, wait 20 seconds, click that wait 
another 10 seconds just to see the temp up or down buttons which themselves 
only respond after a few seconds with each click. So annoying. Bas user 
interface design. And also still waiting for integration with Google home 
in New Zealand. Other devices integrate, why not LG Earlier review... From 
over a year ago... Aircon schedule function is not very helpful it only 
works for one on and off operation. I would like to schedule it to switch 
on and off daily. Recurring schedules. E.g. low heat on daily at 6pm, off 
daily at 11pm, etc.

Name: Logan Rosevear
Review:
Can not connect to my OLED TV. They advertise Google Assistant but it 
doesn't work. I will say connection with my washer and dryer does work and 
is a nice feature. I will update my review once they fix the TV issue.

Name: œá Gunning
Review:
Terrible all around. I wanted to get info from LG washer & drier via NFC. I 
could pair devices, but NFC download froze on dryer dl, requiring phone 
reboot before NFC dl worked again. App usability is terrible (in one 
screen, android back button is disabled). NFC process is quirky even when 
it works - very little user feedback, requires trial-and-error fiddling 
with phone position. App requires login (with birthday!?) & invasive 
permissions just to open: does not allow selective permissions overrides. I 
wasted 30 min of my life trying to download data from 2 appliances with 
this garbage app. Device manufactures like LG clearly have no idea what 
good software looks like. I love the appliances, but don't expect any help 
from this app.

Name: Jack Reed
Review:
Great app, finally used it on my LG double door fridge and it did a hard 
reset to pull it out of defrost mode. Went back to working, great deal.

Name: Cedric Schwarz
Review:
Yeaahhh Im not giving out permission to my location, photo library and 
phone call management only to control a freaking washing machine. Sorry 
guys this is a flop!

Name: Marcus Salinas
Review:
I got it to work but their instructions are outdated for newer Android 
devices. For instance, I'm on Android Pie and the setting to turn off 
mobile network switch does not exist anymore. Also I got kind of lucky. At 
first it didn't work and I was frustrated but then it occurred to me that I 
could replicate turning off this switch by just turning off my Cellular 
data. Not airplane mode but just turning off cellular data and it worked 
like a charm. Hopefully this helps those who are having issues. The problem 
is that your phone switches from the device it's connected to and it wants 
to connect back to your WiFi and link it there but what it does if you 
don't turn off your cellular data is it connects to the internet there and 
it looks for your device but it's not going to find it on your cell network 
haha. This could probably be fixed by LG by checking the data connection is 
WiFi instead of what appears to be just scan as soon as you have data.

Name: A Google user
Review:
It was the first time when I tried to connect my topload washer with it but 
after 30+ tries the app is not showing the WiFi networks of washer and my 
router both. It is not easy to connect as the app doesn't allow us to. I 
hope with some new update this bug will let us use the feature otherwise 
there is no use of such features and should stop charging for the 
particulars from customers

Name: Josh Allan
Review: Quick and easy connection to my phone. Just follow the prompts in the app and tag the NFC spot. App is simple enough to not overwhelm with useless options but is a nice companion to our new dishwasher.

Name: Adrian Lyons
Review:
While it does do what it says, it does so incredibly slow. It takes an 
unnecessary amount of time to connect to the units on the network

Name: Ben O'Brien
Review:
Doesn't work. Support line emailed me the most retarded instructions ever. 
I never messaged them back. Truly trash.

Name: c. s
Review:
Trash. Not sure what LG is doing. Doesn't connect well, won't download 
washer or dryer "features", so there is truth to the customer rating. 
Should have gone with Samsung. Gave 2 stars because I'm holding on to hope. 
Complaining on social media next.

Name: Michael Richard
Review:
The app provides the same information as the on-fridge dashboard. It 
provides the temperature settings but not the true measured temp. The 
diagnostics is essentially useless outside of monitoring door open 
statistics.

Name: Richard Powell
Review: Failed execution upon first launch. Pixel 2 XL with Android Pie. Fully updated.

Name: Nathan Greeney
Review: Tried to use app with our washer and dryer for the NFC tag on feature but it just does nothing when trying to register. Never had an issue with other NFC objects so it is an LG issue. Troubleshooting info is worthless.

Name: Raul Cardoza
Review: Does not work. I have an LG refrigerator with Wi-Fi connection. Can get the app to register the refrigerator, but then it fails to connect. Tried a dozen times. I'm a software engineer, l know how to connect devices to networks, but the connection process is too complicated, error prone and at the end of the day it just doesn't work for my refrigerator model even if every step is done properly. Update: after trying many more times I was successful. It seems this app has a race condition or timing issues. You often get different results or different errors for each attempt to connect, it isn't consistent but if you are persistent it finally connects, very frustrating. After all that trouble though the app itself isn't very useful. It's too tedious to enter all your food all the time for that function. The best feature is the alert if your fridge temperature gets too warm. But its a whole lot of trouble for not much benefit. Another update to this review, since the latest app version as of December 2018 this app doesn't work at all, can't connect to my refrigerator, complains that my refrigerator is turned off. It's a fridge dumbasses, if it were off my food would spoil. Deleted the device and tried the setup process again but this app now doesn't even see my fridge, less than worthless, deleting...

Name: jason blomgren
Review: Did nothing. Told me that there were no problems detected even though my 2 year old nearly & $3k refrigerator won't cool.

Name: Matthew Turner
Review:
Very nice app, gives you information if there's any trouble with the 
product, and information if you've neglected the maintenance of it as well. 
I did have some difficulty in using the connection to the dryer and have 
failed to be able to diagnose it,but the washing machine and the app work 
perfectly together

Name: Eric L
Review: The app does not open anymore. It was pretty useless, so its not a huge loss. Do not buy LG products with SmartThinQ technology because it doesn't work. In fact, don't buy any LG products at all.

Name: Jeremy Nelson
Review: This app is trash. Unlike the old lg app, you can't even use this one without both giving them unnecessary permissions and signing in with a social media account so that they can siphon off as much information about you as they can. If you try to create an LG account as an alternative, they want your DOB -- right cause they really NEED that. No matter what date you give them however, the apps says the minimum age requirement is not met. So to me that says they are blocking new accounts and will only accept a FB/Google/Amazon account. Not gonna happen. All I wanted was to diagnose my LG dishwasher that isn't working and has been troublesome since day one. Never again will I buy an LG appliance.

Name: K Z
Review:
Does not connect with the Ac unit.. total waste of time bought this unit 
just because of this feature I wish I checked these review before my 
purchase ... useless app

Name: Steven Olson
Review:
Installed on Pixel 2XL, app fails after getting permissions granted. Tried 
multiple times never got app to successfully start. Bug!

Name: Toby Cook
Review: No notifications since last update. Using a Non-rooted Pixel 2XL on Android Pie. App used to work ok (Though it should use Android notifications rather than splash screen notifications) I'm using for an LG Washer/ Drier combi (There's no option to set this up as such, you have to set it up as a Front load Washer only). The UI is a bit janky and the notifications are now unreliable. At least you can set remote start from the app (For some reason only set programs, not adjust things like spin or temp) but you get the feeling this will likely break at some point too. Not enough focus from LG on the app. The Washer Drier itself is superb, however.

Probably the worst app I've ever used...every update made it worse than the

waste of time. i dont need my LG products to search my photos, manage phone

Name: Brian LaPolt
Review:
I tried for 3 hours to get my new air conditioner connected and was 
unsuccessful. I am good with IT and networking but this app is just plain 
garbage. I even called tech support and the representative was clueless. He 
tried to tell me that my android phone needed to be running a certain 
minimum version of IOS... He then proceeded to tell mto do all the steps 
that the app walks you through. I saw that some people had luck with the 
previous versions of the app so I went and found the .apk for a version 
from last year. Guess what? The app tells you an update is available and 
when you choose not to update, IT CLOSES! You can't even run an older 
version if you wanted to! I didn't buy the AC unit for the bells and 
whistles, but it would be nice if they actually worked as advertised. Also, 
no way the app should need that many permissions. **Update 05/24/2018 - 
Zero response to the email I sent to the developers as requested. The 
update pushed out yesterday has had no effect despite claiming "bug fixes". 
Still garbage. 7/14/18 - the app barely functioned as intended after the 
last update. The update on 7/8 completely broke it again. Also, the 
scheduling is pretty useless if you can only set on or off. How about an 
option to change temperatures at a specific time?

Name: Samuel Lewis
Review:
Very glitchy app. Got it to tag my washer, but won't stay on for

Name: Susan Pariseau
Review: I just purchased a new LG Washing machine after going to Consumer Reports and checking out which were listed as the best in 2018. Part of what attracted me to the washer was the LG SmartThinQ that would hook up to my android phone and give me some reminders that I can use i.e.; a load is in the washer to put it in the dryer, a load is in the dryer take it out, yes I purchased a paired dryer but it has not been delivered yet. Well I can't get my Samsung Galaxy 9+ to work with the washer. I tried everything. I installed and uninstalled it to see if I could log in using my LG Account it would show I had registered my Washer.  It told me I was using a Google acct and I had to log in that way. I tried logging in using Amazon and the device kept trying to download some sort of information that never finished. I had to get out of it to make it stop. So long story short. I have a washer that the program will not work with and am extremely disappointed. Comments were unavailable via my cell phone so I am commenting using my laptop. Assistance to get these to function together. By the way I did try NFC and pay is the way it is listed in the new Samsung phone so that was useless.

Name: Paul Sharp
Review:
The app launches and works fine for me (Pixel XL which some people seem to 
report problems with but I've never had it FC even once) worked fine with 
my washing machine for 1 month, then it stopped sending the cycle end 
notification. Odd, it still sends notifications for other things if e.g. 
you haven't closed door properly. And I can see status whilst running. But 
no cycle end notification any more, and there is no info on 'last wash 
cycle' either or on number of cycles either since it stopped sending the 
end of cycle notification. I've tried removing device from app and 
re-adding it, but behaviour remained the same. I think it is on machine 
side (or LG centrally) that notifications aren't being sent as it stopped 
at the same time on my wife's iPhone. Would be nice to get the 
notifications back...! Update July 2018, behaviour remains the same, still 
no notifications for cycle end and no historical cycle data. Reinstall 
makes no difference.

Name: magicbobNJ
Review: Aug 29 - 2018 Hello,  I was promised 16 days ago that the engineering team would contact me as your customer support spent 1-1/2 hrs trying to get my Smart ThinQ app to register my new LG Washer and dryer.  I received server errors as well as could not register, try again.  Same thing happened with the washer AND dryer with the wifi on the washer and dryer AND I did switch my app to use the washer or dryer network when I was  supposed to do that.  We tried 20 or 25 times.  I never received the promised contact from the engineering dept.  I called again on Aug 17 and Shan and she also spent more than 90 minutes and could NOT get my app to register my washer and dryer.   She told me no worries, she spoke with a supervisor and I would definitely be called tomorrow on the 18th by a supervisor. I NEVER was and now another 11 days has passed.  I want to return the washer and dryer to sears before my 30 day exchange privilege ends.  Today, Aug 29 your rep Joy told me to send this complaint and you would respond SHORTLY.  Please, I need to hear from you today.  Thank you.  I posted as you requested last week and no reply same with your Smarthinq email team

Name: A Google user
Review: I have an LG-LMXS30796S refrigerator. Manage to connect. First issue: When it starts it shows that my fridge temperature is 35 C and the freezer is -1 C (which of course is not true).When I click on it shows 35 F and -1 F which is more likely, but there is no way to change from Fahrenheit to Celsius (I did not find any). I am in Canada and I need Celsius , this is how the fridge is set to show the temperature on the front panel. Fahrenheit has no meaning to me.  So how do I switch the units ? It's a fridge , so this is basic stuff. I tried every settings I found in app, no use.  Second problem, the app works only when I am at home. If I try to connect from work it crashes at start. I know, this could also be some weird setting on my work WIFI but on the other hand all other apps I use do not have problems, so again, why this one ? Is this a "feature" you only can access it at home ? Anyway this is not so major for me, but the temperature units is.

Name: A Google user
Review:
App works perfectly with my new LG front loader washing machine. It was so 
easy and took only a couple minutes to create a new account and register my 
unit. I wish my washer had Wi-Fi but the NFC functions are a nice bonus to 
be able to download wash cycles and keep track of the tub cleaning 
schedule. The NFC did not connect with my phone in the case even though I 
have no problem using NFC with my phone in the case for other things. Might 
be the popsocket on the back and not the case itself. Not too much of an 
inconvenience though. Love my new washer and the app.

Name: Teresa Gordon
Review:
Im using a new lg phone and a brand spanking new lg washer i need the tag 
on to wash clothes that are waterproof...come to find out my new lg phone 
is not supported for this app so now i cant wash my babies sheets. Fix this 
issue lg and quick i spent alot of money on your washer dryer and phone 
make them work together. Not a happy customer

Name: Joe Longtin
Review:
I'm very surprised and disappointed that LG would publish an app without 
exhaustive testing against all the platforms it is intended to support. I 
cannot add an appliance because it fails to recognize that my phone does 
allow Near Field Communication. Sad that LG could not devote sufficient 
budget to the effort after making it a prominent feature on these product 
lines. What a horrible thing for their reputation.

Name: A Google user
Review:
App requires permissions for possible features I don't need. App doesn't 
work without granting those permissions. This is a BAD and undesirable 
development strategy, invasive permissions should be OPTIONAL. And yes, LG 
*says* they respect your privacy, but even when they are sincere, there is 
NO guarantee they can prevent a possible data leak et cetera. Therefore, 
permissions such as these should be optional.

everything (unit, phone, modem) and uninstalled/reinstalled. When I used my 
unit last year with the same phone it worked no problems, don't know what 
happened but I am highly disappointed that I paid the extra money for wi-fi 
on my a/c just to not have it work.

Name: Jamie Rogers
Review:
Really? Way way too many invasive permissions. I would like to read about 
exactly why they need access to some of them... record audio via 
microphone? Read and view SMS? Permissions are the ONLY reason I am not 
using the app.

Name: A Google user
Review:
Sent email ref problem as suggested and pleased to see a new version 
released BUT did not fix issue. Phone registers the A/C and fails to 
download product info. NOT HAPPY STILL NO WORKING. WASTE OF TIME. App 
updated & still not getting product data RUBBISH

Name: David Marcionek
Review: I have an LG front load washer which supports Tag On feature. I cannot get my Samsung Galaxy S7 to connect to the washer even though the phone supports NFC and has it enabled.. This app is useless.

Name: Isaac Ullah
Review:
This is a total gimmick. You buy a washer and dryer with a "tap on" NFC 
connection to your phone. You think there's some value in that. You think 
you might be able to do something simple like pair your phone to tell you 
when the load is done. You find out all you can do is "troubleshoot" or 
download a custom wash cycle. You do not need either of these things. You 
just want to be dinged when your load is done so you don't have to keep 
walking out to the garage to check on your "smart" washer and dryer. But 
you can't, do that.

Name: Al Griffiths
Review:
I have tried many times to connect our brand new LG fridge freezer to this 
app via NFC and it refuses. Pretty pointless advertising the benefits of 
your smart connection when it won't connect. V disappointed

Name: Taylor Garoutte
Review:
App requires location, weird but okay. Also wants storage and phone 
call/contact information, intrusive but okay I suppose. Finally in order to 
use the smart diagnosis or any of the app features you need an account, 
Fine. However, I can't create an account because I don't meet the age 
requirements... I'm 28 and entered 1990 when trying to establish my 
account. Uninstalling and junking my LG units. Terrible application buyers 
beware this selling point is a gimmick.

Name: Cosmin Daniel Dina
Review: I have an AM12BP Air Conditioner and have been trying to connect it to wifi but no matter what I do, it will not work. Wifi was the reason for getting this AC (other than the ionizer) and not getting it to work is a big letdown. My wifi is 2.4Ghz, SSID only uses letters and numbers. I follow the steps, I press the 2 buttons on the remote, the AC beeps, I can see the wifi symbol on the AC, but the process stops at "The applicaton is connecting to the product". If I click on the message, it says: "Error Air Conditioner is either Off or not connected to the network. I have tried multiple times, unplugging AC and reinstalling app. My Router is an Asus RT-AC88U. Devs, if you have any resolution, please reply.

Name: A Google user
Review:
Refuses to let you use the app unless you grant certain permissions. If 
something is needed then let me know when I go to use that functionality. 
This is lazy and poorly designed.

Name: Jason Walters
Review:
My LG air conditioner can connect to the application but I'm left with only 
basic controls. Schedules don't work, Google Assistant only works 
occasionally but won't allow me to change the temperature or mode and the 
AC decides for me what settings it's going to retain when it comes back 
online. This application is useless. Stick with the remote for the portable 
AC. It's faster to fumble around for the controller than to wait for the 
app to load and realize it can't do anything differently.

Name: Brian Syptak
Review:
Needs work compared to other smart device apps. SLOW to start. Finally 
after about 2 months I got it to connect to wifi by turning off my 5mhz 
network temporarily as it only works with 2.4 for initial connection. 
Almost zero documentation on connection.

Name: A Google user
Review:
Just wanted to see what the Tap On feature was all about on my aging LG 
washer and dryer. So... From what I've learned so far, I can download a new 
cycle to my dryer. Okay... I guess that has some value. Oh, and I can 
attempt to use the "Tap On" feature to "diagnose" any "issues" that may 
come up. Well, I tried that and it did work... Only thing is that I havent 
had any issues with the dryer so nothing was available to diagnose, but it 
did give me some drying tips I was unaware of; not bad. For what I've done 
with it, it seems like a decent app...

Name: Pubudu De Silva
Review:
One of the worst apps I've ever seen. Cannot login. It keeps trying to 
login even if I created an LG login or use Google account. Android webview 
system is also the highest version. Please fix this bug. Hope it would be a 
useful app once you fixed the issues. Thanks.

Name: David Schott
Review:
I'm using the app on my new fridge. It's ok and I'm sure it'll be 
invaluable if anything ever goes wrong but they've missed an opportunity to 
give useful information. The most obvious is I'd like to know what 
temperature the fridge and freezer currently are. It tells me what they're 
set to but, since I set it, that tells me nothing new.

Name: Brandon
Review: This app asks for horribly intrusive permissons. There is no good reason it needs access to my phone, contacts, amd photos. You explanation for this in an earlier review doesn't make sense. Other apps store data on my phone wihout "needing to determine storage" and if you need to know which country just ask me. Why would you need my location to control the AC over wifi? The developer's responses is nonsense. I returned the LG AC unit and bought a GE instead. All their app asks for is camera access to scan the QR code on the unit for setup. Once setup was complete you can turn that off and the GE app still works fine. Go get a GE instead. There is no excuse for all the permissions the LG app wants.

Name: Rob Chatters
Review:
$400 air conditioner won't register / sync with the app. I spent extra $$$ 
to get the unit that has wifi. Just keep getting product registration 
error. Please help me. App works fine for my LG fridge.

Name: Christopher Brushett
Review:
Should be able to select 0 stars. The app won't even open. Goes to failed 
execution, try again. So much for connecting equipment to it. Should of 
stuck with Samsung.

Name: Tanner McDaniel
Review:
Piece of junk. Tried to use with my LG washing machine with smart 
diagnosis. Despite all the screeching noises from my washing machine, the 
app would not work. Delete.

Name: James Railton
Review:
Updated review. Better permissions screen when first opened. Unfortunately, 
it still refuses to run without permissions it doesn't need. It needs 
location permissions for wifi configuration. That makes sense. But I should 
be able to revoke it after initial setup. And there's no need to refuse to 
load without access to my phone. That's just lazy development. If I don't 
want to give you permission to my phone, just display the support phone 
number instead if I ever need to call it. Ask for permissions when I try to 
do things that need them. Don't block me from using the entire app!

Name: Whitney MacChoi
Review:
Connected to my fridge/freezer and all the app shows are the set 
temperature of the system. Very useless information. I want to know the 
current temperature. Please update it and include live current temperature 
readings.

Name: Semra Sahin
Review:
Consider user friendliness! If I am going to download a cycle for a washing 
machine, I need to know the details of the cycle. Only a name like training 
is not enough. It is impossible to find cycle details.

Name: Jason Falk
Review:
Not compatible with the TV I bought just one year ago because I cannot 
update to web os 4.0. Last LG TV I ever buy. It shouldn't be outdated after 
a year.

Name: The Master
Review:
Smart diag has been moved into this app. I dont like having to login just 
to run a test. Also the test app would not tell me why the ref is 55 degs. 
Only that since it was unplugged 5 hrs ago i needed to wait 24 hrs for it 
to gey cold .nonesence canned script. The unit has been running for a week 
after lg service and its still not cold. Defective products require 
repeated service calls. And still dont work right. So far morher noard has 
been replaced defrousters and now a factory installed crimp in the cap line 
was removed. Had to pay for all of this and still it doesnt cool. And this 
app says i have not left it plugged in long enough

Name: Corey Ouellette
Review:
bought a WM4370HKA and a DLEX4370K and the nfc feature does not work on 
either of they to connect to this app. using a Samsung s7 - you can hear 
the nfc register but never does anything afterwards on the install

Name: Tom√°≈° Petr√≠k
Review:
How to set the notification from my washer to only appear in the standard 
system notifications, and not show the pop-up window? This behavior is 
completely non-standard, annoying, and totally unacceptable, as it even 
wakes the display (!!!), which can lead to unintentional touches on the 
screen when the phone is in my pocket. The only other option is to disable 
notifications, but I want to be notified, I just don't want to get the 
intrusive pop-up. Let me set to have the notification just in the 
notification panel, just as every single other app does it.

Name: Pat TRSHD
Review:
The permissions required to simply control appliances are far too 
intrusive. Uninstalled as soon as I realized this.

Name: Glenn Buckberry
Review:
Tells me I am rooted. I am not I have ran software to test. Plus I checked 
safetynet and my certificate is valid. So this is a bug and needs to be 
fixed.

Name: Hari Peethambaran
Review: Update review (10-07-2018): A month after my initial review, I wish I could give this app 0 stars as it simply does not do what it is intended to do and 0 stars for LG customer service. I have emailed these guys with screenshots but nothing came from it. Not even an acknowledgement. Shows you how much they care. I have followed their instructions as per their response below, but its a generic how to connect instruction. It fails everytime at the end with the error "Product registration failed". PLEASE DO NOT BUY LG WD1411SBW 11kg washing machine, it does not work with this app.  Original review (17-06-2018) : Stupid app. Tried setting up with LG WD1411SBW 11kg washing machine. Has  got to be possibly the worst designed connection setup process ever. It  just keeps looping in circles. Never actually connects the appliance to the  home network. Yes, I'm using 2.4GHZ network, yes I've got my password typed  correctly. Please fire the developer and how someone who knows what they're  doing. This is not rocket science. Make it easy for the customer, not this  bloody difficult. Gaddamn!

Name: Leon Cruywagen
Review:
Installed without a problem but then refused to run saying it can not run 
on a rooted device. Problem is my device is not rooted.

Name: L R
Review:
Tag on does not work. It gets 30% then an error. Waste of time and waste of 
money buying LG appliances with Tag On if it doesnt even work.

Name: Tim Hough
Review:
Very easy to set up with my 11kg front loader(WD1411SBW) and my phone, 
particularly compared to Samsung's app and 11kg washer which were a pain to 
set up. (that washer broke after 1 wash, so we got the LG) The app is a bit 
sluggish to open and connect, but the "wash complete" notifications work 
great, which was the main feature that I wanted. I've deducted points 
because I can't seem to edit existing washes(like changing the temp, spin 
spin speed etc) which you can do on the machine itself! I also can't see a 
way to create custom washes from scratch, which I'd a shame! If there's a 
way to do the above from the app, then let me know and I'll change my 
rating! I know why they are required but I'm also not keen on the 
permissions required to run the app...seems excessive when all I want is to 
control my washer remotely!

Name: Carson Official
Review:
I have an LG 2018 and Alexa, couldn't pair them at all. Apparently it "may 
not work on 5ghz networks". Sorry didn't realise this was 2008...

Name: Steven McLaughlin
Review:
I have the LG LP1417WSRSM Portable AC, and I am now able to change the mode 
setting finally using the app on my device. Changed my rating from 1 star 
to 5 star.

Name: Doug Wilkinson
Review:
I'm a tech savvy person and could not get a single aspect of this app to

Name: Peter De Gregorio
Review:
The app reported to me that the refrigerator needed new air and water

Name: Florian H√∂hne
Review:
I bought LG appliances so I could integrate with Google home! Unfortunately

Review:
Worked great last year. Just put my air con up and updated the app, not

Review: The AC is next to the router and yet has issues connecting. Seems like LG  doesn't test their products. Horrible app execution. Even after disconnection the AC, rebooting the router and re installing the app it still has major issues connecting. It connects maybe 1 out of 10 times. Needs better developers.

Name: Leo Co
Review:
Takes forever to connect or error message saying not connected or poor 
internet connection. Router is in same space and with excellent reception 
for all of my other devices. Super buggy, not reliable and laggyness makes 
this app useless for its intended purpose.

Name: A Google user
Review:
Works fine. For those who say it doesn't work with a rooted phone, they're 
wrong. Use Magisk for root and Magisk hide to hide root from the app. 
Bingo. It works fine. Takes time to find the NFC and transfer the programs 
but maybe that's because its new to me.

Name: Tom Ridgeway
Review:
The latest update has left this basically useless. More bloat and 
unnecessary items like local temperature... Make it fast and stable. Latest 
two updates caused app to not work at all. I can't use it at all. It's 
finally working again, and fast. Thank you you or fixing it.

Name: David Nagel
Review:
Update June 2018: I ditched my LG phone and got a Samsung. Now the app 
works. Hahaha. Way to undermine your own company, LG! I'll never buy an LG 
phone again. (Love your appliances and TVs though.) In response to the 
dev's questions, no my previous phone wasn't rooted. Your app just didn't 
work. It couldn't even get past the launch screen before crashing. And yes 
I uninstalled and reinstalled multiple times.

Name: Steven Cuttic
Review:
The app won't connect to my LG washer WM4370HKA using NFC. I tried for over 
an hour and found the exact spot that my phone needed to be a few times, 
but the registration failed every time at 30%. I didn't move my phone 
during the registration process. I have never had a problem using Samsung 
Pay with my Galaxy S7 and I use it a few times a week.

Name: Sebastian Jones
Review:
Tried connecting my new refrigerator, followed the directions exactly as 
they're laid out in the app and receive an error message saying it's 
unavailable every single time. Update: Re-installing the app helped and my 
fridge is now paired to the wifi. The app is a little clunky but iverall 
works well. One thing I'm unsure of is how to activate away/vacation mode, 
I haven't found it yet in my limited use.

Name: Lucas Whyte
Review: Slow to load, slow to control, crashed the three times I tried it. I did  get it to control my AC, but it is much faster to climb three flights of  stairs then to wait for this app to load. *EDIT* no fault of the app but I am returning the AC unit: the compressor start up is very noisy.

Name: Basudev Chaudhuri
Review:
The WiFi on the fridge probably increased its price. What's the point of 
this app? Useless WiFi, pointless app. We can track our own groceries far 
more efficiently.

Name: A Google user
Review:
*UPDATE* after days of messing around with this thing off and on I finally 
figured out that when it says the SSID may not contain special characters, 
they also mean that the wifi PASSWORD can also not contain any special 
characters. Setup a guest network, made a basic, insecure password since it 
can't contain special characters, and it connected right to it. Thanks LG 
for your garbage app and garbage security. Will definitely be returning 
this and getting a Samsung. Unbelievable. For those of you having the same 
issue, try that, I'll bet it works. Got a window AC today. Spent 2 hours 
trying to get the app to work. Registers device but will never connect just 
hangs. Tried your very generic response to literally EVERYONE with the same 
AC problem here. Uninstalled the app, disconnected power, reinstalled app, 
still doesn't work, what a shocker. How are you going to advertise a 
feature that just flat out doesn't work?

Name: Jody Emberly
Review:
Update.....thanks for the May 23rd update. The A/C is now working again 
with the app.........Since your update it won't connect to my air 
conditioner. It just said network connection unstable please wait. It 
connect to my Wi-Fi everything is fine on my end it's the app. The phones 
the app ate also up dated so that's not the problem. I installed and re 
install still the same. Pls fix it. You must realize since to may 10th 
update that people are complaining

Review:
The app is so slow.. My internet is a 75mbps.. every click in the app I do

Review: Your 09/05/2018 terms of service changes "For enhanced service" made me discontinue use of your service. Sorry LG, I'm not gonna continue giving you access to my device info so you can whore it out to third partied or data mine and not be held liable if you have data leaks. Closing out all LG accounts. People concerned about your data, take the 10-15 mins and read the terms of service. It's not good!

Name: Kyle Thompson
Review:
Works for about a week before my ac stops connecting to wifi. Really wanted 
to use this away from home but after reading other reviews, it's clear LG 
doesn't care. Ac works great, but Pointless app. Just use the remote...

Name: Kyle Fairhurst
Review:
Update: I can connect to the app if I disconnect from my WiFi connection 
and use wireless data. Not ideal, but at least I can use the app now. I was 
able to connect the app to my new window AC unit easily, but next day I 
can't even open the app. I get stuck at "Failed Execution. Try again." and 
can't get any further. Huge bummer since remote access to the AC was one of 
the primary reasons for my purchase. Using an unaltered Samsung Galaxy S7. 
I have uninstalled and reinstalled several times, with no luck.

Review:
Literal Garbage, App Failed Execution. Love paying over 2400 USD for a 
laundry pair and get shafted because a dedicated button that relies on the

Review:
Love that I can adjust the rinse aid usage and have extra options for

future so I can use other functions of the app.

Review: Takes forever to connect (1 out of 20) or error message saying  my AC is LP1417WSRSM "Getting the data and then "error air conditioner is either Off or not connected to the network check product networks OK" I have perfect WiFi for all other devices. Called tech. support - he said I am not the only one.suffering Let's see if they fix it.

Review:
Totally useless ! Just bought LG Washer, download this huge memory (200 MB)

Name: Peter Jacobs
Review:
The app used to work with our Heat pumps but now it mostly times out. After 
10 minutes it may show 1 of 4 devices, but when I select one to control it,

permission to use my phone or access my phone number and identity. Turn 
those requirements off and I'll consider using your app. Until then, we are 
done. (Edit) after deleting the app and reinstalling it I was able to 
connect to my heat pumps. But, it is the only app on my phone that 
immediately stops working when I disable Location and access to my phone 
function. The App is disabled again until LG respects my privacy.

S7. Just picked up the A.C. unit from my local DIY store, and had 
everything completed in under 2 hours.. Bring on the Nor-Cal/Central Valley 
heat !

Name: James Miras
Review:
This review contains 3 updates over 2 years. 2017 - Forced to use this app 
instead of LG Smart app - was very happy controlling my LG mini split 
system remotely with the LG Smart App. I had no issues with the LG Smart 
App whatsoever. I was very happy. But as of this past weekend I was forced 
to upgrade to this app now and having all sorts of issues connecting to my 
AC / Heat mini split. What once was a very easy process of managing my 
units has turned into a nightmare. I constantly get errors saying that my 
product is unavailable or connection cancelled. What makes matters worse is 
these units are installed in a secondary home so remote capability is 
paramount. Will not buy LG products any longer based on this experience. 
Sorry I made this mistake up front. You live, you learn. April 30 update - 
have sinced fixed the issues above and added 2 more devices to control. 
Easy setup and love the app and its design. You need to power off the 
circuit for the install of the wifi module you are installing. Then it will 
be recognized in the setup. Working as advertised so all is well!! May 23 
2018 Update... App sucks again after updates. I'm controlling 5 Wifi 
modules for 5 Mini-split AC units. Takes way to long to pull the data for 
each unit and then gives a "network unstable message" after I select a unit 
to manage. After this it needs to refresh all 5 units and takes forever 
again. Never-ending cycle of madness. Stabilize this app!!!

Name: Collin B
Review:
Washer and dryer registered and notified their status for a week or so and 
then just quit one day. They still wash and dry but app connectivity was 
nil. What ended up solving this was to set up a separate network with no 
security and restricted it to only allow the washer and dryer to connect to 
it. Both connected right up and report their status again. The remote 
notification is a nice feature that influenced our purchase. Lucky Goldstar 
clearly expects everyone who buys their products to be a network engineer.

Name: Jason Vigo
Review:
I just purchased 3 LG Air conditioner. The app doesn't work I have eero 
network and it's in the same room as my LG air conditioner and still not 
working. I Followed the app instructions and it finds the network work and 
registers the AC to the app. But the app always shows ( getting data 
information but doesn't change. ) I have a appointment for a technician to 
come out to resolve on the 5/23/18 but if not working after that I will be 
returning the 3 air conditioners I have just bought.

Name: BeLar
Review:
I went through the setup several times. Everything is appears to be 
successful, however when I try to use the app to control the air 
conditioner, it always tells me that the device is not connected. I go into 
product details and sure enough, it is connected to my WiFi and 
registration is complete. I could have saved a ton of money but going with 
a conventional air conditioner and a WiFi connected receptacle.

Name: Megan Hess
Review:
App is not working as promoted. Dryer is connected to wifi. App used to 
find the data so I could download new cycles remotely. App claims that 
remote start is turned on but then will just keeps searching and searching 
for dryer status until claiming it's off even after the app stated that 
remote start was turned on. So frustrating to have a feature that doesn't 
work due to a faulty app. Get your S**t together LG.

Name: A Google user
Review:
Wish I read the reviews here before purchasing our air conditioner! 
Connected once! Uninstalled reinstalled, still doesn't connect. Probably 
returning air conditioner and going with another brand. Major fail LG. 
Think I'm done with LG.

Name: Rich Chase
Review:
Permissions are excessive, and requires me to enter my Wi-Fi password into 
the app after signing into an LG account, and giving the app 'call' 
permissions. My phone already has my WiFi password. This dir a different 
reason. This is much more than a WiFi app. It's an Internet and phone call 
app for my dryer to phone home to LG. No thanks.

Name: Sean Quinn
Review:
Notification UI needs to be redone, plain and simple. If an appliance pings 
one's device, the notification is not a proper notification tray type 
notification, it is a pop-up window circa Android Donut. How this made it 
into production without being rethought is beyond me, as an unattended 
device will drain of battery due to the display being held on wake lock by 
this inane notification. If you must use this app I highly recommend 
turning off all notification function to prevent battery drain.

Name: Madhu Aravind
Review: Looks like a really amateur app. Have been trying to connect my new lg washer dryer to my android phone without any luck. No real aids to trouble shoot the issue. A real pain!

Name: Libor UK
Review:
Smart Laundry was perfect. This update make it far too complicated, not 
user friendly at all! Mainly women washes laundry, not IT guru's! Why do 
you need permission for camera, contacts, etc? Spying LG customers? Size of 
app is too big. All over - this update is a disaster!! Think before you 
act!!! This will keep me away from other LG products if needed something 
else than washing machine...

Name: Justin
Review:
LG's "smart" technology is a joke. Anytime I try to pull up my dryer in the 
app it either gets stuck on "getting the data" or pulls up what I'm 
assuming is supposed to be the control panel for the dryer but is only list 
a few random characters and blank space. LG should be embarrassed about the 
obvious low quality of this app and their smart appliances.

Name: Eric Driscoll
Review:
Had a mandated update on the app, now all I get is connection issues. This 
app is now useless unless LG tech corrects this issue. However, judging by 
the previous comments, nothing is being done about it. It's a shame....

Name: Tricia Andrulot
Review:
I just bought new washer with Tag On. Can only download cycle that aren't 
available. Also, no status on current the machine cycles. Deleting this 
garbage app. Worthless waste of storage space on my device. Love the 
washing machine.

Name: Brandon Ramsundar
Review:
For the past few months I was searching for a wifi enabled air conditioning 
unit to add to my home. I bought one from LG in hopes that I wouldn't have 
any issues. I mean, we're talking about a company who has years of 
experience and a high standard in quality control. Well, I was very 
disappointed. I tested the unit right next to my router and the only result 
were intermittent connectivity and the app telling me the unit was 
"offline". Come on LG, fix this and step up your game!!!!

Name: John T
Review:
Got as far as the app asking to get access to basically everything on my 
phone - photos, make calls etc and then thought I better read the reviews. 
Saw how terrible it is and uninstalled. Doesn't do anything for fridges 
other than give you the temperature anyway. Not a lot of point to it.

Name: Shanmukha C
Review:
This is one worst app, I tried may be like 20 times to set my refrigerator 
on wifi, every time it says cannot register or failed to connect. Now 
thinking why did I purchased this refrigerator better to go to samsung 
where things are much better apps

Name: Rob Alexander
Review:
Worked at first but now usually refuses to connect to my air conditioner, 
says "network connection is unstable" even though the WiFi is quite good in 
the AC location and phone location. I can usually eventually connect to 
where I can hit the power at least, but it almost always fails to get into 
the detail settings where you can change temperature and fan speed and so 
on. Appears to have started this after an update.

Name: David S
Review:
This app worked great for the past 5ish months but after the recent update 
there is a constant issue with connectivity and slow load times when it 
does work, the supposed bug fix update added bugs where before I had none. 
Estar for the precious build.

Name: C Haver
Review:
App unreliably gets data from washer/dryer (just keeps saying "getting 
data"). Wish you could change the push notification sound (to make it 
unique sounding for this app compared to my regular default notification 
sound). Wish remote control would remain on once I turn it on. Needs more 
functions with Alexa skill (such as washer/dryer cycle end notification). 
Way too many permissions needed. Keep updating the app please to improve it.

Name: Joe Smirti
Review:
I love the refrigerator. The app is easy to install and register. My router 
is 20 feet from the refrigerator in a direct line of sight and it fails to 
maintain connectivity. Essentially, the app is worthless. I was hoping all 
the poor ratings on here were inaccurate. They are not. Fortunately, 
uninstalling the app is super easy too.

Name: Nathaniel Walter
Review: Wow LG I expect better from you. I just bought a brand new washer and dryer. They work great, but the only thing that works with the app is the notifications. How am I supposed to start them away from home when the app is always "Getting the data...."? They registered to my wifi easily, but they will not work with the app. I can't start them or at times even see the status. My washer shows as off right now when I know it is on and it is in the middle of a 5 hour delayed start. I had to do the delayed start because the app won't work well enough for me to start it at later today while I'm away. You need to let your customers know what is going on with your app and what is being done to fix it. This app and it's functionalities were one of the biggest purchasing factors for me. I sure hope you are fixing this. If not, I will never buy another LG device again. To be honest, I'm looking for a new tv and refrigerator now. LG is not high on my list as I apparently can't trust you.

Name: Austin Best
Review:
Completely f'n useless. Will not stay connected to device. Thankfully I 
bought Samsung washer & dryer, works perfect! Was just hoping something as 
simple as an ac unit would work! Nope. App is junk as everyone is stating.

Name: Anthony VenGraitis
Review: It seems LG checks these reviews and occasionally responds, so I hope this message reaches someone on their team and it can be routed to the appropriate person  LG, I installed the app to work with my washer and dryer and it worked fine for months.  On May 11, there was an update to your app.  Since then, the app no longer finds my dryer and occasionally can find my washer but when it does, it takes a very long time.  You've been directing Google Play reviewers to read how to install your app, but I suggest sending a message to your app development team and let them know many many users are complaining that the May 11 update broke something in the app and it's not working properly.

Name: Richard Jay Nussbaum
Review: I echo the accounts of other recent reviewers: Whether due to a recent app update or some other change, the LG SmartThinQ system is now basically unusable for me. Although my air conditioner is connected to my wireless network, the LG SmartThinQ app either does not see it at all or, after an extended delay, recognizes the air conditioner but then is unable to control it and gives a network error message. Phone tech support seems to be completely unaware of this widespread problem (treating it instead like a problem with my individual unit or settings) and does not offer effective solutions.

Name: Ashley Hakker
Review: The entire Smart ThinQ service appears to be borderline inoperable.  I was looking forward to having an app to control my new air conditioner but while there's no problem in configuring to get online, it's connectivity beings so infrequent that the function might as well not exist.  Some other reviews suggest it is a fault by an update from LG, I'm unsure, but my network itself shows no problems.  I hope they fix it but at this point I can only say that LG's Smart ThinQ feature should be avoided by consumers entirely.

Name: D Bowen
Review:
After I finally got this app to work with my air conditioner it seemed okay 
for the first month but after that it has network connection issues? None

I wish I could say I liked this app because I love the fridge. But in

Review:

Name: Igor Ivlev
Review:
Doesn't work at all, opens and gies to black screen with few icons and

Name: Ray Hastings
Review: I have a Galaxy S8. I gave up after trying to get it to work with my air conditioner. Uninstalled it.

Name: Richard Tivey
Review:
Finally got this setup but it's not easy. The app asks for way to many 
permissions - all I wanted was the status of my washing why do you need 
device storage, contacts, camera, microphone, etc just for that! The only 
big thing I can understand you might need is location and that's at a push. 
On the comments LG have left for other people who have complained about 
this; usim info to get then country - do you really need to do that? Can't 
you just ask the user for their country or use the location service which 
you have also asked for permission for? And storage to determine if you can 
install the app?? Huh? How can the app run something before it's installed 
to determine if it can be installed..? Play store manages all that. sorry 
but I'm a software developer and it all doesn't sound right to me... Anyway 
now its setup I can view the status of my washing but push notifications 
never work. I tried a plan b of connecting the account to Google home, 
first issue is you can't use the standard LG account I setup instead you 
need to link to your Google account. But after going through the hassle of 
registering again with my Google account and linking the washer to it all 
that I get in google assistant is 'LG isn't responding at the moment' :-( I 
then realised you can link the lg account to if this then that (ITTT) wow I 
thought this would be cool, so gave that a go... But I can't even link the 
accounts up for that I just get "device does not match region settings. 
change region settings" when I sign in to the account, ahh so frustrating! 
So basically it's a fail. LG seem to have had lots of really good ideas but 
the technical implementation is really disappointing. Hopefully given time 
then it will all get looked at but it's really not up to scratch at the 
moment, I'm amazed it all got through their QA process! Sorry LG Update - 
Just gone down another start for answering with your standard reply!

Name: Richard Espinal
Review:
Worked fine when initially installed, controlling my 4 split units but now 
it never connects, constantly showing the devices as off and unable to 
update.

Name: mannusha sri
Review:

it was working fine.... but they launch an update and now isnt working

Name: Mace Moneta
Review:
Edit: The non standard lock screen notification keeps the phone and screen 
awake indefinitely, rapidly draining battery. As a result, I've lowered my 
rating an additional star. When the app asks if you have a touch panel, 
they mean an LCD or OLED type screen, not the touch button type panels. It 
took me hours to figure out that my "touch button panel" wasn't a "touch 
panel". How about just asking for the model number? The UI needs work in 
general. It's slow to start up (on a Snapdragon 835 with 6GB RAM and 100Mb 
WiFi throughput). It would also be nice to be able to customize the 
notification sounds for each device, so I could get "The washer is done" or 
"The dryer is done", etc. instead of generic notification tones.

Name: Jeff Rowe
Review: It worked with my refrigerator for one week. Now it can no longer connect. The WiFi icon on the fridge just flashes. Terrible. I'm thinking to return my expensive fridge.

Name: Daniel Castellanos
Review:
I'm rating this only one star for now because I can't use this app. I can't 
even login. When I try to login with my username and email I am greeted 
with an error message "Attention. Device does not match region settings. 
Change region settings." Does this mean my phone is set to the wrong 
region? Does this mean my account is set to the wrong region? Does this 
mean my appliance is in the wrong region? Does this mean my IP geolocation 
is showing me in the wrong region? This message is so obtuse and unhelpful. 
Additionally, I don't know how to take a reasonable action based on the 
suggestion of this error. I am an American who speaks English, but I often 
work and live overseas. My home base is in the USA, but I spend most of the 
year in various locations overseas with corresponding appliances in each 
country. My phone is a Google Pixel 2 XL with Project Fi, which I use 
because of its great international roaming capable SIM card. Each appliance 
is set to the region where it resides, and would be detected as such by IP 
geolocation as well. Does LG expect that I change my phone's region 
settings every time I fly to a different country? Does LG expect that I 
have a different phone for each country? Does LG expect that I set 
appliances in other countries to the US region? Does LG expect that I 
create a different account for each region? All of these solutions seem 
unnecessarily complex and inconvenient, and, combined with the unclear 
error which doesn't really tell me where the problem is, deserving of one 
star. LG, either fix your system to more easily support users with multiple 
residences, or provide a clear solution on how to use SmartThinQ in my 
situation. If you can help me with that, then I can actually review the 
usefulness of this app.

Only legitimate use at this time is alerts that it's complete.

Review:
Too many permissions. Why does my dishwasher need to know where my phone

them. No thanks, controlling my dishwasher from my phone isn't worth that. 
EDIT - LG says they need all those permissions for "support". Ok, do like 
EVERY OTHER app and ask when appropriate, don't close the app at load when

Review: Very slow app. Used for washer. Takes 5-10 minutes to start and makes user read it's logo. No extra benefit as the down loadable cycles only add names. The options are very similar to one of existing cycle. You cannot create your own cycle also. Once you review all of them then you will know that you don't need a download and probably this app also.

Name: Mark Whitehouse

The only reason I installed  this app was so I could download a dryer only function to the machine.  Deleting app now as it has unreasonable permissions (wanting access to make phonecalls and monitor my calls. No reason for this except blatant marketing)

Review: Connects to my LG kitchen appliances just fine. Finicky on my laundry. My fridge was being difficult, but after unplugging it for 10 seconds, it connected to the app.

Each time it would show it's connecting and getting info, then it would show connection failure stating I wasn't entering my correct password to my modem which I know I was.  Right now 1 star. The app tells me to press and hold the wifi / wifi connect until the connect icon starts to blink. Can you please tell me where the heck to find the wifi connect on my LG wt7200cw washer? I looked everywhere online and there's nothing that tells me how to find this or how to connect my washer to this app

Name: Eugen BƒÉlintescu
Review: Another version of this app that force closes.  You should remove the word "smart" from it's name,  there is nothing smart about it or the people who make it.  And I still can't use all of my washing machine's functions although I paid for the whole package. I don't understand how Google allows such an app here when most people can't use it.  And I don't understand how a company such as LG treats it's customers this way by being incapable of writing a damn working app.

Name: Jeff Page
Review: Useless. You have to turn on the washer and dryer manually to use this REMOTE app which is ridiculous.  It would be like having smart lights that you can only operate remotely once you manually switch them on.... EVERY TIME you use them. Why wouldn't the remote stay on and the washer dryer stay connected to WiFi when asleep like EVERY OTHER SMART APPLIANCE ON THE MARKET? Embarrassingly terrible smart applicancea and app.

Name: Rodger Graham
Review: After reading all these reviews I didn't even bother to download just to get a simple text that the laundry is done.... And every LG response is that same copy and paste BS that's full of bad Grammer the kind you find  in the cheapest made in China product manuals with every person still having the same problems

Name: Gabrio Frantzen
Review: The app is asking me to press WiFi Reset in the WiFi Menu, after selecting More Settings under the Settings button.  I don't have any of these buttons or menus, they don't exist anywhere.  I do have a twin wash as in the picture, I do not have a jog dial. The manual has nothing on it, It mentions a gateway requirement....  Does it want me to use the app to connect? While the app wants me to use the settings menu on the machine? Come on! Life was good.   Ooooh, stupid me! Of course! Got it connected! Simple really, just don't follow the instructions.  1.Answer no when they show a picture of your machine. 2. No matter what they ask you to press, like a boss, just press and hold the Delayed End button until the WiFi icon starts to blink. 3. Wait a few and check your app, cool app by the way.   2 more stars

Name: A Google user
Review: The app never opened after installation. A brand new washer and already one major feature cannot be used. That is utterly ridiculous. I want a full refund and I'm buying a whirlpool

Also, I saw somebody complaining that they bought  their washer and dryer because of the app. How stupid are you? Buy a WASHING MACHINE for how well it washes or the reliability, hell even just because you like the design. To purchase anything because of an app is just dumb and you get what you deserve.

Review: This app is a total joke do not download it. It asks you for your birthday and then tells you you do not comply with their terms of service. I must be too old or too young to own a dishwasher. At least I know that I'm old enough to know how to uninstall this app now
