Review: BS app, wants to know way too much about you before you can get started.... FB, you can location, access to make calls, and modify media, to date of birth and agree to three separate terms... Duk Off.

Name: Pat Kelley
Review: App sucks, crashes immediately. Tech support who responds to poor ratings is equally incompetent as they continue to request emailed screenshots of an app that shuts down the INSTANT you touch the icon. I'm sure a screenshot of my app page emailed to them will fix everything.....NOT.  Old version is also gone, of course.

Name: Jeffrey Bingham
Review: The app works perfectly, as designed.  The trouble is with the instructions. Both the manual that came with my washer and the online manual are completely wrong.    Personally I had little trouble getting it going.

Name: Tanya Hughes
Review: Push notifications don't work! I'll get a notification of cycle finish anywhere between 12 and 24 hours later... often in the middle of the night while sleeping! Even after I turned off the push notifications in the app it continues to notify me at annoying hours even after I've put the laundry away. So now I went into the phone battery and prioritized this app for notifications and still it does not work. So I turned it all off in the app again and now also turned off in my cell app notifications. Stupid app. Worked the first week and now it's garbage! Come on LG... you should know how to fix this!

Name: Mike Compart
Review: This app was uninstalled within 5 minutes. To many permissions (no good reason for location to be shared), plus it was over 250 MB by the time I got to the point of logging in. Don't waste your time.

Name: Gary Pugsley
Review: So smart it needs access to location, phone and files or it won't open. Invasive rubbish.

Name: A Google user
Review: Two stars because I'm hopeful for the necessary improvements. Right now the app deserves one: SmartThinQ is not compatible with Amazon Alexa. The app itself doesn't actually do anything.  Pairing my appliance to my phone (Huawei Mate 9) is a pointless exercise. Want to turn the oven on and set the temperature? Walk to the oven and fiddle around for the NFC spot. How about changing settings? Same pointless thing. The app doesn't monitor the oven, nor does it send notifications. I reckon the crux of the problem is that there seems to be no way for the app or the appliance to connect to my WI-Fi. For what it does (which is nothing), it asks a LOT of permissions. Again, I'm hopeful that sometime soon the app will actually minimally function.

Name: Cas Pearson
Review: So it took a couple of weeks and a few chats/phone calls/emails to finally get this app communicating with my washing machine lol.. but I'm hooked up now so you can start collecting my data ;) I won't ever be using the app to remotely start my washing machine haha but as a reward for manufacturing a washer that allows me to choose the water temp, depth, cycle intensity, soak, extra rinse, rinse only, rinse speed and more! I will allow you to get some stats on how the washer is used :D Thanks.

Name: Koikoi N
Review: Download successfully, but failed to load application on Android v7.0. Guess what phone this is crashing on LG? It's your LG G5 phone that I'm using, wow! This application really needs to be fix LG.

Name: Sunshine Vaughn
Review: I don't understand the point of having remote start if you have to push the button every time you turn the machine on should the machine not pretty much just stay on at all times this just doesn't make sense

Name: A Google user
Review: Needs access to make phone calls and check the status of my phone. Needs access to determine my exact location of my phone even when app isn't running and I'm not home. What the hell?

Name: Nigel elliott
Review: Doesn't work with Google Home! In Australia, even though the app shows in the google home list of connectable things. One of the main reasons I bought the LG air conditioners, so pretty disappointed. The app is ok, but so slow.

Name: Nishant Singhal
Review: Not developed with the care LG claims it takes to make it's products. Did not even help diagnose my refrigerator no cooling issue using SDS. No info on the problem on a new fridge makes it pointless to have the app.

Name: Daniel Chesson
Review: LG, you should be embarrassed by the user experience in this app. After registering new products on the web, I went ahead and created an account on the web. Then after downloading this app, I tried to login using the credentials I created for registration. Did that work? NO. I had to create a separate account, which does not recognize all the data previously entered. So now I have two LG customer accounts, WITH IDENTICAL CREDENTIALS AND INFORMATION, to access the full feature set of what I've purchased. It's absurd to have to register to use an app to access devices only on my own LAN, but it's doubly absurd to have to register twice through the same company, and it's downright terrible that there is no internal data sharing at LG. I only hope that the hardware experience is better than the software, this does not present a good picture of how LG thinks out how its customers engage with the brand.

Name: Marius Luca
Review: App won't even start (One Plus 3) for a washer+dryer. I'm glad I didn't purchase the more expensive wifi version and will definetly avoid getting a dishwasher based on this feature.

Name: Esta-Jane Middling
Review: UPDATE: Originally I left a 1 star review. In May 2017 when I originally purchased the machine I couldn't get the phone to connect via the tab at all. It connected with other appliances so I knew it wasn't an nfc issue with my smartphone. Fed up of having to manipulate cycles for my wools (surprising it isn't a standard option anyway) I decided to give it another go. I downloaded the app again and then when it came to pairing with the phone it was instant (I placed it in the same place as last time so defo wasn't me). Clearly the developers have listened to customers and updated the app. I found a wool cycle and downloaded it, phone didn't even have to be right on top of the machine either just hovering nearby, and the cycle reset on the washer and was ready to go. This is exactly what I wanted so you deserve the newly updated 5 star rating guys üëå  I'm sure there are other features too but this was my bug bear not getting it connect and it's now fixed so I'm looking forward to seeing what other features I can use :)

Name: P
Review: App needs fixing - simply crashes when trying to open. My phone is not rooted so should not be an issue.  I will update review if you can get an update out to fix this.  In response to your reply - I downloaded the app, click on the icon, the app flashes up then crashes. I don't know what more to say. Will uninstall & just use the buttons on the front of my new washing machine.

Name: Chuck Brackett
Review: LG, someone before me posted a question about why your app needs access to way too much information - IE pictures, storage, phone, etc - in order to turn the app on.  Your response, pasted below, is grossly inadequate.    "LG Electronics, Inc. February 8, 2018 Dear.Jamie I'm sorry for the trouble. About permission, we don't collect any information. And we're in progress of developing the new version that explain the reason why the app need the permission. Please wait.. And I'm sorry again."  The answer is that your developers are lazy.  There is NO reason that your app needs all this access simply to download cycles and remotely control the machines.  The only reason you'd ever need that is for troubleshooting.  I know it makes life easier for your devs to make it mandatory instead of actually developing the app in such a way to make it less intrusive, but that's what they get paid to do.  Remove that requirement and you'll have a fair number of happier customers.  Further, I agree that the app, so far anyway, seems fairly useless for anything beyond downloading cycles.  Perhaps when I have a problem that needs to be troubleshot remotely I'll find it useful, but for now, no.

Name: James B
Review: Last update broke the app. Will not even open even after uninstalling and reinstalling :'(

Name: MANAS RANJAN DAS
Review: SO MANY BUGS üòßüòßüòßN TOO MUCH TIME TAKING 2 OPEN THE APPüò©üò©üò©. ALSO NOT USER FRNDLY FOR SENIOR CITIZENS üëéüëéüëé

Review: This app won't work on my brand new LG phone. Love LG's phones but disappointed with their apps...

Review: crash!! couldn't even open it. downloaded it twice. crashed!!!

Name: Arman Shahh
Review: Absolutely useless despite over 90 MB of size! Never think of installing it.

Name: A Google user
Review: Why do you need access to phone calls , msg, gallery!!

Name: Jays Phone
Review: Edit: STILL NOT WORKING, STILL NO SUPPORT FROM LG! THIS APP DOESN'T OPEN it FORCE CLOSES! Android 6 & Android 4+ devices. RIDICULOUS. - Feb 17th.   Like this comment so we can get some support rather than an automated answer, the highest rated comment which shows first says it's all fine, which it clearly isn't. Many people having issues and an app rating of 2! Seriously LG???  Original post:  Just bought an LG Titan washing machine with apparently Smart Thinq technology. Doesn't work at all, the app immediately closes as soon as you try to open it, using a clean Honor 6x android 6 install, same as I see another person in comments using (without success too) Not rooted so that isn't the problem. Found an earlier version of the app, v1.8 which actually shows the app loading screen but then notifies of an update to 1.92 and won't continue further without updating, so catch 22. Really annoyed as this was part of the reason for buying this machine. Please fix this app else I'll be switching to a Samsung machine. Unacceptable.  Edit: As already stated, the app simply won't open. Tried via my Honor 6x phone running Android 6.0 Emui 4.1.3 Kirin 655. My Samsung Tab running Android 4.4, none of the devices are rooted. Name: WILSON CUARTAS
Review: LG automatically download an upgrade to our Smart ThinQ washer and after it the machine doesn't work anymore. After several weeks of complaints the factory never responded for the damage. We don't recommend this Application, the LG product  support is pretty bad.

Name: Stacy Price
Review: This app hasn't worked once!! I cannot stress how useless the app is. My remote start is on and the app says it's off. I can't use the downloaded cycles since it won't remote start. I am disgusted that I spent almost $2000 for this special washer to have the special features non useable!!! SERIOUSLY, the whole point of having a remote start is so that if you forget to start your load you can start it from your phone right? Nope, have to plan on using remote start in advance and turn the machine to that setting and then the machine turns itself off if you don't start it within a certain time frame. So what's the point of remote start?!?! And when is doesn't work even when it's on.....unbelievable

Name: George Diamantopoulos
Review: Fastest crash ever. Won't even show a splash screen.  I would withdraw this app from Google Play and do a complete rewrite. Congrats LG.

It'd also be great to create your own cycles.

Name: A Google user
Review:
I deeply regret I bought an LG washing machine. The app does not even start 
without permissions to read my location, make and manage phone calls, and 
access my photos. I guess it is time to file a GDPR complaint to either 
force LG to comply with the rules or to get their products banned in the 
EU. My mobile phone operator and my location are none of your business, LG. 
And no, you don't need to check for available space before downloading a 
file. You can instead report an error if the download fails.

Name: Eddie H
Review: Figured it out with my washing machine, but the instructions are unclear and vague. I searched online for answers and found nothing until I read the LG support replies to the negative reviews. Here is what I did:  1. Make sure NFC, WiFi, and Bluetooth are all enabled on your phone and your phone is close to the power button of the washing machine.   2. Start the phone app first and have it ready at the waiting to connect screen.   3. Turn on the washing machine and immediately hold the "*Wi-Fi" button for 3 seconds (the WiFi button doesn't work if the machine has been on for a while)   4. The knob of the washing machine should have the checkered glow pattern during this entire process and the red WiFi light symbol should turn on after you held the button.  5. The phone should still be close to the power button of the washer and the phone app should detect the machine pretty quickly. (If it still can't detect it, try using a different phone. My phone detected it but my wife's phone didn't, different Samsung phones)   6. The phone app will then ask you to give your Wi-Fi login information to the Washing machine. Once that is entered, the product will be registered and you can begin  tinkering with the gimmicky features and diagnostic tools.   It's a shame the phone app didn't provide clear instructions. I wasted a lot of time figuring this out, which is why I am leaving a low review score.

I am very disappointed in the quality of work from LG and feel cheated that I purchased the wireless version of the A/C unit.  Unacceptable!

Do not install this app and grant those permissions.

Name: A Google user
Review: Just download this NEW SmartthinQ app to a Samsung Galaxy 5 to use with my new washer/dryer delivered yesterday and its useless. Promoted as 'snart' but its far from it! It won't perform any of the functions that LG promote on the website e.g. remote operation, calendar for tub clean and more importantly will not let you download wash cycles which is partvreason for purchase! There are no features that you can access except for showing you a pointless picture of the appliance! Quality control is needed by the developer as LG are promising something they cannot deliver.  Look at all the other negative reviews, very poor!

Name: Peter George
Review: Have a new Port A/C. Last step takes forever to register then says it has, but no product show up when done. Fix please!  I'm using an Android Pixel.  I see also see no response from any of the poor ratingssl I'm sure this is going absolutely nowhere so at least your consistent with your app. Good work! Especially for a tech company.

Name: A T
Review: Like other users are saying: bring back the Smart Laundry app! I bought a washing machine with the promise of extra functionality, only to have these extra functions taken away within months from the date of purchase! And if I want this back, I have to give you access to all kinds of details of my personal life?! No thank you, LG, this was the last time you got my money! (and yes, I do understand why some functionality - e.g., calling a technician - might require certain permissions; however, you could give users an option to use these functions in the app or not, instead of just bluntly demanding permission for functions we/I don't need) (and who wants to have an app decide which technician to call anyway??)

Name: Lucy Iannotti
Review: Tap On doesn't work so app is useless. Samsung Galaxy 7 phone.   Edit: finally got Tap On to work by taking the cover off my phone and holding the phone in a horizontal position. But, since my washer isn't Wi-Fi enabled, the app is still almost useless.   I can download ONE custom wash setting, but the list you choose from doesn't describe the setting so it's just a guessing game.  And supposedly the app will tell me when it's time to run the drum clean cycle, but in order for it to know that I would have to take off my phone cover and tap my phone again so it can count how many wash cycles we've been through, and I just don't think I'll bother. Much easier just to make a calendar reminder.  The function I really wanted -- knowing how long before the wash is done -- I can't have since this isn't a Wi-Fi machine. Wish I'd known all this before I purchased.

Name: Corneliu Niculite
Review: I was expecting the app to ask permission to access NFC. Instead, it asked for contacts and calls access, gps and storage and media files. I will not give access to this app to these functions. Ever! Reduce the amount of permissions and maybe I will get back to it.

Review: Updated to the new app for my Wine Cellar A.C. unit. Will not connect, extremely disappointed as now I cannot control the temperature. Bring back the old or fix the thing. But the major disappointment was that you can't create your own cycle, just download some really strange ones. With more than 10 cycles already? Useless. But I still hope that LG can improve this one...

Review: I have to sign up for an LG account before I can use it? No thanks.

Name: Martine G. Gibbs
Review: Doesn't work

Name: Diane Roberts
Review: I got a new phone so I had to download this app again and I was shocked to see it only has a 2.3 rating. I love it! I can put my load in the washer when I leave for work but start it remotely later in the day so it's ready for the dryer when I get home. And it will notify me when either unit is done no matter what I am! Great app, one of the reasons we bought these units.

Name: Alan M.
Review: I like that I don't have to log in each time, unlike using the previous app. BUT I don't like its requirement for phone and file system access. We should have a choice of skipping the features that require access. Just as annoying, the new app doesn't run on my Nexus 9 tablet even though the old one did. So much for the convenience of being able to control my LG devices from around my house unless I want to carry my phone wherever I go.

Name: Sarah Rudder
Review: Yep, its complete garbage.   Registered my new W&D set on the LG website, then downloaded the app. Went to log in -- wouldn't accept my login (I tried multiple times). So I made a local account instead. Tried to add both appliances via "Tag on" -- no matter how many times I tried, it wouldn't add either one. Even took the case off my phone. It did recognize the smart diagnosis chime, but that didn't give me access to any of these smart features. Why buy a $700 appliance that gives you everything a $400 one does?

Name: Wayne Lauton
Review: Why in the world does this app need to manage my calls, files, make calls and the like?  It needs access to photos, media and files?  Invade privacy much?  I will not use an app for laundry that is this invasive. If the rating system had negative numbers, that is how I would rate it just based on those factors.  That's ludicrous.

Name: Dan Beach
Review: I just signed up for a US account, although I'm in Canada, reinstalled the app, which I also had to choose USA as country. But this time SUCCESS! I was told that LG doesn't have a Canadian Smart Thing server, so this appears to be a workaround... until they change something else!

Name: CESAR CASTANEDA
Review: This app is very bad. I keep getting a  product registration failure when I try to connect with my air conditioner. Instructions are vague and I tried contacting smart thing Q and I have not received a response. I will not buy LG products any more.

Name: Joan Gibeson
Review: Is a great app when it works. After last update keep getting error message "smart think app failed execution. Try again" with choice to cancel or retry. Please get this problem fixed. Also keeps saying washer/dryer is disconnected when I know it is running and connected. as of 1.11.2019 this app asked to read new privacy and something else updates and agree to it. I did that now I get a screen up that has a ! in a red phone shaped icon and the wording below it is in Chinese. APP now useless.

Name: Eric Waller
Review: The app wants permissions to make phone calls?  Seriously?  Okay, decided to allow it for the sake of testing.  Then the application will not run because the phone is rooted.  I develop code for Android and have my phone rooted for a reason.  I understand why financial won't allow transactions on rooted phones, but can anyone at LG give me a reasonable business case for your laundry application refusing to run because my phone is rooted?  Inane.  Edit:  In response to LG's response.  Specifically, what "law of increased security".  The only laws of which I am aware are those designed to protect my private data.  How does refusal to run on a rooted phone impact this?  More importantly, how does requiring that your application have access to photos, contacts, mail and phone functions in any way support the fantasy that LG invokes these measures for "security".  Please.

Name: Dan Timmer
Review: Tried to connect our brand new top load washer two a few different phones and nothing ever worked. Almost got it to connect once and then it said that there was an error and it erased all the information. Our Wi-Fi connection is great and have no network issues. This is how I know that it is the software's fault. This app is garbage

Name: reg inald
Review: My dishwasher with "smart diagnosis" logo doesn't support "Smart ThinQ" app. This was a selling point when l purchased the dishwasher 3 years ago and it isn't supported now that I need it. I'm very disappointed and will purchase accordingly in the future. The 2.3 start rating for this app should be of concern to LG as it reflects very low customer satisfaction.

Name: Nathan and Shelly Donahoe
Review: This had been favorite part of my new washer and dryer. The latest update removed my appliances and i can't pairing again. pairing process doesn't find anything. So frustrating!

Name: Jen Anderson
Review: Worked somewhat well until I got a new router and had to try to change my network. App gave me no option to do so, so I deleted the appliance and tried to readd it, but the WiFi will not connect to my new network. Can't find any tutorials for this issue. Very disappointing to have a "smart" appliance not smart enough to connect to my WiFi.  Response to LG: My router offers both and I can see the proper network to connect to, I select it, put in the password, hit connect, then on the next screen it says to press the button on the fridge panel for 3 seconds until it flashes, and I do, but it never connects. The WiFi button flashes off and on for a minute or so, and then stops and it never connects.

Name: Peter Shank
Review: Tried new app, doesn't get beyond connecting attempt with wifi flashing. Chatted with tech support but told my phone isn't compatible with the app.

Name: Kevin Vinther
Review: Completely unusable! Demands way too many permissions to install, then quits when it tries to communicate with an apparently nonexistent server. Bring back the old app that worked!

Name: Martin Carmichael
Review: The instructions on registration of washing may could be better, finally was able to register my washing machine and now it works.  What the instructions don't tell what to do.  Follow these instructions and you'll be able to use this app as per the previous version.   To Register product click the 3 dots top right of the screen - press register product - it should ask if your washing machine either has the "smart Thinq logo" or "Tag on logo" - choose which ever you have - I chose "Tag on" as that's what I have - then I followed the instructions on phone to connect.  It would have been a lot better of LG to make registering product as seemed as the previous version.

Name: Cheryl Teasdale
Review: This app does not have half the cycles the previous one had. Upgrades are suppose to improve things not make them poorer. Very disappointing from LG. Please sort this out.

Name: Chris From Canada
Review: Only usable to do new wash load cycle.  Waste of space on my phone.  Almost as bad as the smart diagnostic app

Name: A Google user
Review: Would love to stop wasting time but the app takes so long to load that I waste more time waiting for it to start up. The download via nfc is too finicky which takes more time to upload settings.

Review: Should've left it alone. I can't register my washer with NFC on the new app because when I try it just takes me too the old Smart Laundry app. Please fix. Very dissapointed

Review: So I have an HTC desire 626, and once I opened the app it takes me to these options of either an LG account login or a "simple login" and every time I clicked on either one it takes me to a blank white page that allows me to zoom in out on that white page. So, what's up with the app?

Name: George Lee

Name: Jim Wiedman
Review: Very Disappointed. The old app that worked well has been discontinued and will only open the new app. I can only find one washer function on the new app, and it doesn't seem to have most of the things the old app had. There is more to the privacy policy than to the app itself. This app needs some major UX work.   I do appreciate the response from the developer, but apps shouldn't require documentation, the UI should be designed so it is not needed. I could use the old app without extra instructions.

Name: Dan Eisenhut
Review: Useless.  Requires access to my location, ability to make phone calls, and access to all my store files.   Ummm, no.  It should not need these privileges to let me control my washer via near field.  It will not run at all without these privileges.  No thank you.  Uninstalling...

I.e. you can choose  "overnight dry" or "denim", but until it is loaded to the washer or dryer, the user has no idea what settings that entails (and there's no provision to modify the downloads).

Name: A Google user
Review: What am I missing? I was only able to link my washer and dryer to my phone/app but after that, nothing. Was really looking forward to cool features. Is this app currently being worked on or something? VERY DISAPPOINTING.

Review: It works. It is less intuitive than the old app. Took a while to find all the downloadable options for my washer, then to discover nothing new, except the app is 5.3 times larger in size on my phone.

Name: No No

You need to redesign your app to be able to use the phone WiFi to talk to my washer and send data over the mobile network at the same time

Name: Genny Gibbard
Review: Bought a fancy dancy new dishwasher. Reading the manual, it said there is an app for more features. I thought 'cool!' i download the app and go through the steps to register with NFC... 'Your product is not supported'. What? If you are going to mention the app in the manual, and actually put the tap on function on the product, customers are going to expect the app to do something. LDF5545ST. Top notch sorry though. Got a response almost immediately. When the initial fix still didn't work they tried again  and I can see the additional cycles avail for our machine.

Name: Ivan Dossugi
Review: It initially didnt work on my s7. And the advise on updating webview is correct but missing the fact that if you have chrome installed, this may prevent you from updating / enabling webview. What you need to do is disable chrome, go to playstore and update/enable webview, install smart thinq, then enable chrome again. That made mine work.

Name: Richard Crow
Review: Well, it doesn't recognise my existing LG log in details so had to set up another account. I think it would be useful if these accounts were linked. After setting up additional account it works ok. The app should say that you cannot use your existing account.

Name: Steven Stoner
Review: First off it won't recognize my existing MyLG login credentials.  Since it won't let me log in and presumably access my product registration isn't doing anything for me.  No indication on the fridge that WiFi is active after the initiial blinking.  Didn't really need my fridge to track my location, snoop my contacts and make calls on my behalf.  Deleting app.  May try later.

Name: Loren Truter
Review: Old app worked fine for my air conditioners. New app has a terrible interface and less options than the original. And since the last update with the new app, it doesn't even open! It shows the "Smart ThinQ" opening screen and doesn't go any further. Worst app ever!  UPDATE - uninstalled and re installed the app, got to the page with the "start" button, clicked that and it got stuck on a loading screen, closed and re opened the app and it went back to getting stuck on the main title page. Awful app!  Australia

Name: Adam Bertelsen
Review: Disappointing and useless selection of download cycles for my dishwasher without specifying what they do. For example, what does "Rainy season" washing mean?? What does "kids clothes" do differently than normal 60 degree washing? Most importantly, where is the option of making your own washing cycles!?

Review: This has to be the worst app ever it's completely useless.... it Does not have near as many features as the old app that this one replaced and 90% of the time it never works... Totally useless and worthless

Once I accomplish that after say a 2-3 minutes of struggle the connection is so sensitive that the app gives up after 30% progress each time. The diagnosis I suppose is that the phone moved while the connection was established. LG you'd be better off providing a magnet for sticking my phone. Too difficult for my phone atleast.

Review: I have downloaded, installed, and reinstalled several time and cannot get my refrigerator to register and app to work. I get through all the steps and the product registration fails. I sent an email previously and did not get any reply, so for me this app is useless.

Turns out the company takes away the app without bothering to update its manuals (which still instruct users to dl the Smart Laundry app), and leave us with an app with exactly one cycle choice I don't use. Glad the appliances work, because the app is utterly worthless.

Name: Valeria Kiss-Germain
Review: I HATE this version. I have no idea why they had to change it. The previous version was so much better. I actually loved it and used it all the time. This one is craaaap!

Review: Old app worked just fine. This one just fails to register my air con. Wish I could go back to the old app.

Review: Rubbish app that simply doesnt load on my phone- samsung galaxy s6 since upgrade from lg smart air. 40 degree-plus days here in sydney so great time for the app to go bust...NOT

Name: nigel maunder
Review: Ok, the server for the app is not working correctly, first experience i coulnt login would freeze did standard trouble shooting got it working but told me network was too slow um running gigabit def not network or internet tested 25Mbs finaly got in app and the app told me could not process request due to server issue. Im hoping you patch this fast or alter the app to become a hydra style app using this at its base but using smaller apps as its heads. going from smart ac to this is not a pleasant experience i now have to use a app that wont even turn on my A/C that i paid $120 for the dongle to be able to use and was working until last week on the smart ac app

Name: Yves St-Hilaire
Review: Ask for too many permissions, like access to your sms and contacts. Also ask personal information like date of birth. Way too much intrusive.

Name: Peter Gould
Review: I set up an LG account to register my new washer.  I downloaded an app from the tag on the machine which took me here. This won't let me log onto LG account with my ID and password. Checked and triple checked with no joy.  Sort it please

Name: Tash Hepting
Review: So LG is Blocking root users,  and claiming there is a compliance law forcing them to.  Show me the law,  LG.    Also,  the most recent version of the app is now requesting location access.  Why the hell do you need GPS access on my phone? I'm stuck with the washer and dryer,  but when I remodel the kitchen I'm not buying LG.

Name: Lisa Pellegrini
Review: This app is a waste of time.  It refuses to maintain connection with my Note 4.  Each time I set the settings on it to start my oven with TagOn I have to walk to my stove to reconnect.  What a poor substitute for my previous app.

Review: New update requests far too many permissions. Uninstalling due to privacy concerns. Why does an appliance app need access to contacts?

Review: Was forced to download, app won't recognize my machine.  Old app was just fine.  Bring back old app!

Name: Ricardo A. Cazorla
Review: This is crap I've tried to diagnose my drier 5 times and it never worked always said it did not get anything. It SUCKS and btw why do yo need to connetct to my Facebook or me G+ account this is too intrusive

Name: Kevin Kiejko
Review: Was hoping I could use this app to download a drying cycle to my dryer that wouldn't leave my clothes damp. It registered my washer and dryer fine using NFC, but wouldn't see my phone when I tried to download the new cycle to the dryer. Tried for almost half an hour moving my phone slowly all over the Tag On logo, so I am sure it isn't the NFC location. I wish LG would test their apps thoroughly so I wouldn't have to test out their warranty and return policy.

Name: A Google user
Review: We fail to understand why the app needs so many permissions just to control a washing machine?  Why would LG want to access the camera, microphone, location, contacts and phone?  My mum always said "Do not wash your dirty linen in public", so we are avoiding this app now as given all the permissions we need to grant to it we suspect there is a website somewhere where people can actually watch dirty linen being washed, with live feeds direct from LG washing machine owners!  LG say here they don't collect personal information, then why ask for it?  Even if they don't collect it  and it's just down to lazy programmers, it's a security breach waiting for someone to exploit via the app.  No thanks LG.

Name: Hiep Tran
Review: This program does not add any value to my brand new lg washer and dryer.

Probably some more things, but have no time to play around with that right now - will look for some alternatives to LG and their remote functionality.

Even reminds me to clean machine. I would like a steer on where I can find timings / durations for washes as it's not until starting on machine that I see them. And some are 2hrs. I'd also like it to be easier to activate speedy turbo wash. I can't see where I can start my machine remotely either? Delay start also seems to be delay end time not start.

Name: SantosTrisha Reyes
Review: I am trying to clean my tub on my lg washer and the feature is gone. What the heck happened? The old app worked and gave me the option to clean my tub. I have been reading so many negative reviews but all you guys ask is for our email address to email us I guess, the instructions. Why not just post it on here? Come on now. Why fix something that is not broken? After you guys receive all the negative reviews, why not attempt to fix the app?

Review: The old LG apps is much better and user friendly use. Current apps design was lousy and not user friendly. I had spent like 20minutes to understand the Tub Clean start up from the guide. Previous apps would have the auto kick start tub clean by NFC touch(awesome). Please get the app developer team to enhance this apps.

Name: Jennifer Pritchard
Review: There was only small load for the washer and super dry for the dryer - none of the claimed numerous settings to download by LG. As far as I can tell that's all this app does - no diagnostics at all. It would not recognize my LG account online so I was forced to make a new one. I'm definitely not impressed with this app. Not as advertised at all. I recommend some serious updates on LG's part.

Review: This app replaced Smart Laundry which was not great but had some nice features.  All of the features were removed from the new app, so it has no useful function that I can find.  Perhaps if washer/dryer fails it may help, but thankfully, I have not had that problem yet.

Name: Blake Moore
Review: I have the DLEX5000 and WM5000HV but the app wont pair with the washer dryer. I've followed the installation instructions and everytime the unit shows up on my wifi list suddenly the pair process stops and I get an error message. What's wrong with this app?   NOT A WIFI ENVIRONMENT ISSUE. ERROR MESSAGE APPEARS STATING "The app does not support this product". Why wouldn't your app support your top of the line machines?

Name: Yaroslav Mudryy
Review: Does not work with tablets. Too many questionable permissions. Fix it and I'll update my rating. Dropped starts to 1 because I found that now it is impossible to download cycles to washer our dryer, it just fails every time. Paid so much money for their top of the line washer and dryer and get such a lousy software engineering. Unacceptable.

The washer manual shows how to set up a phone but it's obviously for an LG phone. I'm thinking that I set my phone up correctly as it did connect to the washer. Pretty useless to me.

Review: I was hoping for the best but was expecting the worst, and the worst is what I got. Like everyone else, they pulled the app that worked and force people onto this one. I tried to register my washer, wm5000hva, it returns saying this washing machine isn't supported even though it worked with the old app.... And the dryer, it doesn't even try (dlex5000). LG, you should be ashamed to have your name on this app.

You do not even refer to the user's name in the canned answer of you're supporting the issue, whatever that means? #FAIL

Review: Used LG Smart Laundry until forced to upgrade.  Smart Laundry worked perfectly! Dislike this new ap immensely, and wish I had the choice to use the original ap!

Review: I simply wanted to see if it was time for my tub clean. I can't get that. You have forgotten which products I have. I need to register again, with an app that wants too many permissions. Review: No functionality compared to Smart Laundry.  Can't see any machine statistics like used to be able too.  One download able cycle? Used to be loads.  LG bring back smart laundry!

Review: Forced to upgrade app unable to use old one that worked brilliantly, functions of old app no longer there. LG laundry app worked fine. Default name washer can't change to longer name? I'm all for progress, but this is not it. Let me roll back to old app until this one is actually completely ready for release with all the functions.

Name: Kimberly Smith
Review: Please go back to old app this one will not let me register my washer and dryer set. I used to be able to just pick a setting & Tap my phone to the appliance & it'd start right up. This app is not even worth a star!

However, it works well and I'm able to download new wash cycles for my washer dryer as well as use it as a diagnostic tool.

Review: My number one complaint is the custom Notification box they force on top of other applications. The state of my laundry does not need an obtrusive eyesore that demands interaction. Also, every user input in the application seems to result in a slow, half hearted reaction.

The old app shows as 37.15 MB with only 40 KB of data, for a total of 37.19 MB.

Adds so much functionality to my littlw robot vacuum... Its great!!

Review: I just installed it bc I thought it's awesome that I can check my fridge temp that way. I just got my door in door yesterday and I have a feeling the fridge doesn't get below 8-10 degree Celsius.  I have it set to 1 degree now and before around 3. after 30 hrs running it should be cold. the freezer is. what I don't get why the pics above show that temperature control and such and I only can do is a service check. kinda sucks. so app is kinda useless unless u have a problem

Name: Georgina Green
Review: I can not rate something 2-5 mins.after installing it. I actually need to use it first. So ask me again in a couple days, I should have a rating in mind by then. Thanks for taking time to read this I hope, (Google)üòä

Review: It's decent but doesn't display an option on the application to change from Fahrenheit to Celsius.

Name: Tammy Andrini
Review: Fantastic features

Name: Gordon Rothman
Review: Two months ago I downloaded the old app, which did Smart Diagnosis and worked great. The phone was rebooted in the meantime, and I was so sorry to find this new app. Really, to do ANYTHING I have give you my email and set up a password? No thanks! Bring back the one that worked.

Name: James Sanders
Review: I own an LG washer and dryer. I used the "Tag On" and it says they are not supported. Old application forces you to use this one. Not even 1 year and the features of my washer and dryer are now useless. I should be able to download my cycles and cannot. Thanks LG for forcing us to use unsupported software.

Name: Tina Kalinec
Review: I don't understand this app at all. I can register my washer and dryer, and thats pretty much it. I have to try several times to download a cycle (to which no description is given), though it does load properly when tagging it to the appliance. Also, why does the app need access to my phone, contacts, and location? Shouldn't  it pick up the WiFi? Please make this more user friendly!

Name: Ben Whiting
Review:
Terrible !!!! As alot of people are saying all the permissions required are 
a joke and you can't open it without them. All I want is the old smart 
diagnosis app not some loaded up peice of junk that I have to either create 
a new account for or give access to a social media accout and then give 
basically full access to my phone

Name: Harvey B
Review:
The app handles the request for security permissions poorly, rather than 
disabling just the portions of the app for the denied permissions it just 
aborts itself. No you can not have permissions to identify my device that 
you claim that will only be used if I call customer service, wait until I 
use that feature THEN re-request the permission.

Name: A Google user
Review:
I think this app is too intrusive!! In the terms of agreement your app 
isn't just making sure there's enough space, it states that my pics, files, 
etc are able to be used or shared as your company sees fit. What a waste of 
an app. I just bought my new washer and dryer and was excited for the extra 
features... But at the sake of my privacy being violated... NO THANK YOU!!

Name: Taylor Gonne
Review:
Why do you need an LG ACCOUNT to use an appliance.Why do you need an email 
or Facebook account to use a washer dryer or any other Appliance. This is 
outrageous. Spend thousands of dollars on a new Appliance and be told how 
great and easy it is to use and troubleshoot issues. But only if you allow 
LG access to your location, media files (pictures) and other private 
information. Outrageous! Update: my wife downloaded the app and accepted 
the permissions and it WILL NOT WORK on her Samsung phone. LG responded to 
my first review explaining that the permissions are needed to be sure the 
app is working properly. Completely missing the point that an app that 
connects to a simple house hold appliance dose not needed access to all 
this personal information. I will be returning my new washer and dryer and 
LG CAN GO F*** OFF!

Name: Bene Lang
Review:
Won't work on rooted devices, although my device has to be rooted in order 
to function properly in Europe. It's a shame every single banking app out 
there has compliance and security strategies for rooted devices but the 
f'ing LG application for my washer can't work. Who the hell is in charge at 
LG's development department for an official app having 2.7 stars and major 
issues, my boss would fire me if I do such bad work. Seems the customer is 
irrelevant for LG.

Name: Protected Individual
Review:
Why the F**** does a washing machine app need my location, access to my 
phone book, My birthday just so I can use a dang jeans setting on my new 
washer and dryer. Privacy Act of 1974 protects my rights to privacy. This 
app should be removed from google play until they fix this issue.

Name: Fish Jam
Review: The old app worked perfectly. Now the old app does not work. It would keep track of how many cycles it ran before it needed cleaned. The new app won't even let me run a cleaning cycle. Worse yet, the old app's functionality was intentionally shut off. When you open the old app, it sends you to this one which does not work.

Name: Patrick Sheldon
Review:
An exercise in frustration from start to finish! Pairing a device might 
work once if you are lucky but most times it will just sit there 
indefinatey. App requests tons of permissions (camera, contacts, etc.) 
Honestly I think this is a dataminer disguised as a convenience tool.

Name: Jay Man
Review:
What horrible junk. Trying to link this app with my front load washer and 
dryer but no luck. It asks me to hold my phone to the logo on the appliance 
for nfc connection. Nothing happens. It's like my appliance has the label 
but no nfc is available or turned on. How do I get my appliances loaded 
into this app?

Name: A Google user
Review: App just won't NFC connect to washer.  I have a Galaxy S7 with Android up to date.  I can transfer files to anothrr phone via NFC and can use Amdroid pay at merchants  so I know the technology works.  I have no clue as to what to do and LG phone support hasn't been of any help at all.  I quit.  Uninstall.

Name: Denise Fredianelli
Review: If I could have given it 0 stars I would have.  This app is completely useless.  The previous one was much better.  I liked the other one and used it regularly but this new one,  I deleted.  Why mess with something that was working so well and user friendly to force everyone into this garbage update.

Name: Daniel Sanchez
Review: Screw you LG I can't believe this app is a thing if I have to go tap the oven to start it why not just use the controls there. LG smart oven worked so much better. Think q better blow yourself . Too bad your oleds are amazing or id never buy LG again

Name: A Google user
Review:
I can't believe that for several months corporation like LG can't make 
international smart assistant coverage for its IoT line! Ridiculous! 
Probably last time I mistaken to buy your products, based on false future

Name: A Google user
Review:
Requires way too many permissions. Storage, location and wants to MAKE 
phone calls without my say so.Then registration and login. Intrusive as 
hell. A bit too much just to operate a bloody washing machine... 
Uninstalled immediately.

Name: A Google user
Review:
Like others, I found the found the amount of permissions to be ridiculous. 
Do you want my social security number and bank account logins also? Can't

Name: Mikhail Zvonov
Review:
The app is a hilariously ridiculous. It requires a lot of permissions right 
from the start, then asks you to register! The reason why Google have added 
runtime permissions is to ensure the app asks for them when needed, not 
when developer wants it. Crazy how such company as LG can have this kind of 
app.

Name: Cheryl Holley-Stanton
Review: It would find my WiFi but would only once go further. Also, since I don't have a door in door it doesn't tell me how to make my refrigerator visible.  I had such high hopes!

Name: Diane Bagley
Review: App doesn't work with HTC 10. I used my phone to Android Beam photos to and from phone using NFC so the phone isn't the issue. App won't register washer or dryer so it is either the app, washer or dryer Tag On that has the problem.  Hubby was not pleased when he found out we couldn't use app.

Name: Super SLo
Review:
Too many permissions. States "to get the most out of ... needs access to". 
Apparently should say "to even open the app, needs access to". Don't 
understand why it should fail to even start up if I deny access to manage 
calls or access to location or storage. Give me an error when that 
permission is actually necessary and fails. Uninstalled, annoyed I can't 
even see the advanced smart integration advertised for my appliances.

Name: A Google user
Review: Mandatory upgrade breaks app on rooted phones.  Bought an LG laundry pair last fall and an LG tablet recently.  Not planning on buying any more LG appliances or devices if they put arbitarty blocks on them.  What is this, an appliance monitor app or banking app?

Name: Matthew Smith
Review: There is no situation where any app needs this many permissions to install.  Change it to ask as you choose to use features, or remove unnecessary permission.  I see no reason to share my contacts to manage my appliances.

Name: Michael Wiles
Review: New update is horrible! I don't want to have to create an account just to program my washing machine. The old app didn't require that. You don't need my location, my files or to make phone calls to communicate with my washer. I uninstalled the app and will probably never use it again. You need to come up with a light version that just let's you customize the washer settings.

Name: Trish Dewhurst
Review: Don't know why you changed from the lg smart laundry app. What an absolute load of rubbish use to be able to tap phone on and it started straight away rubbish for the tub clean too. Not worth the one star

Name: Jeff Mitchell
Review: Forced to upgrade from old laundry app. That one was only useful to tell me how many cycles it'd been since the last tub clean. This one doesn't even do that. So they went from nearly useless to totally useless. Good job LG.

Name: Brian C
Review: The previous version had all kinds of neat hints, how to read labels, etc....now it does not let you do that. Nor does it let you use the old app, forcing you to upgrade. LG ... life NOT good.

Review: I am so disappointed with LG. They took away the great tool their clients had with something very confusing which doesn't even work and requires an unnecessary registration. I can't even use a simple diagnosis system for the washing machine that almost caught fire. Well done for losing yet another client! Brilliant!

Name: Noah Larsen
Review: The thing is about this app. It connects to my washer and dryer, but doesn't actually work. Maybe the people you pay money to work on this app, could actually fix it. So I can use this wretched app.

Name: A Google user
Review: Not only does it demand all out access... I have to connect my google or fb-account... I just want to use my effing washing machine.

Review: Intrusive. Wants access to control my phone, photos, etc. All I want is control of my washing machine. LG also disabled the older Smart Laundry app which worked well for me, forcing the update to this app. Not a chance. Very disappointing.

Review:
Useless app unless you get the stuff that actually connects with wifi.

Beware, IoT devices are still in their infancy and should be regarded as a 
potential major security vulnerability. -take it from a systems engineer.

Review:
Bought a new LG dishwasher. Installed the app and it won't even open. Get a

Galaxy S6. Update 4/16/18 - Tried it again thinking they might have updated 
and fixed the problem. Nope. Still won't load, but now I get a message 
saying it doesn't work with rooted phones. Lame.

Review:
App uses highly misleading language about permissions -- and refuses to run

Name: A Google user
Review: Useless. I cannot setup a program in it, just get one of predefined ones. But i can do it using a machine itself! Why do I have to stand near it with a telephone?! I just hoped that this app will give me more control then the stupid machine displey. It gave me nothing at all. Nice.

Name: James Stine
Review: Don't waste your time with this app it does not work at all . It is a shame that LG paid somebody to develop this app , they got took. All it manages to do is frustrate the people who bought LG products. I hope a quality control is better on the product than the app.

Name: A Google user
Review: Downloaded the app on two different phones, run diagnostics and test fails every time.  Seen the rest of the reviews as well...maybe you should test an app to make sure its working well bstore eliminating the prior app that worked fine.

Name: Karmann Y
Review: All I want to do is wash my clothes. The old app let me do just that. This one wants me to log in, use a password and turn over my life story. It's a washing machine not a nuclear missile launcher. And the stupid app doesn't work.

Name: Alex
Review: Absolutely not working. I am unable to register my brand new  aircon unit. All i am getting is an error telling me that my device is different from what is already installed. I have none.

Name: Shane Gagnon
Review: Another "Register with a username & password" crappy app so they can email you spam. I'll pass and use my washing machine the old fashioned way.

Name: Wid Chandra
Review:
Want to blackmail me to demand location? Forget it. I just don't use the 
app any more and forget abt me buying another lg item.

Name: Nevoxia Violet
Review: It was easy to install and open, and quickly register my oven using the "tag on" function with NFC. The app itself loads quickly and navigates smoothly and without issues. However, it immediately seems useless after that. When attempting to operate the oven from the app, it requires that you "tag on" and hit "start" on the oven itself every time you want to use it. If I have to be at the oven every time I want to use the app, what is the point of the app? I have used other apps like this to manage devices in my home, and the entire point is the convenience of not having to be directly in front of the device.  But if the pointlessness of the app wasn't bad enough, it really disappoints with the fact that it only worked the very first time. And every attempt after the successful first attempt resulted in an error where the app claimed that the knob was not in the "tag on" position, although it was.

Name: John Culotta
Review: Good luck getting suckers to allow basically everything on their device to be used at your disposal LG

Name: A Google user
Review: Why can't we have the old app for our washing machines that apparently did work?!!!  This app downloads to your device then NEVER LOADS.  If you can get it to load (I could not) other comments on here I do not doubt.  I do not need an app for a house full of products as I only have an LG washing machine!  PLEASE GIVE US BACK THE OLD WASHING MACHINE APP SO MY MACHINE DOES WHAT I PURCHASED IT FOR, DIAGNOSTICS AND OPTIONS FOR CYCLES.  WHY IS THE OLD APP GONE?  LG PLEASE ANSWER ME AND SO MANY OTHERS!

Name: A Google user
Review: Bought new washer Sept 2016 from lying salesman at Currys. Told had 5yr guarantee. After  registering it was told it was only 2yrs. Tried downloading smart laundry app but was forced onto smart thinq. LG then want permissions to data mine all my personal info whilst providing an app that doesn't work. Decline all requests and uninstall this piece of rubbish, I have. LG never again

Name: Kevin LeMay
Review:
You should not advertise this as a feature for your products if it won't 
even work. Probably going to take the washer back now just because I feel 
duped.

Name: Andrew Sumowski
Review: Why do I have to turning on remote start everytime i use the washer or dryer.  Should just stay on.  Also this should work with ifttt.  I added the lg washer and dryer on ifttt but it says no option.  Looks like LG decided to disable ifttt for last year's models to encourage the new models.

Name: A Google user
Review: Downloaded the app and attempted to login. Emphasis on "attempted" because I still haven't been able to login. Tried chatting online with my computer with somebody who did not have a single clue. They were talking about a totally different issue that I wasn't even on the same planet. Total fail LG!

Name: David Bowring
Review: Why does an app for my washing machine need access to my location, calls and file storage? I'm not prepared to grant them so here's another one star review.

Name: Andri Mahegan
Review: I have a washer/dryer that both have the "tag on" function and when I went to use the nfc function on the washer, it redirected me to a google play link that didnt work. Come to find out, the lg smart washer and dw app that is supposed to download when you connect it with nfc isn't available in my country (the us). Now it wants me to install the lg thinq app that my washer/dryer doesn't support. Why does this exist?!

Name: Susan Csaszar
Review:
Older model unit. Doesn't connect to new software. Spent too much time 
reregistering and reregistering the thing. AC doesnt cool. Tried the 
diagnositucs app but same result dumb app

Name: A Google user
Review: what the heck... they said they dont collect information. then why they TOO MANY QUESTIONS. WHY.. THESE APP REALLY SUCKS. consistently they reply to the complaint but they dont do much.. LG.. DONT YOU GET IT.. TOO WAY INTRUSIVE. Cant you see all reviews.. too many permissions. too intrusive.. these was just a simple app why ask for more

Name: Chong Yee Ong
Review: Seriously, you want to know my location, phone contacts and access to my phone photos and media.. Is this a diagnostic tool or social engineering? :)

Name: David Pressnall
Review: Way too many permissions!  Why does it needs access to my personal pictures! Why does ti need to make phone calls! It sounds like a trojan! This is a data mining pos!

Name: Sam G
Review: The app is a gigantic space hog for what it does.  It also takes 10x as long as it should to start up.  The downloadable cycles for my washing machine and dryer seem to just set the spin speed, wash temp, and mode dial to different presets. I can literally do that before the app has finished loading.  This app is basically a how-to manual for making a slow, ugly, unintuitive Android application. Two stars because it connects and functions as intended, I guess. It's just the intentions don't seem to be the right ones.

Name: Paul Marchand
Review:
Forced to upgrade to this app, but this app will not run on a routed device 
so it is useless to me. Why would the developers care if you have a routed 
mobile phone or not! Bad programming!

Name: Tyler M
Review: This should just be a simple local app to notify me if my laundry is done. Or maybe some presets for washing and drying clothes. But I will never know.  Too obtrusive with permissions to access calling, location, date of birth, storage access, etc. This is before even opening to test if my washer and dryer would actually sync. Given the reviews, I have my doubts.   Read the privacy statement guys. Seems LG made this app just to generate revenue from selling data mined from your use and information.

Name: A Google user
Review:
I fail to understand why my so much personal information is required to 
activate this app. More than needed to register my LG appliances. I deleted 
the app so I cannot comment on it's functionality. Bottom line, I don't 
trust LG with my personal information. RESPONSE: Thank you for your reply. 
I understand phone permissions needed for your app to function. My 
objection is to being required to give LG my birthday - that's way to 
intrusive for me, and many others, I expect.

Name: William Melville
Review: This app should not need access to everything on my phone to tell me how much longer my laundry has to go. Photos, contacts, my SD card?  This is a joke.

Name: Jass Lim
Review: Now my washing machine is been lock. I don't ever can use the smart diagnosis.  Pls advise!

Name: David Dione
Review:
The air conditioner I bought is great. 18k btu Dual Inverter. Very quiet. 
This app is horrible. Would not connect after many, many attempts. Lists AC 
as powered off. De-installed.

Name: Deni Ristevski
Review: I'm very tech savvy and not only followed all of LGs instruction but troubleshooted all over the web, LGs website, and the comments in these review. Couldn't get my new fridge to connect, and to the LG rep who is copying and posting generic responses to people's elaborate questions. Go to hell! You don't deserve a job.

Name: Bill S
Review:
This app needs to link automatically and seamlessly to other related 
software (MyLG account, MyLG app, SmartTV, GoogleAssistant, Alexa, etc). 
Creating those links is cumbersome if not impossible. Plus it's a huge app. 
Currently it's not worth keeping.

Name: Tom Wilfong
Review:
Asking for crazy permissions... Why do you need to access my media a d be 
able to make phone calls? I tried anyway and it kept telling me I did not 
meet age minimum. I'm a grown ass man! Dump the app!

Name: A Google user
Review: I paid a lot of money for my "smart" washer, but LG's app doesn't comprehensively do what LG advertised it would. Get it together, LG, or stop telling customers your appliances and apps can do things they can't reliably do yet. How is it that a company as big as LG can have a current app with so many bad reviews and little resolution in the responses? All these customers who paid hundreds or thousands of dollars for what LG advertised as "smart" appliances, and LG just isn't providing them with the functionality they bought and paid for.

Name: A Google user
Review:
LG ThinQ doesn't work. Registered multiple times to integrate with Google 
Home and it never was able to link up despite saying it was linked. Finally 
just slapped a Chromecast Ultra on it to make it work.

Name: Candle Jack
Review: Smart diagnosis just doesn't work. It either fails, or says it can't determine the problem with my drier.

Name: Craig Nixon
Review: Just read the privacy policy all the way through; by using the app, you consent to YOUR data being shared with anyone, "without limitation", including nations without data protection laws. You also agree to them collecting and sharing information from your mobile or tablet, including pictures, voice, email and contact info. LG are having a laugh. Steer well clear.

Name: Paulina Pyrzyk
Review: The company invests in fancy tools but treats clients bad. I was waiting for few months for LG Polska to look into problem with the washing machine and few more to repair it. Imagine the cost with a 2 year old on the board ! Not even a sorry from Lg Polska. Lame

Name: Raymond Chiu
Review: It respond slow. It disconnect unexpectedly. After app reinstall, it cannot pairing again.  If it is stable, slow response is acceptable as a trade-off for remote control over internet, but it don't.

Name: Karl Milton
Review: Won't even open. Throws some -1000 error. Too bad. Nice idea, but the app won't even load. 100k downloads, and 100k uninstalls

Name: David Carter
Review:
I am not going to allow this app to make phone calls so I uninstalled it. 
Security is important to users but not apparently to LG. Do you really 
expect me to open my phone up to a possible hack to make premium rate phone 
calls?

Name: Cassandra Maher
Review: App recognized dryer but could never connect to it or diagnosis because app said it couldn't connect to internet. WiFi is working perfect as I am watching Netflix right now. Horrible app!!!

Name: Heather Dickens
Review: Was forced to install this app. Then wouldn't work unless I gave it permission to make calls etc. Then told me the country was wrong so I had to make a new account but wouldn't let me make a new account since my email is already in use! Not at all impressed with it LG. Needless to say I deleted the app!

Name: KB C
Review:
Absolutely worthless app. My LG washer and dryer and dryer do not have 
internet conductivity. Deceptive advertising indicating a cell phone and 
tap here location however all this does is transfer information from the 
appliance to the phone. The units themselves do not have any Wi-Fi 
connectivity. Another thing that I don't like about this is you have to 
give it access to a lot of your personal information which is really 
totally unnecessary other than for their marketing purposes. Uninstalled. I 
certainly would be in on a class action suit for their false advertising.

Name: Craig Fink
Review:
App say "cannot run on rooted device" then quits. My device is not rooted. 
App is broken

Name: Joho
Review: What a terrible app.  Social media authentication doesn't even work properly.  Buggy and slow.

Name: Daniel Friend
Review: The app would not let me log in. I used the same credentials that work on LG's website, and it insists they're wrong. The app is therefore completely unusable.

Name: Jacqueline Balog
Review:
Connected wifi extender. Followed instructions, machine never connected. 
Totally useless.

Name: Etre
Review: Why does this app needs to make calls ? This is absurd !   One of the reasons I bought a washing machine from LG, was because of the "smart" functions.   Now ... since smart is useless, I might go to LG's local headquarters and ask for a discount or refund.

Name: Henrik Hermansen
Review:
Got the app because LG website said I could add my TV here to link it to 
Google assistant. When I pressed + there was no option in the list to add a

wrong information is not ok.

Name: Dan R
